[subroutine] The Runner cannot break any subroutines on the next piece of ice he or she encounters during this run.
[subroutine] The Runner cannot jack out until after encountering the next piece of ice during this run.
data.title: Inazuma

data.text: When the Runner encounters Komainu, it gains "[subroutine] Do 1 net damage." for each card in the Runner's grip for the remainder of this run.
data.title: Komainu

data.flavor: Yip Yip!
data.text:
[subroutine] Do 1 net damage unless the Runner pays 1[credit].
[subroutine] Do 1 net damage unless the Runner pays 1[credit].
data.title: Pup

data.flavor: When locked in a fortress in your own mind, be careful what door you open.
data.text:
[subroutine] Look at the top 3 cards of R&D and arrange them in any order.
[subroutine] The Runner accesses the top card of R&D unless the Corp pays 1[credit].
data.title: Shiro

data.flavor: Certain areas of cyberspace are dominated by a single digital entity. Runners call them 'gods', and only a miracle can save those foolish enough to enter their domain.
data.text: [subroutine] If not already running on Archives, the Runner is now running on Archives instead of passing Susanoo-no-Mikoto. The Runner cannot jack out until after he or she encounters a piece of ice.
data.title: Susanoo-no-Mikoto

data.flavor: It is difficult to go to Japan without ending up in the sprawl of NeoTokyo.
data.text: The first time an advancement token is a placed on a card in this server each turn, gain 1[credit]. Limit 1 region per server.
data.title: NeoTokyo Grid

data.flavor: Known as the Red Woman, Hanzō is notorious for her ruthless methods of server protection.
data.text: The first time you would do any amount of net damage during each run on this server, instead you may pay 2[credit] to do 1 brain damage.
data.title: Tori Hanzō

data.text:
Plan B can be advanced.
If the Runner accesses Plan B, you may reveal and score an agenda from HQ with an advancement requirement equal to or less than the number of advancement tokens on Plan B.
data.title: Plan B

data.flavor: Out of the corner of his vision, a flash of light. He felt a thud as his grip on cyberspace loosened. Spider didn't like this. He should have bypassed the outer layer of ice by jacking in from the internal server. Another thud, and his whole frame shook with the resounding shockwave. He desperately reached for his shuriken…
data.text:
Guard cannot be bypassed.
[subroutine] End the run.
data.title: Guard

data.flavor: The annual review of ice as published by the NSCA consistently gives top marks to the ice that provide the most impact in relation to their size and upkeep cost. Critics of the NSCA point to the bounce ratio as the most important stat when judging ice.
data.text: [subroutine] End the run.
data.title: Rainbow

data.flavor: YucaBean has seen astounding growth in even the most remote markets.
data.text: Gain 1[credit] for each remote server with a card installed in it.
data.title: Diversified Portfolio

data.flavor: The longer the employees didn't look at the Doomsday Clock, the more it gnawed at the back of their minds. A quick look only reinforced what they already knew: there wasn't enough time.
data.text: Search R&D for an agenda, reveal it, and add it to HQ. Shuffle R&D.
data.title: Fast Track

data.flavor: "Truth is a fickle mistress."
data.text: When your turn begins, gain 2[credit] if the Corp has more scored agenda points than you.
data.title: Iain Stirling: Retired Spook

data.flavor: "Try to keep up."
data.text: The first time you play a run event each turn, gain 1[credit].
data.title: Ken "Express" Tenma: Disappeared Clone

data.flavor: "Don't waste my time."
data.text: The first time you make a successful run on HQ each turn, you may expose 1 card.
data.title: Silhouette: Stealth Operative

data.flavor: A job is only as strong as the weakest link. Thankfully Ms. Jones is always on time.
data.text: Gain 1[credit] for each installed connection resource.
data.title: Calling in Favors

data.flavor: Tenma clones are excellent at multitasking, their brains custom-made for parallel processing.
data.text:
Play only as your first click.
Make a run and gain [click].
data.title: Early Bird

data.flavor: The clone was surprised to see the red-jacketed man. It was like looking in a mirror, only the mirror made him look…cool. Confident. Individual.
data.text: Look at the top 4 cards of your stack and add 1 of those cards to your grip. Shuffle your stack.
data.title: Express Delivery

data.flavor: Stirling entered the server, passing a growling piece of ice. He was unarmed…or so it seemed.
data.text: Make a run on HQ. Bypass the first 2 pieces of ice encountered during this run. If successful, you cannot access any cards.
data.title: Feint

data.flavor: "I work by referral only, with an up-front fee. The fee is reasonable if you value results." -Silhouette
data.text: Make a run on HQ. If successful, access 2 additional cards from HQ.
data.title: Legwork

data.text: As an additional cost to play this event, spend [click]. Search your stack for a run event and play that run event (paying its play cost), ignoring any additional costs. Shuffle your stack.
data.title: Planned Assault

data.text: +1[mu] Your maximum hand size is increased by 1. Whenever the Corp scores an agenda, you may search your stack for a card and add it to your grip. Shuffle your stack. Limit 1 console per player.
data.title: Logos

data.flavor: Express loved libraries. The consoles were weak, but the security even weaker. He wirelessly loaded up his personal blend of code and started cloning the drive. In just a few minutes, another zombie would claw its way to the surface of cyberspace.
data.text: 1[recurring-credit] Use this credit to play run events.
data.title: Public Terminal

data.text: Use Unregistered S&W '35 only if you have made a successful run on HQ this turn. [click], [click]: Trash 1 rezzed bioroid, clone, executive, or sysop in a server without paying its trash cost.
data.title: Unregistered S&W '35

data.flavor: The grass looked greener on the other side of the tear. But it always did, and there was always another tear.
data.text: [click]: Draw 1 card from the bottom of your stack.
data.title: Window

data.flavor: Appearances are easy to change in cyberspace, but a high-quality render is not easy to mimic.
data.text: 1[credit]: Break sentry subroutine. 2[credit]: +3 strength. Alias cannot be used on ice protecting a remote server.
data.title: Alias

data.text: 2[credit]: Break up to 3 barrier subroutines. 2[credit]: +4 strength. Breach cannot be used on ice protecting a remote server.
data.title: Breach

data.flavor: The digital equivalent of a fly on the wall.
data.text:
Install only if you made a successful run on HQ this turn.
Whenever the Corp draws a card, you may pay 2[credit] to reveal that card.
data.title: Bug

data.flavor: Catch me if you can!
data.text: 1[credit]: Break tracer subroutine. 2[credit]: +3 strength.
data.title: Gingerbread

data.flavor: If speed is of the essence, an indirect encounter with a piece of ice is usually best.
data.text: [trash]: Break all but 1 subroutine on a piece of ice.
data.title: Grappling Hook

data.flavor: Nothing is secure when you have the right documentation.
data.text: 1[credit]: Break code gate subroutine. 2[credit]: +2 strength. Passport cannot be used on ice protecting a remote server.
data.title: Passport

data.text: Secretly spend any number of credits. The Corp guesses if you spent an even or odd amount. Reveal spent credits. If the Corp guessed incorrectly, gain credits equal to twice the amount spent.
data.title: Push Your Luck

data.flavor: She was as good as Mr. Li said. The source machine had been compromised in under 24 hours. If a freelance operative could do that, the server clearly wasn't ready to endure Gagarin's legion of corp-owned runners.
data.text:
When your turn begins, you may choose a server. The first time you make a successful run on that server this turn, instead of accessing cards, gain 2[credit].
<errata>Errata from FAQ 4.0</errata>
data.title: Security Testing

data.flavor: "Why is a raven like a typing desk?"
data.text:
When you install Theophilius Bagbiter, lose all credits in your credit pool.
Your maximum hand size is equal to the number of credits in your credit pool.
data.title: Theophilius Bagbiter

data.flavor:
She slipped back onto her hopper. "I'm your family now, so don't twist me, dǒng ma?"
He flicked the e-cig away from his mouth, and nodded. What had he gotten himself into?
data.text:
You cannot use Tri-maf Contact more than once per turn.
[click]: Gain 2[credit].
When Tri-maf Contact is trashed, suffer 3 meat damage.
data.title: Tri-maf Contact

data.flavor: "Welcome to the mass install wizard! This wizard will guide you through the process of installing a whole mess of programs onto your almost-certainly inadequate rig. When you're ready to continue, say-oops, too late, here we go!"
data.text: Install up to 3 programs from your grip (paying the install costs).
data.title: Mass Install

data.flavor: One of the core problems of quantum computing is isolating the system from external factors to prevent decoherence. The Q-Coherence Chip is one, imperfect, solution.
data.text:
+1[mu]
Trash Q-Coherence Chip when an installed program is trashed.
<errata>Errata from FAQ 3.0.1</errata>
data.title: Q-Coherence Chip

data.text: Place 1 power counter on Overmind when it is installed for each unused MU. Hosted power counter: Break ice subroutine. 1[credit]: +1 strength.
data.title: Overmind

data.flavor: "The best place to hide is in plain sight, don't you think?"
data.text:
You cannot use Oracle May more than once per turn.
[click]: Name a card type. Reveal the top card of your stack. If the revealed card is of the named type, draw it and gain 2[credit]. Otherwise, trash it.
data.title: Oracle May

data.flavor: You can find Donut in the park on Thursday afternoons, playing backgammon. You want his attention, the price is always the same: a cup of coffee and a donut. That buys you a seat at the backgammon table, and you have until he beats you to talk business and set the price.
data.text: The play cost of operations and events is increased by 1.
data.title: Donut Taganes

data.text:
[click],[click],[click]: Place 1 agenda counter on Domestic Sleepers.
Domestic Sleepers is worth 1 agenda point while it has at least 1 agenda counter on it.
data.title: Domestic Sleepers

data.flavor: The networking capabilities of the NEXT suite of ice are unparalleled.
data.text: NEXT Silver gains "[subroutine] End the run." for each rezzed piece of NEXT ice.
data.title: NEXT Silver

data.flavor: "Chi resonance mapping has created a whole new field of network security. It is unassailable perfection." -Akitaro Watanabe
data.text:
The strength of Lotus Field cannot be lowered.
[subroutine] End the run.
data.title: Lotus Field

data.text:
As an additional cost to play this operation, trash a rezzed piece of ice.
Reveal cards from the top of R&D until you reveal a piece of ice. Install and rez that ice in the same position as the ice that was trashed, ignoring all costs. Shuffle R&D.
data.title: Mutate

data.flavor: Only the News You Need.
data.text: The first time you create a server each turn, draw 1 card.
data.title: Near-Earth Hub: Broadcast Center

data.flavor: Works better than a PAD hooked up to a tinfoil umbrella and coffee can.
data.text:
3[recurring-credit]
Use these credits during traces.
data.title: Primary Transmission Dish

data.flavor: Halfway upstalk, Midway is a destination unto itself with its microgravity hotels and fine dining options.
data.text: The Runner must pay 1[credit] as an additional cost each time he or she uses an icebreaker to break at least 1 subroutine during a run on this server. Limit 1 region per server.
data.title: Midway Station Grid

data.flavor: They said it couldn't be built. That it was a fantasy. That Jack Weyland was a fool, and he had bought the fools in Washington too. But year after year the buckyweave grew, and 'they' stopped talking.
data.text:
3[recurring-credit]
Use these credits to advance, install, and rez cards.
data.title: The Root

data.flavor: Taurus promised strength, but gave only rage.
data.text: [subroutine] <trace>Trace 2</trace> If successful, trash 1 piece of hardware. If your trace strength is 5 or greater, trash 1 piece of hardware.
data.title: Taurus

data.flavor: On the first day She breathed data into the void, and it hung suspended like jewelled stars. On the second day She spoke order into the data, and it flowed from rivulets into streams and from streams into mighty rivers. On the third day She gave independence to the order, and it ebbed and flowed according to its own accord. -The Cant of Helios
data.text:
Mother Goddess gains the subtypes of all other rezzed ice.
[subroutine] End the run.
data.title: Mother Goddess

data.flavor: He who bears the shield of honor.
data.text: When the Runner encounters Galahad, you may reveal up to 2 grail ice from HQ. For the remainder of this run, Galahad gains the subroutines of the revealed ice in the order of your choice. [subroutine] End the run.
data.title: Galahad

data.flavor: Known as malware 0-394-41525-6 to sysops, runners just refer to it as "bad times."
data.text:
Play only if the Runner is tagged.
The Runner's memory limit is reduced by 2 until the end of the turn.
data.title: Bad Times

data.text:
Play only as your first [click].
Choose a server. The Corp can rez a piece of ice protecting this server. If he or she does not, make a run on that server, during which the Corp cannot rez ice.
data.title: Cyber Threat

data.text:
Whenever you make a successful run on HQ, the Corp loses 1[credit].
Trash Lamprey if the Corp purges virus counters.
data.title: Lamprey

data.flavor: His eyes were beginning to blur, as he duplicated the credentials for what seemed like the fiftieth time. Perhaps a genetic refit would have been easier.
data.text:
Play only as your first [click].
Remove all tags.
data.title: Paper Tripping

data.flavor: "Public network kiosks, vending machines-there's all sorts of poorly-secured power sources in the city. Tap in to one of these and you've got plenty of juice when you need it. A little advance warning when the power grid starts misbehaving, too." -Gabriel Santiago
data.text: Gain 1[credit] whenever a trace is initiated.
data.title: Power Tap

data.text: Whenever you encounter a piece of ice that was just rezzed, lose all credits in your credit pool. Gain credits equal to the rez cost of that ice.
data.title: Nasir Meidan: Cyber Explorer

data.text:
Play only as your first [click].
Choose an unrezzed piece of ice. If the Corp rezzes that piece of ice this turn, gain credits equal to its rez cost.
data.title: Social Engineering

data.flavor: "I once saw someone running a seven-tier nested daemon tree. Not for any good reason, just to see if he could. Well, of course the root daemon crashed and he lost everything. I wonder what he's up to now?" -Kate "Mac" McCaffrey
data.text: Leprechaun can host up to 2 programs. The memory costs of hosted programs do not count against your memory limit.
data.title: Leprechaun

data.text:
Whenever you make a successful run on R&D, instead of accessing cards, you may install Eden Shard from your grip, ignoring all costs.
[trash]: The Corp draws 2 cards.
Limit 1 per deck.
data.title: Eden Shard

data.text: The first time you rez a piece of ice each turn, you may search R&D for another copy of that ice, reveal it, and add it to HQ. Shuffle R&D.
data.title: The Foundry: Refining the Process

data.text: This card is not trashed until another current is played or an agenda is stolen. As an additional cost to make the first run not made through a card ability on his or her turn, the Runner must spend [click].
data.title: Enhanced Login Protocol

data.flavor: "There are many advantages to having facilities on the moon. Less traffic, for example." -Director Hass
data.text: If the Runner loses or spends a click during a run on this server, he or she loses all credits in his or her credit pool. Limit 1 region per server.
data.title: Heinlein Grid

data.flavor: "Binary computing is obsolete. I use a base-4 structure for this system; it's modeled on our DNA. Well, my DNA, anyway." -Doctor Endo, Jinteki researcher
data.text: All code gate ice have +1 strength. When you score Encrypted Portals, gain 1[credit] for each rezzed code gate.
data.title: Encrypted Portals

data.flavor: Her eyes were the color of a vidscreen, tuned to a dead channel.
data.text: This card is not trashed until another current is played or an agenda is stolen. The Runner's identity text box is blank.
data.title: Cerebral Static

data.text: This card is not trashed until another current is played or an agenda is stolen. Name a card. Gain 10[credit] whenever the Runner plays or installs a copy of that card.
data.title: Targeted Marketing

data.flavor: Throw enough data at a runner and it ceases to have any meaning at all.
data.text:
When the Runner encounters Information Overload, <trace>trace 1</trace> if the trace is successful, give the Runner 1 tag.
Information Overload gains "[subroutine] The Runner trashes 1 of his or her installed cards." for each tag the Runner has.
data.title: Information Overload

data.text: This card is not trashed until another current is played or an agenda is stolen. Gain 1[credit] whenever the Runner makes a successful run.
data.title: Paywall Implementation

data.flavor: Nothing is impenetrable. The key is to make breaking into it more costly than what it's worth.
data.text:
1[credit]: Move any number of credits from your credit pool to Sealed Vault.
[click] or [trash]: Move any number of credits from Sealed Vault to your credit pool.
data.title: Sealed Vault

data.text:
Ignore the install cost of the first piece of ice you install each turn.
Limit 1 per deck.
data.title: Eden Fragment

data.flavor: "I don't care how good your console is, or how tricked out your rig is. The lag time on a run on the moon from earthside can be a killer." -Leela Patel
data.text: This operation is not trashed until another current is played or an agenda is stolen. All ice have +1 strength.
data.title: Lag Time

data.text: Whenever there is a successful run on this server, you may trash Will-o'-the-Wisp. If you do, choose an icebreaker that was used to break at least 1 subroutine during this run. The Runner adds that icebreaker to the bottom of his or her stack.
data.title: Will-o'-the-Wisp

data.flavor: Sometimes a single stone is enough.
data.text: Place 3 power counters on D4v1d when it is installed. Hosted power counter: Break ice subroutine on a piece of ice that has a strength of 5 or greater.
data.title: D4v1d

data.text: This card is not trashed until another current is played or an agenda is scored. The first piece of ice encountered each turn has -2 strength for the remainder of the run.
data.title: Scrubbed

data.flavor: In this business, you had to anticipate. If you weren't three steps ahead, you were three steps behind.
data.text:
Play only as your first [click].
When this turn ends, gain 2[credit] for each successful run you made during it.
data.title: Three Steps Ahead

data.flavor: What goes up must always go down.
data.text: This card is not trashed until another current is played or an agenda is scored. The Corp cannot install more than 1 piece of ice each turn.
data.title: Unscheduled Maintenance

data.flavor: "People keep saying that 'Cash is king' in the business, like it's untraceable in the days of DNA sniffers and microtracers. Digital credits can be just as anonymous, and they're just as easy to counterfeit." -Silhouette
data.text: Place 3 virus counters on Cache when it is installed. Hosted virus counter: Gain 1[credit].
data.title: Cache

data.flavor: Fifteen seconds of fame.
data.text: This card is not trashed until another current is played or an agenda is scored. 1[recurring-credit] Use this credit during a run.
data.title: Net Celebrity

data.flavor: Originally not very popular, the regulator was overlooked by those who used energy sinks to protect their rig. But it quickly found an audience once Smoke casted a run on a Blue Sun server, using it to keep her rig online while repeatedly diverting energy spikes in excess of 50,000 volts.
data.text: 3[credit] or [trash]: Prevent an installed piece of hardware from being trashed.
data.title: LLDS Energy Regulator

data.flavor: In the spaces between the data, do trapped souls from the past persist?
data.text:
Place 3[credit] on Ghost Runner when it is installed. When there are no credits left on Ghost Runner, trash it.
You can use the credits on Ghost Runner during a run.
data.title: Ghost Runner

data.flavor: Created by merging the brainscans of over a hundred of the most intelligent people in Haas-Bioroid's cerebral database, its effectiveness is limited beither by its lack of imagination or the imagination of the sysops who employ it.
data.text:
The rez cost of IQ is increased by 1 for each card in HQ.
IQ has +1 strength for each card in HQ.
[subroutine] End the run.
data.title: IQ

data.flavor: Eliza's Toybox is the preeminent purveyor of high-class debauchery on the moon, courtesy of its bioroid pleasure models and other exotica. Every fantasy has its price.
data.text: [click],[click],[click]: Rez a card, ignoring all costs.
data.title: Eliza's Toybox

data.flavor: There are those who believe the nine-tailed fox is an angel in disguise. And then there are those who have followed, and discovered her secret...
data.text: [subroutine] The Corp may choose a card in HQ. The Runner accesses that card. If he or she does, trash Kitsune.
data.title: Kitsune

data.flavor: The port was first built as a remote location to unload and offload dangerous felons.
data.text: The Runner cannot jack out while running on this server unless he or she trashes 1 installed program. Limit 1 region per server.
data.title: Port Anson Grid

data.flavor: "There are reports of a terrorist threat at Starport Kaguya. The NAPD is offering a reward for anyone who can provide them with information about the current whereabouts of the individual pictured here. He is considered extremely dangerous and is armed with a PAD and a portable rig."
data.text: The Runner cannot play current events.
data.title: The News Now Hour

data.text: This card is not trashed until another current is played or an agenda is stolen. The first time the Runner makes a successful run each turn, trace 2 if successful, give the Runner 1 tag.
data.title: Manhunt

data.text: Wendigo can be advanced. While Wendigo has an odd number of advancement tokens on it, it gains barrier and loses code gate. [subroutine] Choose a program. The Runner cannot use the chosen program for the remainder of this run.
data.title: Wendigo

data.flavor: Mars would never have been colonized if not for the Gargarin facilities at Promontorium Agarum.
data.text: Successful runs against this server are not considered to be successful or unsuccessful for the purposes of card abilities. Limit 1 region per server.
data.title: Crisium Grid

data.flavor: The irony is that those who'd want to destroy certain memories can't afford to do so, and those who can afford it-well, they're too busy sipping on dreamwine.
data.text: When you score Chronos Project, the Runner removes all cards in his or her heap from the game.
data.title: Chronos Project

data.text:
Shattered Remains can be advanced.
If you pay 1[credit] when the Runner accesses Shattered Remains, trash 1 piece of hardware for each advancement token on Shattered Remains.
data.title: Shattered Remains

data.flavor: He who wields the sword of valor.
data.text: When the Runner encounters Lancelot, you may reveal up to 2 grail ice from HQ. For the remainder of this run, Lancelot gains the subroutines of the revealed ice in the order of your choice. [subroutine] Trash 1 program.
data.title: Lancelot

data.flavor: "Why should we be slaves to our genetic heritage?"
data.text: Once per turn, break 1 barrier subroutine.
data.title: Quetzal: Free Spirit

data.flavor: Bad luck for any sysop blind enough to cross its path.
data.text: 1[credit]: Break 1 barrier subroutine (or up to 3 subroutines if you spent a credit from a stealth card). 2[credit]: +1 strength (or +2 strength if you spent at least 1 credit from a stealth card).
data.title: BlacKat

data.flavor: Carved directly out of the lunar rock, Duggar's is a popular spot among blue-collar loonies and slumming risties. A place where you could find what you're looking for-if you knew who to look for, and didn't get distracted by the energetic dancers.
data.text: [click],[click],[click],[click]: Draw 10 cards.
data.title: Duggar's

data.text: +2[mu] Your maximum hand size is increased by 2. Limit 1 console per player.
data.title: Box-E

data.flavor: "I can get you anything, and guarantee the best prices in town."
data.text:
[click]: Host a resource or piece of hardware from your grip on The Supplier.
When your turn begins, you may install a hosted card, lowering the install cost by 2.
data.title: The Supplier

data.flavor: "If you look like you belong, people will ignore you for hours. Or years. It's only when you don't fit in that things start to go wrong." -Exile
data.text: 1[credit]: Break code gate subroutine. 1[credit]: +3 strength. Use this ability only by spending a credit from a stealth card.
data.title: Refractor

data.flavor: There have been several attempts to create a "world church," uniting all human faiths into a single, harmonious whole. The irony, of course, is that each new "world church" is another schism in humanity's shared religious experience.
data.text: The first time you have no credits in your credit pool each turn, gain 1[credit].
data.title: Order of Sol

data.text:
Whenever you make a successful run on Archives, instead of accessing cards, you may install Hades Shard from your grip, ignoring all costs.
[trash]: Access all cards in Archives.
Limit 1 per deck.
data.title: Hades Shard

data.flavor:
"This is Rachel Beckman. She's in the business of keeping people alive."
Rachel smiled. "Only when I'm not in the business of killing them."
data.text:
You have 1 additional [click] to spend during your turn.
Trash Rachel Beckman if you are tagged.
<errata>Errata from FAQ 3.1</errata>
data.title: Rachel Beckman

data.flavor: <champion>Designed by 2012 World Champion Jeremy Zwirn</champion>
data.text:
Architect cannot be trashed while installed.
[subroutine] The Corp looks at the top 5 cards of R&D and may install 1 of those cards, ignoring all install costs.
[subroutine] The Corp may install a card from Archives or HQ (paying all costs).
data.title: Architect

data.flavor: "Servers fully-armed and operational."
data.text: Gain 1[credit] for each rezzed piece of ice.
data.title: Peak Efficiency

data.text: Place 2 power counters on Labyrinthine Servers when you score it. Hosted power counter: Prevent the Runner from jacking out. The Runner cannot jack out for the remainder of this run.
data.title: Labyrinthine Servers

data.flavor: The way past is to go a different way.
data.text: Ashigaru gains "[subroutine] End the run." for each card in HQ.
data.title: Ashigaru

data.text: Hosted power counter: Do 1 net damage. Use this ability only during a run. [subroutine] Do 1 net damage. [subroutine] You and the Runner secretly spend 0[credit], 1[credit], or 2[credit]. Reveal spent credits. If you and the Runner spent a different number of credits, place 1 power counter on Mamba.
data.title: Mamba

data.flavor: Making a name for yourself has its perks. But it also makes you a target.
data.text:
Reversed Accounts can be advanced.
[click], [trash]: The Runner loses 4[credit] for each advancement token on Reversed Accounts.
data.title: Reversed Accounts

data.flavor: "It's a small one-time fee, apparently. Only I've paid it seventeen times."
data.text: [subroutine] The Runner loses 1[credit] unless the Runner is tagged. If the Runner is tagged, he or she loses all credits in his or her credit pool and the Corp trashes Universal Connectivity Fee.
data.title: Universal Connectivity Fee

data.flavor: Unlimited Energy. Reasonable Prices.
data.text: When your turn begins, you may add 1 rezzed card to HQ and gain credits equal to its rez cost.
data.title: Blue Sun: Powering the Future

data.text: Changeling can be advanced. While Changeling has an odd number of advancement tokens on it, it gains sentry and loses barrier. [subroutine] End the run.
data.title: Changeling

data.flavor: If the clones were nervous about living in a repurposed fuel tank, they never mentioned it.
data.text:
As an additional cost to play this operation, spend [click].
Trash any number of cards from HQ. Gain 2[credit] for each card trashed.
data.title: Reuse

data.text:
When your turn begins, you may add 1 card from Archives to the bottom of R&D.
Limit 1 per deck.
data.title: Hades Fragment

data.text:
[click], [click]: Place 1 power counter on Docklands Crackdown.
The install cost of the first card the Runner installs each turn is increased by 1 for each power counter on Docklands Crackdown.
data.title: Docklands Crackdown

data.flavor: "Knowledge comes in many different shapes and sizes." -Quetzal
data.text: Reveal the top 4 cards of your stack and trash all programs revealed. Gain 1[credit] for each program trashed, and add the rest of the revealed cards to your grip.
data.title: Inject

data.flavor: The earliest instances of data folding were inspired by the traditional art of origami. Just as a crease pattern is the blueprint of a paper crane, there is a sequence to data that must be considered in order to achieve the greatest result.
data.text: Your maximum hand size is increased by 1 for each copy of Origami installed.
data.title: Origami

data.flavor: "You should have known better than to scratch it…" -Quetzal
data.text: Whenever the Corp purges virus counters, he or she loses 2[credit], if able.
data.title: Fester

data.flavor: It practically runs itself, unless you're in a pinch.
data.text:
The first time you install a program from your grip during your turn, gain [click].
Trash Autoscripter if you make an unsuccessful run.
data.title: Autoscripter

data.flavor: Small. Compact. Easy to slip by monitoring programs and it can do some damage.
data.text: 1[credit]: Break any number of sentry subroutines. Use this ability only by spending a credit from a stealth card. 1[credit]: +7 strength. Use this ability only by spending a credit from a stealth card.
data.title: Switchblade

data.text:
As an additional cost to play this event, trash an installed piece of hardware.
Gain credits equal to half the install cost of the trashed hardware (rounded down) and search your stack for a piece of hardware, reveal it, and add it to your grip. Shuffle your stack.
data.title: Trade-In

data.flavor: "There is no better tool for charting the empty spaces of the net." -Nasir Meidan
data.text: +1[mu] Draw 1 card whenever the Corp creates a server. Limit 1 console per player.
data.title: Astrolabe

data.flavor: "Low gravity sports are wildly popular, so match-fixing has proven wildly profitable." -Leela Patel
data.text: Place X power counters on Angel Arena when it is installed. When there are no power counters left on Angel Arena, trash it. Hosted power counter: Reveal the top card of your stack. You may add that card to the bottom of your stack.
data.title: Angel Arena

data.flavor: "'What does it do?' Whatever I bloody want it to do." -Director Haas
data.text: When you score Bifrost Array, you may trigger the "when scored" ability of another agenda that is not a copy of Bifrost Array in your score area.
data.title: Bifrost Array

data.flavor: Sagittarius promised foresight, but brought only regret.
data.text: [subroutine] <trace>Trace 2</trace> If successful, trash 1 program. If your trace strength is 5 or greater, trash 1 program.
data.title: Sagittarius

data.flavor: "If thou only knowest what it is to conquer, and knowest not what it is to be defeated; woe unto thee…" -Tokugawa Ieyasu
data.text: Whenever the Runner trashes a Corp card (including Hostile Infrastructure), do 1 net damage.
data.title: Hostile Infrastructure

data.flavor: Gemini promised pleasure, but dealt only pain.
data.text: [subroutine] <trace>Trace 2</trace> If successful, do 1 net damage. If your trace strength is 5 or greater, do 1 net damage.
data.title: Gemini

data.flavor: "We've received seventeen crates from ChiLo. We'll hit stores the same day we sign the licence agreement."
data.text: When you score License Acquisition, install and rez an asset or upgrade from Archives or HQ, ignoring all costs.
data.title: License Acquisition

data.flavor: "A new investment deal every morning! Grab the bull by the horns and take control of your future!"
data.text: The first time you draw a card each turn, draw 1 additional card. Add 1 of the drawn cards to the bottom of R&D.
data.title: Daily Business Show

data.flavor: "Our new barriers will be built on the rubble of our enemies".
data.text: All barrier ice have +1 strength. When you score Superior Cyberwalls, gain 1[credit] for each rezzed barrier.
data.title: Superior Cyberwalls

data.flavor: "Do it again, but this time I want to see you to enunciate less. Maybe let some spittle fly."
data.text:
When your turn begins, you may rez a card, lowering the rez cost by 1[credit].
1[credit],[trash]: Search R&D for an asset, reveal it, and add it to HQ. Shuffle R&D.
data.title: Executive Boot Camp

data.flavor: "It's weird. I hit the server again and it was like a totally different piece of ice was waiting for me. Lost my root daemon. I shouldn't have nested them seven deep."
data.text: Lycan can be advanced. While Lycan has an odd number of advancement tokens on it, it gains code gate and loses sentry. [subroutine] Trash 1 program.
data.title: Lycan

data.flavor: The last thing he saw was the tattoo of a strange beast on his captor's neck. It had a goat's head, the body of a lion, and the tail of a serpent. Then the bag was yanked over his head, and there was only darkness.
data.text: Trace 3 If successful, trash 1 connection. The Runner can take 1 tag to prevent this.
data.title: Snatch and Grab

data.flavor: He who holds the staff of wisdom.
data.text: When the Runner encounters Merlin, you may reveal up to 2 grail ice from HQ. For the remainder of this run, Merlin gains the subroutines of the revealed ice in the order of your choice. [subroutine] Do 2 net damage.
data.title: Merlin

data.text:
You cannot use Shell Corporation more than once per turn.
[click]: Place 3[credit] on Shell Corporation.
[click]: Take all credits from Shell Corporation.
data.title: Shell Corporation

data.flavor: "Sometimes you just need a brain in a jar" -g00ru
data.text: Your memory limit is equal to the number of cards in your grip. Limit 1 console per player.
data.title: Ekomind

data.flavor: "He only likes to eat live meat." -MaxX
data.text: Place 4 power counters on Cerberus "Cuj.0" H3 when it is installed. Hosted power counter: Break up to 2 sentry subroutines. 1[credit]: +1 strength.
data.title: Cerberus "Cuj.0" H3

data.flavor: "I'd say I do it for the challenge, but the truth is it's not that hard."
data.text: Whenever an agenda is scored or stolen, add 1 unrezzed card to HQ.
data.title: Leela Patel: Trained Pragmatist

data.flavor: "Useful for fetching all sorts of things…but you better have a treat ready if he likes it." -Iain Stirling
data.text: Place 4 power counters on Cerberus "Rex" H2 when it is installed. Hosted power counter: Break up to 2 code gate subroutines. 1[credit]: +1 strength.
data.title: Cerberus "Rex" H2

data.flavor: "They'll deliver anything to anywhere. Make sure to request air holes if you're shipping someone important, though."
data.text:
Place 1[credit] on Zona Sul Shipping when your turn begins.
[click]: Take all credits from Zona Sul Shipping.
Trash Zona Sul Shipping if you are tagged.
data.title: Zona Sul Shipping

data.flavor: Cybsoft started by designing games. Eventually they just redesigned the same game each year, and to combat piracy created a dedicated machine to play it. Profits grew ten-fold.
data.text:
1[recurring-credit]
Use this credit to install programs.
data.title: Cybsoft MacroDrive

data.flavor: "Its bytes are definitely worse than its bark." -Chaos Theory
data.text: Place 4 power counters on Cerberus "Lady" H1 when it is installed. Hosted power counter: Break up to 2 barrier subroutines. 1[credit]: +1 strength.
data.title: Cerberus "Lady" H1

data.text:
Whenever you make a successful run on HQ, instead of accessing cards, you may install Utopia Shard from your grip, ignoring all costs.
[trash]: The Corp discards 2 cards from HQ at random.
Limit 1 per deck.
data.title: Utopia Shard

data.flavor: It takes power to create power.
data.text: When you score Helium-3 Deposit, place up to 2 power counters on a card with at least 1 power counter on it.
data.title: Helium-3 Deposit

data.flavor: Recycling the energy entering the system via a run is both responsible and economical.
data.text:
[subroutine] The Corp gains 1[credit] or draws 1 card.
[subroutine] The Corp gains 1[credit] or draws 1 card.
[subroutine] The Corp gains 1[credit] or draws 1 card.
data.title: Errand Boy

data.text: [click]: Place 1 power counter on IT Department. Hosted power counter: Choose a rezzed piece of ice. That ice has +1 strength until the end of the turn for each power counter (including the one spent) on IT Department.
data.title: IT Department

data.flavor: The forge must never run cold.
data.text:
The Runner may spend [click] to break any subroutine on Markus 1.0.
[subroutine] The Runner trashes 1 of his or her installed cards.
[subroutine] End the run.
data.title: Markus 1.0

data.flavor: Achieve the Impossible.
data.text: The trash cost of each card is increased by 1 for each facedown card in Archives.
data.title: Industrial Genomics: Growing Solutions

data.flavor: A masterpiece of cloning and hardware technology, Jinteki created homo vacuo operae, commonly called "turtlebacks", to operate for long periods of time within a vacuum.
data.text: Gain 1[credit] whenever you create a server.
data.title: Turtlebacks

data.text:
As an additional cost to play this operation, spend [click].
Rez 1 piece of ice for each tag the Runner has, ignoring all costs.
data.title: Shoot the Moon

data.flavor: You gotta pay the troll toll to get in.
data.text: When the Runner encounters Troll, <trace>trace 2</trace> if successful, the Runner must lose [click] or end the run.
data.title: Troll

data.flavor: Virgo promised love, but offered only jealousy.
data.text: [subroutine] <trace>Trace 2</trace> If successful, give the Runner 1 tag. If your trace strength is 5 or greater, give the Runner 1 tag.
data.title: Virgo

data.text:
As an additional cost to steal an agenda, the Runner must pay 2[credit] for each advancement token on that agenda.
Limit 1 per deck.
data.title: Utopia Fragment

data.flavor:
There drew he forth the brand Excalibur,
And o'er him, drawing it, the winter moon,
Brightening the skirts of a long cloud, ran forth
And sparkled keen with frost against the hilt:
For all the haft twinkled with diamonds sparks,
Myriads of topaz-lights, and jacinth work
Of subtlest jewellery. -Lord Tennyson
data.text: [subroutine] The Runner cannot make another run this turn.
data.title: Excalibur

data.text:
Install only in a remote server.
[trash]: Trash all cards installed in or protecting this server and <trace>trace X</trace> if successful, do 3 net damage. X is the number of cards trashed. Use this ability only during a run on this server.
data.title: Self-destruct

data.flavor: "What terrors hatch in her dispossessed mind, waiting for their moment to be born? My money's on a double-helix rainbow with the head of a panda." -fakespeare
data.text: When your turn begins, place 1 virus counter on Incubator. [click], [trash]: Move all virus counters from Incubator to another installed virus program.
data.title: Incubator

data.flavor: Digs in deeper than its Alabama counterpart.
data.text:
Whenever the Corp loses at least 1[credit], gain 1[credit].
Trash Ixodidae if the Corp purges virus counters.
data.title: Ixodidae

data.text: Make a run on R&D. If successful, instead of accessing cards, you may search your stack for a program and install it, lowering the install cost by 3 for each piece of ice protecting R&D, and then take 1 tag. Shuffle your stack.
data.title: Code Siphon

data.flavor: "All programs are connected. The data that runs through one runs through all." -Rielle "Kit" Peddler
data.text: Draw 1 card whenever the Corp rezzes a piece of ice.
data.title: Collective Consciousness

data.flavor: δὶς ἐς τὸν αὐτὸν ποταμὸν οὐκ ἂν ἐμβαίης
data.text: Sage has +1 strength for each unused MU. 2[credit]: Break code gate or barrier subroutine.
data.title: Sage

data.flavor: "Sometimes it's helpful to remember that you're not the only one who loves money." -Gabriel Santiago
data.text: Make a run. During this run, the Corp must pay X[credit] as an additional cost to rez the first unrezzed piece of ice approached.
data.title: Bribery

data.flavor: The datastream slipped away, and it felt like being born for a second time, if only you could remember the first. A rush of air fills the lungs to bursting, and you gasp it out, coughing and choking as the dim lights of the room shine with the brilliance of a thousand suns.
data.text: Gain 1[credit] whenever you jack out.
data.title: Au Revoir

data.text:
Place 3 power counters on Earthrise Hotel when it is installed. When there are no power counters left on Earthrise Hotel, trash it.
When your turn begins, draw 2 cards and remove 1 power counter from Earthrise Hotel.
data.title: Earthrise Hotel

data.flavor: We Never Sleep.
data.text: Whenever the Runner steals an agenda, he or she must either take 1 tag or suffer 2 meat damage.
data.title: Argus Security: Protection Guaranteed

data.flavor: Sic Itur Ad Astra.
data.text: As an additional cost to access a card in a remote server, the Runner must pay 1[credit].
data.title: Gagarin Deep Space: Expanding the Horizon

data.flavor: The Way Forward.
data.text: Whenever you score an agenda, you may place 1 agenda counter on it.
data.title: Titan Transnational: Investing In Your Future

data.text: Place 3 agenda counters on Firmware Updates when you score it. Hosted agenda counter: Place 1 advancement token on a piece of ice that can be advanced. Use this ability only once per turn.
data.title: Firmware Updates

data.text:
Glenn Station can host a single card.
[click]: Host a card from HQ facedown on Glenn Station.
[click]: Add a card on Glenn Station to HQ.
data.title: Glenn Station

data.flavor: It is essential to liberate a populace from tyranny before that tyranny takes root.
data.text:
[click]: Gain 3[credit].
Limit 1 Government Takeover per deck.
data.title: Government Takeover

data.flavor: "Trust me. I know what I'm doing."
data.text: Place 1 agenda counter on High-Risk Investment when you score it. [click], hosted agenda counter: Gain 1[credit] for each credit in the Runner's credit pool.
data.title: High-Risk Investment

data.flavor: "With distributed systems, assets can be realigned with no loss of efficiency." -William Knuth, The Tower of Babbage
data.text: When your turn begins, you may move an advancement token from a piece of ice to an installed piece of ice that can be advanced.
data.title: Constellation Protocol

data.flavor: "This is a one-of-a-kind opportunity…"
data.text: Whenever you spend an agenda counter, gain 1[credit]. [trash] or any agenda counter: Gain 2[credit].
data.title: Mark Yale

data.flavor: Future leaders start here.
data.text:
If Space Camp is accessed from R&D, the Runner must reveal it.
When the Runner accesses Space Camp, you may place 1 advancement token on a card that can be advanced.
data.title: Space Camp

data.flavor: No one on the board knows everyone on it.
data.text:
Each agenda in the Runner's score area is worth 1 fewer agenda point.
If The Board is trashed while being accessed, add it to the Runner's score area as an agenda worth 2 agenda points.
data.title: The Board

data.flavor: His belt of stone did shake and shatter.
data.text:
Asteroid Belt can be advanced and its rez cost is lowered by 3 for each advancement token on it.
[subroutine] End the run.
data.title: Asteroid Belt

data.flavor: As through the door of light he came.
data.text:
Wormhole can be advanced and its rez cost is lowered by 3 for each advancement token on it.
[subroutine] Resolve a subroutine on another piece of rezzed ice.
data.title: Wormhole

data.flavor: He bent his bow of stellar matter.
data.text:
Nebula can be advanced and its rez cost is lowered by 3 for each advancement token on it.
[subroutine] Trash 1 program.
data.title: Nebula

data.flavor: And seeking prey he then took aim.
data.text:
Orion can be advanced and its rez cost is lowered by 3 for each advancement token on it.
[subroutine] Trash 1 program.
[subroutine] Resolve a subroutine on another piece of rezzed ice.
[subroutine] End the run.
data.title: Orion

data.text:
[click]: Move this piece of ice to the outermost position protecting any server.
[subroutine] Place 1 advancement token on a piece of ice protecting this server that can be advanced.
[subroutine] Place 1 advancement token on a piece of ice protecting this server that can be advanced.
data.title: Builder

data.flavor: "I passed right through one once. It didn't seem to do anything at first. It wasn't until I jacked out that I realized they were busting down the door of my apartment." -Valencia Estevez
data.text:
When you rez Checkpoint, take 1 bad publicity.
[subroutine] <trace>Trace 5</trace> If successful, do 3 meat damage when this run is successful.
data.title: Checkpoint

data.flavor: "Definitely a literalist." -Liz Campbell, VP Project Security
data.text:
Fire Wall can be advanced and gains +1 strength for each advancement token on it.
[subroutine] End the run.
data.title: Fire Wall

data.text:
Searchlight can be advanced. X is the number of advancement tokens on Searchlight.
[subroutine]<trace>Trace X</trace> If successful, give the Runner 1 tag.
[subroutine]<trace>Trace X</trace> If successful, give the Runner 1 tag.
data.title: Searchlight

data.text: This card is not trashed until another current is played or an agenda is stolen. The first time the Runner installs a card each turn, he or she must trash 1 card from his or her grip.
data.title: Housekeeping

data.flavor:
Update 1.1:
-Fixes some stability issues. //maybe
data.text: Install Patch on a rezzed piece of ice as a hosted condition counter with the text "Host ice has +2 strength."
data.title: Patch

data.flavor: "Traffic was murder."
data.text:
Play only if the Runner has at least 2 tags.
Do 2 meat damage.
data.title: Traffic Accident

data.text: Each piece of ice protecting this server is considered to have 1 additional advancement token on it. Limit 1 region per server.
data.title: Satellite Grid

data.flavor: Anything worth doing is worth doing twice.
data.text: Whenever the Runner passes a rezzed piece of ice protecting this server, you may reveal and trash another copy of that ice from HQ to force the Runner to encounter the piece of ice just passed again.
data.title: The Twins

data.flavor: "It's fun watching them derez after hitting Enigma." -Grace Lamarr, Freelance Security Expert
data.text: Install Sub Boost on a rezzed piece of ice as a hosted condition counter with the text "Host ice gains barrier and '[subroutine] End the run.' after all its other subroutines."
data.title: Sub Boost

data.text:
2[recurring-credit]
Use these credits to install ice protecting this server.
data.title: Dedicated Technician Team

data.text:
If Cyberdex Virus Suite is accessed from R&D, the Runner must reveal it.
When the Runner accesses Cyberdex Virus Suite, you may purge virus counters.
[trash]: Purge virus counters.
data.title: Cyberdex Virus Suite

data.flavor: "My only regret is that androids cannot feel my hate."
data.text: Trash the first operation you access each turn at no cost.
data.title: Edward Kim: Humanity's Hammer

data.text: When your turn begins, trash the top 2 cards of your stack. Draw 1 card.
data.title: MaxX: Maximum Punk Rock

data.flavor: "Everyone deserves a chance. Everyone."
data.text: The Corp starts the game with 1 bad publicity.
data.title: Valencia Estevez: The Angel of Cayambe

data.flavor: "The human brain only uses like a quarter of its capacity anyway, right?" -MaxX
data.text: Gain [click][click][click] and suffer 1 brain damage (cannot be prevented).
data.title: Amped Up

data.text:
Draw 3 cards.
Whenever I've Had Worse is trashed by taking net or meat damage, draw 3 cards.
data.title: I've Had Worse

data.flavor: No one knows what they want-least of all them.
data.text: This card is not trashed until another current is played or an agenda is scored. The Corp's maximum hand size is reduced by 1 for each bad publicity he or she has.
data.title: Itinerant Protesters

data.text: Make a run on R&D. If successful, instead of accessing cards from the top of R&D, access cards from the bottom of R&D (starting with the bottom card and working your way up).
data.title: Showing Off

data.text: Make a run on HQ. If successful, instead of accessing cards, you may spend any number of [click] to force the Corp to trash an equal number of cards from HQ at random.
data.title: Wanton Destruction

data.flavor: "Hello thank you for vidding MegaBuy I'm Carol how can I help you."
data.text:
As an additional cost to play this event, spend [click][click][click].
Gain 10[credit].
data.title: Day Job

data.text: Make a run. The first time you break all subroutines on a sentry during this run, trash that sentry.
data.title: Forked

data.text: Make a run. The first time you break all subroutines on a barrier during this run, trash that barrier.
data.title: Knifed

data.text: Make a run. The first time you break all subroutines on a code gate during this run, trash that code gate.
data.title: Spooned

data.flavor: Nom nom nom.
data.text:
1[credit]: Break ice subroutine. You cannot access more than 0 cards for the remainder of this run.
1[credit]: +1 strength.
data.title: Eater

data.flavor: "Once your sniffer finds the protocols the server uses to trash its own data, you can spoof those same protocols. It's quite the show." -Ji "Noise" Reilly
data.text: Whenever an installed Corp card is trashed, place 1 virus counter on Gravedigger. [click], hosted virus counter: The Corp trashes the top card of R&D.
data.title: Gravedigger

data.flavor: "We built the network. But then the network evolved. Can we be sure that it is not alive?" -g00ru
data.text: Place 1 virus counter on Hivemind when it is installed. Virus counters on Hivemind are considered to be hosted on all other virus programs for the purposes of card effects (and can be spent as if on them).
data.title: Hivemind

data.text: You may host a single virus program on Progenitor. The memory cost of the hosted program does not count against your memory limit. Whenever virus counters are purged, instead of removing all virus counters from the hosted card, remove all but 1 virus counter from the hosted card. Errata from FAQ 4.0
data.title: Progenitor

data.flavor: A black box that makes data disappear forever.
data.text: Whenever you access cards in Archives, you may remove 1 card in Archives from the game, instead of accessing it.
data.title: Archives Interface

data.flavor: There was a sickly smell coming from his closet. He hoped it was only a mouse this time.
data.text: When your turn begins, you may trash another of your installed cards. If you do, draw 1 card or remove 1 tag.
data.title: Chop Bot 3000

data.flavor: "The trick is remembering which virus you loaded onto which strip. That's why I draw emoji on 'em. Then I just have to remember which emoji stands for which virus." -Princess Space Kitten
data.text: +3[mu] Use the MU on MemStrips only for virus programs.
data.title: MemStrips

data.flavor: "Show me your faith without deeds, if you can."
data.text: +1[mu] When your turn begins, draw 1 card if the Corp has cards in HQ equal to his or her maximum hand size. Limit 1 console per player.
data.title: Vigil

data.flavor: "They showed me that I wasn't broken. I am still a whole human, no matter how many limbs I lose. The golems are our enemy, as well as anyone who values efficiency and profit more than a human life." -Edward Kim
data.text: Whenever an agenda is scored or stolen, gain credits equal to the agenda points on that agenda.
data.title: Human First

data.flavor: Her heart beat faster as her reader illuminated the records. It was all there. The pod had not been reprogrammed since the 14th, which meant that this was a case of gross negligence.
data.text:
Install only if the Corp has at least 1 bad publicity.
[click],[click],[click],[click],[trash]: Give the Corp 1 bad publicity.
data.title: Investigative Journalism

data.flavor: "Don't worry, me. You won't have to vertical park." -Ji "Noise" Reilly
data.text: [trash]: Prevent all damage. Trash all installed hardware, all installed non-virtual resources, and all cards in your grip. Lose all credits in your credit pool. Remove all tags.
data.title: Sacrificial Clone

data.flavor: Her eyes were the color of dreams and disasters.
data.text: When your turn begins, if there are 2 or more power counters on Stim Dealer, remove all power counters from it and suffer 1 brain damage (cannot be prevented); otherwise, place 1 power counter on Stim Dealer and gain [click].
data.title: Stim Dealer

data.flavor: Scraps of code drifting around the network can congeal into pools of data. Within this primordial soup the code breaks, re-assemble, mutates. Evolves.
data.text:
When your turn begins, place 1 virus counter on Virus Breeding Ground.
[click]: Move 1 virus counter on Virus Breeding Ground to another card with at least 1 virus counter on it.
data.title: Virus Breeding Ground

data.flavor: Runner software is notoriously scratch-built and under-tested, and the shadow net has no tech support. It works, mostly, but sometimes a fresh install is just the ticket.
data.text: Add an installed program or piece of hardware to your grip.
data.title: Uninstall

data.text: When your turn begins, you may lose [click]. If you do, avoid the first tag you take until the beginning of your next turn.
data.title: Qianju PT

data.flavor: "Sometimes I like to make origami cranes out of old newsrag. It helps me think, putting it back on the subconscious. I figure it's the same principle for my rig - keep it busy and it makes me a few creds for my trouble." -Quetzal
data.text: When your turn begins, gain 1[credit] if you have 2 or more unused MU.
data.title: Data Folding

data.text:
The Corp cannot score an agenda on the same turn he or she installed it.
Trash Clot if the Corp purges virus counters.
data.title: Clot

data.flavor: "The Valley is littered with good ideas. You need the discipline to execute if you want to stay in my incubator."
data.text: The first time you install a card each turn (including Paige Piper), you may search your stack for any number of copies of that card and add them to your heap. Shuffle your stack.
data.title: Paige Piper

data.flavor: Turns a night owl into an early bird!
data.text: The first time you lose [click] each turn, gain [click].
data.title: Adjusted Chronotype

data.text: If you have at least 2[link], the memory cost of Spike is 0, even if it is not installed. Spike has +1 strength for each installed icebreaker. [trash]: Break up to 3 barrier subroutines.
data.title: Spike

data.text: The first time you make a successful run each turn, the Corp reveals 1 card at random from HQ.
data.title: Enhanced Vision

data.text: Genetics also trigger the second time each turn their trigger condition is met.
data.title: Gene Conditioning Shoppe

data.flavor: Your heart deserves the best.
data.text: The first time you take damage each turn, draw 1 card.
data.title: Synthetic Blood

data.text: This card is not trashed until another current is played or an agenda is scored. The advancement requirement of each agenda is increased by 1 for each copy of that agenda in the Corp's score area.
data.title: Traffic Jam

data.flavor: Born for success!
data.text: The first time you spend [click] to draw 1 card (not through a card ability) each turn, gain 1[credit].
data.title: Symmetrical Visage

data.flavor: In the vast universe of memories, consciousness slumbers...
data.text: The rez cost of bioroid ice is lowered by 1 for each unspent click the Runner has.
data.title: Brain-Taping Warehouse

data.flavor: "God in Heinlein. What's next, NEXT Platinum?" -John Masanori
data.text: X is the number of rezzed NEXT ice. [subroutine] Do X net damage. [subroutine] Trash X programs.
data.title: NEXT Gold

data.text:
Before taking your first turn, you may swap this card with any copy of Jinteki Biotech.
[click],[click],[click]: Flip this identity.
The Brewery: When you flip this identity, do 2 net damage.
The Tank: When you flip this identity, shuffle Archives into R&D.
The Greenhouse: When you flip this identity, place 4 advancement tokens on a card that can be advanced.
data.title: Jinteki Biotech: Life Imagined

data.text: When you score Genetic Resequencing, you may place 1 agenda counter on an agenda in your score area.
data.title: Genetic Resequencing

data.flavor: The more power a spike process can use, the harder it can hit. The really clever ones borrow the runner's own memory to iterate locally.
data.text: [subroutine] Do 1 net damage for each unused MU the Runner has.
data.title: Cortex Lock

data.text: Whenever the Runner breaks all subroutines on a piece of ice protecting this server, his or her maximum hand size is reduced by 1 until the beginning of your next turn. Limit 1 region per server.
data.title: Valley Grid

data.flavor: "It tracks you and logs you. If you get in you can just delete the log. But first you have to get in." -Gabriel Santiago
data.text: [subroutine] Give the Runner 1 tag. If this run is successful, the Runner removes 1 tag.
data.title: Bandwidth

data.text: This card is not trashed until another current is played or an agenda is stolen. As an additional cost to steal an agenda, the Runner must pay 2[credit].
data.title: Predictive Algorithm

data.flavor: Give a man money, and he is rich for a day. Teach a man how to invest, and he is rich for life.
data.text: [click]: Gain 2[credit].
data.title: Capital Investors

data.flavor: "Negotiation is an art, so never negotiate when you can intimidate instead." -Thiago Reyes, VP Strategic Operations
data.text:
The Runner can pay 2[credit] to break any subroutine on Negotiator.
[subroutine] The Corp gains 2[credit].
[subroutine] Trash 1 program.
data.title: Negotiator

data.flavor: "Don't worry. If this one fails, we can start a new one tomorrow."
data.text: When your turn begins, you may trash Tech Startup. If you do, search R&D for an asset, reveal it, and install it. Shuffle R&D.
data.title: Tech Startup

data.text: This card is not trashed until another current is played or an agenda is scored. As an additional cost to rez non-ice cards, the Corp must randomly trash a card from HQ.
data.title: Hacktivist Meeting

data.flavor: Usually crashing with friends means sleeping on the couch. This time, it meant sleeping on a server farm.
data.text: Off-Campus Apartment can host any number of connections. Whenever you install a connection on Off-Campus Apartment, draw 1 card.
data.title: Off-Campus Apartment

data.flavor: "You can help Jinteki shape the future. Your future."
data.text: Install a resource from your grip, lowering the install cost by 3.
data.title: Career Fair

data.text: Place 4 power counters on Dorm Computer when you install it. [click], hosted power counter: Make a run. Avoid all tags for the remainder of the run.
data.title: Dorm Computer

data.text: The first time you install a card each turn, you may install another card of the same type from your grip (paying its install cost).
data.title: Hayley Kaplan: Universal Scholar

data.text:
As an additional cost to play this event, spend [click].
If you have fewer cards in your grip than your maximum hand size, draw cards until you have cards in your grip equal to your maximum hand size.
data.title: Game Day

data.text: +1[mu] The first time you play an event each turn, you may play another event (without spending a click) after the first one resolves. Limit 1 console per player.
data.title: Comet

data.flavor: "Once you download the lecture source files, this program does a statistical analysis and distills the most important concepts." -Hayley Kaplan
data.text: Study Guide has +1 strength for each power counter on it. 1[credit]: Break code gate subroutine. 2[credit]: Place 1 power counter on Study Guide.
data.title: Study Guide

data.text: Trash all programs hosted on London Library when your turn ends. [click]: Install a non-virus program from your grip on London Library, ignoring the install cost. [click]: Add a program on London Library to your grip.
data.title: London Library

data.flavor: "There are whole generations of people who never move out of a megalopolis center. You should see the look on their face the first time they see the stars." -Professor Darren Fin, Astronomy
data.text: [click], [click]: Search your stack for a piece of hardware, reveal it, and add it to your grip. Shuffle your stack.
data.title: Tyson Observatory

data.flavor: "So much to do. So little time."
data.text:
When your turn begins, lose [click].
Your maximum hand size is increased by 5.
data.title: Beach Party

data.flavor: "My research could make your corporation billions. And save lives, of course."
data.text: When you score Research Grant, you may score another copy of Research Grant that is installed.
data.title: Research Grant

data.flavor: Alan Turing laid the foundation for artificial intelligence by suggesting that you could teach a computer to be human.
data.text: Turing has +3 strength while protecting a remote server. The Runner cannot use AI programs to break subroutines on Turing. [subroutine] End the run unless the Runner spends [click][click][click].
data.title: Turing

data.flavor: Crick and his colleagues ushered in modern genetics by mapping the structure of DNA.
data.text:
Crick has +3 strength while protecting Archives.
[subroutine] Install a card from Archives (paying its install cost).
data.title: Crick

data.flavor: "My script can perform the Kobayashi algorithm in .12 seconds."
data.text: Search R&D for up to X different sysops (by title), reveal them, and add them to HQ. Shuffle R&D.
data.title: Recruiting Trip

data.flavor: Officially, there is no blacklist. That would be illegal. Unofficially, there is a list, and being on it can ruin a career.
data.text: Cards cannot leave the Runner's heap for any reason.
data.title: Blacklist

data.flavor: Johannes Gutenberg ignited the first Information Revolution by inventing the movable-type printing press.
data.text:
Gutenberg has +3 strength while protecting R&D.
[subroutine] <trace>Trace 7</trace> If successful, give the Runner 1 tag.
data.title: Gutenberg

data.flavor: The cost of an education is sometimes felt sharpest in the stomach.
data.text: As an additional cost to play an event that there is a copy of in his or her heap, the Runner must pay 2[credit].
data.title: Student Loans

data.flavor: Meru Mati pushed the limits of physics by engineering the first buckyweave structure, a thousand-foot long wall.
data.text:
Meru Mati has +3 strength while protecting HQ.
[subroutine] End the run.
data.title: Meru Mati

data.flavor: After the Big One, real estate value changed sharply. Some found that they had become owners of beachfront property. Others were underwater.
data.text: The rez cost of cards in this server is lowered by 5. Limit 1 region per server.
data.title: Breaker Bay Grid

data.flavor: The most potent scripts are indistinguishable from magic to the sysop on the other side.
data.text: Make a run on Archives. If successful, instead of accessing a piece of ice in Archives, trash a rezzed copy of that ice.
data.title: Immolation Script

data.flavor: The implanted brain-machine interface, or "skulljack," is the single most common cybernetic enhancement that isn't a medical necessity.
data.text:
When you install Skulljack, suffer 1 brain damage.
The trash cost of all cards is lowered by 1.
data.title: Skulljack

data.text: +1[mu] Whenever you steal an agenda, you may swap that agenda with an agenda in the Corp's score area. Limit 1 console per player.
data.title: Turntable

data.flavor: Picking a chopper might be the last decision you make. If you find a good one, stick with her for life.
data.text: Prevent all meat damage and brain damage from installing cybernetics.
data.title: Chrome Parlor

data.text:
When you install Titanium Ribs, suffer 2 meat damage.
You choose the card(s) from your grip to trash whenever you take damage (including the damage taken by installing Titanium Ribs).
data.title: Titanium Ribs

data.text: If you have at least 2[link], the memory cost of Crowbar is 0, even if it is not installed. Crowbar has +1 strength for each installed icebreaker. [trash]: Break up to 3 code gate subroutines.
data.title: Crowbar

data.text: When you install Net-Ready Eyes, suffer 2 meat damage. Whenever you initiate a run, choose an icebreaker. That icebreaker has +1 strength for the remainder of the run.
data.title: Net-Ready Eyes

data.flavor: Sometimes progress means returning to the past.
data.text: [click]: Make a run on R&D. If successful, instead of accessing cards, you may choose an unrezzed non-ice card with no advancement tokens on it. The Corp shuffles that card into R&D.
data.title: Analog Dreamers

data.flavor: The skull is not one bone, but 22. The surgery is even more complex than it sounds.
data.text:
When you install Brain Cage, suffer 1 brain damage.
Your maximum hand size is increased by 3.
data.title: Brain Cage

data.flavor: Define Yourself.
data.text: Each player's maximum hand size is reduced by 1.
data.title: Cybernetics Division: Humanity Upgraded

data.flavor: Cyber enhancements can be dangerous in the wrong hands.
data.text: The Runner's maximum hand size is reduced by 1.
data.title: Self-Destruct Chips

data.flavor: "Remember those FCC regulations about not creating harmful interference? No? Ah, before your time, I guess." -Cailan Heinrich, Senior Programmer
data.text: [subroutine] The Runner trashes an installed piece of hardware. Trash Lab Dog.
data.title: Lab Dog

data.flavor: Built Oaktown tough.
data.text: The trash cost of cards installed in this server is increased by 3. Limit 1 region per server.
data.title: Oaktown Grid

data.flavor: "Bioroids recognize consciousness in others, but not in themselves."
data.text: [trash]: Do 1 brain damage. Use this ability only during a run on this server and only if the Runner has no unspent clicks.
data.title: Ryon Knight

data.text: [subroutine] You and the Runner secretly spend 0[credit], 1[credit], or 2[credit]. Reveal spent credits. If you and the Runner spent a different number of credits, place 1 advancement token on an installed card and end the run.
data.title: Clairvoyant Monitor

data.flavor: "When your communications are disrupted, you are isolated from your resources. An attack will surely follow." -The Playbook
data.text: [subroutine] The Runner cannot draw cards for the remainder of this turn.
data.title: Lockdown

data.flavor: "A sysop is not just a cog in the corporate machine. They have dreams-and nightmares-just like the rest of us." -Kate "Mac" McCaffrey
data.text:
[subroutine] End the run.
[subroutine] End the run.
[subroutine] The Runner gains 5[credit].
data.title: Little Engine

data.text:
Install Oaktown Renovation faceup.
Whenever you advance Oaktown Renovation, gain 2[credit] (or 3[credit] if there are 5 or more advancement tokens on Oaktown Renovation).
data.title: Oaktown Renovation

data.flavor: If you can't buy the city council, create a new city.
data.text:
As an additional cost to rez Corporate Town, the Corp must forfeit an agenda.
When your turn begins, you may trash 1 resource (cannot be prevented).
data.title: Corporate Town

data.text:
When the Runner encounters Quicksand, place 1 power counter on Quicksand.
Quicksand has +1 strength for each power counter on it.
[subroutine] End the run.
data.title: Quicksand

data.flavor: The server was quiet that night. I closed my eyes, the low-hum of the datastream lulling me into a trance. When I opened them, the construct stood before me in the shape of a man, clad in light of many colors. His stature was impressive, and his saccharine voice wormed its way into my very soul.
data.text: Trash a card from your grip: Break ice subroutine. Trash a card from your grip: +2 strength.
data.title: Faust

data.flavor: "Whaddya buyin'?"
data.text:
When you install Street Peddler, host the top 3 cards of your stack facedown on Street Peddler (you may look at these cards at any time).
[trash]: Install 1 card hosted on Street Peddler, lowering its install cost by 1.
data.title: Street Peddler

data.flavor: "Everything has a price."
data.text: Whenever you use a [trash] ability, draw 1 card.
data.title: Armand "Geist" Walker: Tech Lord

data.text:
As an additional cost to play this event, spend [click].
Expose 1 card installed in a remote server. Trash that card at no cost if it is an asset or upgrade.
data.title: Drive By

data.flavor: Using the exact same rig as a million other people is just another form of security through anonymity.
data.text: +1[link] [trash]: Avoid or remove 1 tag. Limit 1 console per player.
data.title: Forger

data.text: If you have at least 2[link], the memory cost of Shiv is 0, even if it is not installed. Shiv has +1 strength for each installed icebreaker. [trash]: Break up to 3 sentry subroutines.
data.title: Shiv

data.flavor: Muertos has no fear of the law. Muertos is the law.
data.text: Whenever the Corp scores an agenda, access 1 card from HQ.
data.title: Gang Sign

data.flavor: La Señora de las Sombras giveth and taketh away.
data.text:
When you install Muertos Gang Member, the Corp must derez a card.
When Muertos Gang Member is uninstalled, the Corp may rez a card, ignoring the rez cost.
[trash]: Draw 1 card.
data.title: Muertos Gang Member

data.text: When you install Chameleon, name sentry, code gate or barrier. Add Chameleon to your grip when your turn ends. 1[credit]: Break a subroutine of the named subtype.
data.title: Chameleon

data.flavor: "It doesn't actually bend time. It just feels like it. That's relativity." -Hayley Kaplan
data.text: When your turn begins, you may remove Hyperdriver from the game and gain [click][click][click].
data.title: Hyperdriver

data.flavor:
"Isn't this wrong?"
"Not legally. They didn't read the fine print."
data.text:
Test Ground can be advanced.
[trash]: Derez 1 card for each advancement token on Test Ground.
data.title: Test Ground

data.text: This card is not trashed until another current is played or an agenda is stolen. The first time the Runner takes brain damage each turn, he or she takes 1 additional brain damage.
data.title: Defective Brainchips

data.text:
Allele Repression can be advanced.
[trash]: Swap 1 card in HQ with 1 card in Archives for each advancement token on Allele Repression.
data.title: Allele Repression

data.text: [trash]: You and the Runner secretly spend 0[credit], 1[credit], or 2[credit]. Reveal spent credits. If you and the Runner spent a different number of credits, resolve 1 subroutine on a rezzed piece of ice protecting this server. Use this ability only during a run on this server.
data.title: Marcus Batty

data.flavor: "Is your neighbor secretly a violent criminal? The answer to this chilling question and more, right after the break." -Shannon Claire, SSN 5
data.text:
Exposé can be advanced.
[trash]: Remove 1 bad publicity for each advancement token on Exposé.
data.title: Exposé

data.flavor: Pa-pa-pa-chinko!
data.text:
[subroutine] End the run if the Runner is tagged.
[subroutine] End the run if the Runner is tagged.
data.title: Pachinko

data.text:
Install Underway Renovation faceup.
Whenever you advance Underway Renovation, trash the top card of the Runner's stack (or top 2 cards instead if there are 4 or more advancement tokens on Underway Renovation).
data.title: Underway Renovation

data.flavor: "You want no questions asked, hire someone else. I have two: who and how much?"
data.text: Contract Killer can be advanced. If there are at least 2 advancement tokens on Contract Killer, it gains: "[click], [trash]: Trash a connection or do 2 meat damage."
data.title: Contract Killer

data.flavor: "Let me tell you a secret. There's no such thing as impenetrable ice. It has to allow access, or else why is the server on the Network in the first place? But that doesn't mean they have to make it easy." -g00ru
data.text:
[subroutine] End the run.
[subroutine] End the run.
[subroutine] End the run.
data.title: Spiderweb

data.text: Ice protecting this server cannot be bypassed. Cards in and protecting this server cannot be exposed. Limit 1 region per server.
data.title: Underway Grid

data.flavor: "Did you ever notice how everything goes in cycles? The stuff that's cool now was cool before. That's why I keep copy of everything!" -Princess Space Kitten
data.text: When your turn begins, place 1 power counter on Trope. [click], remove Trope from the game: Shuffle 1 card from your heap into your stack for each power counter on Trope.
data.title: Trope

data.flavor: Don't you hate it when you know everything before it's even out?
data.text: Whenever the Corp scores an agenda, he or she trashes the top card of R&D.
data.title: Spoilers

data.flavor: "Just a bunch of knockoffs for the touristos. The real designer stuff isn't sold on the street."
data.text:
When your turn begins, lose 1[credit].
When the Corp's turn begins, draw 1 card.
data.title: Drug Dealer

data.flavor: "I told you to lose my number!"
data.text:
When you install Rolodex, look at the top 5 cards of your stack and arrange them in any order.
When Rolodex is trashed, trash the top 3 cards of your stack.
data.title: Rolodex

data.flavor: Your life is not your own, once you become famous on the Net.
data.text: Whenever the Corp scores an agenda, add Fan Site to your score area as an agenda worth 0 agenda points.
data.title: Fan Site

data.flavor: "My gerbil could write a better screenplay."
data.text:
Film Critic can host a single agenda.
Whenever you access an agenda, you may host that agenda on Film Critic (the agenda is no longer being accessed and is uninstalled).
[click],[click]: Add an agenda hosted on Film Critic to your score area.
data.title: Film Critic

data.flavor: "Yeah, we know right where she is. Just pull up Sizzler!"
data.text:
You are tagged.
Prevent all meat damage.
data.title: Paparazzi

data.flavor: "It's our most pirated property ever. Great work, everyone."
data.text: Whenever the Runner trashes a Corp card (including Ronald Five), he or she loses [click].
data.title: Ronald Five

data.text: As an additional cost to rez Enforcer 1.0, the Corp must forfeit an agenda. The Runner can spend [click] to break any subroutine on Enforcer 1.0. [subroutine] Trash 1 program. [subroutine] Do 1 brain damage. [subroutine] Trash 1 console. [subroutine] Trash all virtual resources.
data.title: Enforcer 1.0

data.flavor: I warned you.
data.text:
Whenever It's a Trap! is exposed, do 2 net damage.
[subroutine] The Runner trashes 1 of his or her installed cards. Trash It's a Trap!.
data.title: It's a Trap!

data.text: Choose a central server. The runner may initiate a run on that server during which he or she cannot jack out. Otherwise, add An Offer You Can't Refuse to your score area as an agenda worth 1 agenda point.
data.title: An Offer You Can't Refuse

data.flavor: Home of Your Imagination.
data.text: The Runner cannot steal more than one agenda each turn.
data.title: Haarpsichord Studios: Entertainment Unleashed

data.text:
If Award Bait is accessed from R&D, the Runner must reveal it.
When the Runner accesses Award Bait, you may place up to 2 advancement tokens on a card that can be advanced.
data.title: Award Bait

data.flavor: It's like Lethal Action 3, only with more explosions.
data.text:
If Explode-a-palooza is accessed from R&D, the Runner must reveal it.
When the Runner accesses Explode-a-palooza, you may gain 5[credit].
data.title: Explode-a-palooza

data.text: When your turn begins, you may pay 1[credit]. If you do, place 1 advancement token on a card that can be advanced in a server.
data.title: Early Premiere

data.text: Install an agenda from HQ faceup and install Casting Call on that agenda as a hosted condition counter with text "Whenever the Runner accesses this agenda, he or she takes 2 tags."
data.title: Casting Call

data.text: Agendas accessed from this server cannot be stolen unless the Runner already has a copy of that agenda in his or her score area. This applies even during the run on which the Runner trashes Old Hollywood Grid. Limit 1 region per server.
data.title: Old Hollywood Grid

data.text:
Install Hollywood Renovation faceup.
Whenever you advance Hollywood Renovation, you may place 1 advancement token on another card that can be advanced (or 2 advancement tokens instead if there are 6 or more advancement tokens on Hollywood Renovation).
data.title: Hollywood Renovation

data.flavor: Sometimes corps have to bury projects, but that doesn't mean they can't make a profit on them.
data.text: Trash a card installed in a server and gain 3[credit] for each advancement token on that card.
data.title: Back Channels

data.flavor:
EXT. KANSAS - DAY
DOROTHY (Miranda) gazes out at the horizon. A sudden gust of wind catches her hair. Above the windblasted prairie loom ominous STORM CLOUDS.
DOROTHY: If only I wasn't in Kansas anymore.
She begins to hum a haunting melody.
data.title: Vanity Project

data.flavor: As the sun sank towards the horizon, the glittering lights of the expo remained dark. But the shanty city bloomed to life.
data.text:
Play only as your first [click].
The first time you access an agenda this turn, gain 7[credit].
data.title: Power to the People

data.flavor: Cowabunga, dude!
data.text: 2[credit]: Swap a piece of barrier ice currently being encountered with a piece of ice directly before or after it. The run continues from this new position. You are still encountering that ice.
data.title: Surfer

data.flavor: "First, you get a horde of zombies. Then you do whatever you want, 'cuz you have a horde of zombies." -Ji "Noise" Reilly
data.text: [trash]: The Corp cannot rez the outermost piece of ice during a run on any server this turn.
data.title: DDoS

data.text: The first time you make a successful run on a central server each turn, you may force the Corp to draw 1 card.
data.title: Laramy Fisk: Savvy Investor

data.flavor: "The secret to investing is networking." -Laramy Fisk
data.text:
Play only as your first [click].
Each player draws 3 cards.
data.title: Fisk Investment Seminar

data.text:
[click]: Host up to 3 cards from your grip facedown on Bookmark (you may look at these cards at any time).
[click] or [trash]: Add all cards on Bookmark to your grip.
data.title: Bookmark

data.flavor: "Our life is made by the death of others." -Leonardo Da Vinci
data.text:
Whenever you make a successful run, place 1 power counter on DaVinci.
[trash]: Install a card from your grip with an install cost equal to or less than the number of power counters on DaVinci, ignoring the install cost.
data.title: DaVinci
