data.flavor: Almost a zettabyte of data flows each minute through one of the many net pavilions scattered around the expo.
data.text:
As an additional cost to spend [click] to trash a resource (not through a card ability), the Corp must pay 2[credit].
<errata>Errata from FAQ 3.0.1</errata>
data.title: Wireless Net Pavilion

data.flavor: The Cybernetics Court has seven floors of attractions. The plasteel used to construct it was even more expensive than the thousands of cybernetic implants displayed inside.
data.text: Your maximum hand size is increased by 4.
data.title: Cybernetics Court

data.flavor: The SanSan Outlaws have a close relationship with Haas-Bioroid's sports engineering division, SHIFT.
data.text: Whenever you score an agenda, you may install a card from Archives or HQ, ignoring the install cost.
data.title: Team Sponsorship

data.text: For the first net damage the Runner suffers each turn, you may look at the Runner's grip and select the card that is trashed.
data.title: Chronos Protocol: Selective Mind-mapping

data.flavor: The more people submit their DNA and family history to the program, the more accurate it becomes.
data.text: Whenever the Runner jacks out, do 1 net damage.
data.title: Ancestral Imager

data.flavor: The Genetics Pavilion was designed by renowned architect Meru Mati II. It was built without the aid of bioroids, instead relying on human and clone labor.
data.text: The Runner cannot draw more than 2 cards during his or her turn.
data.title: Genetics Pavilion

data.flavor: There are over 20,000 brands represented in Franchise City, all of them owned by fewer than 100 corps.
data.text:
If the Runner accesses an agenda from R&D, he or she must reveal it.
When the Runner accesses an agenda, add Franchise City to your score area as an agenda worth 1 agenda point.
<errata>Errata from FAQ 4.2</errata>
data.title: Franchise City

data.text:
If the Runner accesses Product Placement from R&D, he or she must reveal it.
When the Runner accesses Product Placement, the Corp gains 2[credit]. Ignore this effect if Product Placement is accessed from Archives.
data.title: Product Placement

data.flavor: The holosculpture depicts the three inhabited worlds. The square can hold almost 1% of their total population.
data.text:
Worlds Plaza can host up to 3 assets.
[click]: Install an asset from HQ on Worlds Plaza and rez it, lowering its rez cost by 2, if able.
data.title: Worlds Plaza

data.text:
Place 3 power counters on Public Support when it is rezzed. When there are no power counters left on Public Support, add it to your score area as an agenda worth 1 agenda point.
When your turn begins, remove 1 power counter from Public Support.
data.title: Public Support

data.flavor: "Hello, and welcome to the Universe of Tomorrow! You could live for five-hundred years and not see all of the attractions I can tell you about."
data.text: Tour Guide gains "[subroutine] End the run." for each rezzed asset you have.
data.title: Tour Guide

data.flavor: The expo was built in the East California desert: a temporary city constructed for the advancement of humanity.
data.text: When your turn begins, gain 1[credit] if there is a rezzed asset installed in this server. Limit 1 region per server.
data.title: Expo Grid

data.text: When you score The Future is Now, search R&D for a card and add it to HQ. Shuffle R&D.
data.title: The Future is Now

data.text:
[click]: Flip this identity.
The Runner pays 1[credit] more when spending a [click] to remove a tag (not through a card ability).
Flip side:
[click]: Flip this identity.
You may pay 2[credit] fewer when spending a [click] to trash a resource (not through a card ability).
data.title: SYNC: Everything, Everywhere

data.flavor: Nothing but the Truth.
data.text: Whenever an agenda is scored or stolen, you may play 1 current from HQ or Archives (paying its play cost).
data.title: New Angeles Sol: Your News

data.flavor: We're ready to start the fire.
data.text: The first time each turn you rez an advertisement, the Runner loses 1[credit].
data.title: Spark Agency: Worldswide Reach

data.flavor: You had your shot, and you blew it.
data.text:
[click]: Shuffle 15 Minutes into R&D. The Corp can trigger this ability while 15 Minutes is in the Runner's score area.
Limit 1 per deck.
data.title: 15 Minutes

data.flavor: "The trick isn't software, it's hardware. Cyberspace is a collection of physical machines. If we control the machines, we control it all." -KR Kane, "Our Future"
data.text: All tracer ice have +1 strength. The base trace strength of each subroutine is increased by 1.
data.title: Improved Tracers

data.flavor: "Nobody ever lost a dollar by underestimating the taste of the public." -Phineas Taylor Barnum
data.text: All assets gain advertisement.
data.title: Rebranding Team

data.flavor: "Yes and No."
data.text:
If Quantum Predictive Model is accessed from R&D, the Runner must reveal it.
If the Runner is tagged when Quantum Predictive Model is accessed, add it to your score area.
data.title: Quantum Predictive Model

data.flavor: "Live from New Angeles, this is Lily Lockwell."
data.text: When you rez Lily Lockwell, draw 3 cards. [click], remove 1 tag: Search R&D for an operation, reveal it, and shuffle the rest of R&D. Add the operation to the top of R&D.
data.title: Lily Lockwell

data.text:
If News Team is accessed from R&D, the Runner must reveal it.
When the Runner accesses News Team, he or she must either take 2 tags or add News Team to his or her score area as an agenda worth -1 agenda point.
data.title: News Team

data.flavor: No one can bury a story better.
data.text:
[click]: Draw 1 card from the bottom of R&D.
[trash]: Search R&D or Archives for an agenda and reveal it. Shuffle the rest of R&D if you searched it. Add the agenda to the bottom of R&D.
data.title: Shannon Claire

data.text:
The Runner has 1 fewer [click] to spend during his or her turn.
If Victoria Jenkins is trashed while being accessed, add her to the Runner's score area as an agenda worth 2 agenda points.
data.title: Victoria Jenkins

data.flavor: "They're gonna try and make you a star. Whether you want it or not." -MaxX
data.text:
When you rez Reality Threedee, take 1 bad publicity.
When your turn begins, gain 1[credit] (or 2[credit] if the Runner is tagged).
data.title: Reality Threedee

data.text:
If Archangel is accessed from R&D, the Runner must reveal it.
If you pay 3[credit] when the Runner accesses Archangel, he or she immediately encounters it. Ignore this ability if Archangel is accessed from Archives.
[subroutine] <trace>Trace 6</trace> If successful, add 1 installed Runner card to his or her grip.
data.title: Archangel

data.flavor: "Most reporting these days can be done by AI. We just need the talent for the name recognition."
data.text: If a current is active, News Hound gains "[subroutine] End the run." after all its other subroutines. [subroutine] Trace 3 If successful, give the Runner 1 tag.
data.title: News Hound

data.flavor: "In the Olden Times, a 'resistor" was a vital component of practically all electronic equipment. You know, back when dinosaurs roamed the Earth." -Chaos Theory
data.text:
Resistor has +1 strength for each tag the Runner has.
[subroutine] <trace>Trace 4</trace> If successful, end the run.
data.title: Resistor

data.flavor: "If I didn't know better, I'd say they got the better end of that deal." -John Masanori
data.text: [subroutine] The Corp gains 5[credit]. Trash Special Offer.
data.title: Special Offer

data.flavor: //tl;dr duplicate the subs on the next piece of ice
data.text: [subroutine] When the Runner encounters the next piece of ice during this run, that ice gains a second copy of each subroutine on it (after the original subroutine) for the remainder of the encounter.
data.title: TL;DR

data.flavor: "Stay out of the fast lanes! If speed's your only concern, you're already tagged and halfway to fragged." -g00ru
data.text:
When the Runner encounters Turnpike, he or she loses 1[credit].
[subroutine] <trace>Trace 5</trace> If successful, give the Runner 1 tag.
data.title: Turnpike

data.flavor: The only thing worse than bad news...
data.text:
As an additional cost to play 24/7 News Cycle, forfeit an agenda.
Resolve the "when scored" ability on an agenda in your score area.
data.title: 24/7 News Cycle

data.text: As an additional cost to play this operation, spend [click]. Install and rez (paying all costs) X advertisements from Archives and/or HQ, if able.
data.title: Ad Blitz

data.text: This card is not trashed until another current is played or an agenda is stolen. Choose an agenda in the Runner's score area. Media Blitz gains the text of that agenda.
data.title: Media Blitz

data.flavor: "Only with perfect information can we develop the perfect strategy." -The Playbook
data.text:
Play only if the Runner is tagged.
Trash all resources. The Runner can remove 1 bad publicity to prevent this.
data.title: The All-Seeing I

data.text: This card is not trashed until another current is played or an agenda is stolen. The Runner must spend credits first for each trace attempt during a run.
data.title: Surveillance Sweep

data.flavor: "We use ice on our servers. More runners should ice their own rigs."
data.text: [trash], remove 1 tag: Trash 1 program. Use this ability only during a run on this server.
data.title: Keegan Lane

data.flavor: To the worlds sitting on the couch and watching threedee, Rutherford District might as well be all of New Angeles.
data.text: The base trace strength of each trace during a run on this server is increased by 2. Limit 1 region per server.
data.title: Rutherford Grid

data.flavor: "Corporations are made up of people. It's ridiculous to think they'd be either all good or all bad." -Sunny Lebeau
data.text: Global Food Initiative is worth 1 fewer agenda point while in the Runner's score area.
data.title: Global Food Initiative

data.text:
Place 6[credit] from the bank on Launch Campaign when it is rezzed. When there are no credits left on Launch Campaign, trash it.
When your turn begins, take 2[credit] from Launch Campaign.
data.title: Launch Campaign

data.flavor: Bounce rate is a well-understood measure of ice strength. But it is not the only measure.
data.text:
[subroutine] <trace>Trace 5</trace> If successful, do 3 net damage.
[subroutine] <trace>Trace 4</trace> If successful, trash 1 program.
data.title: Assassin

data.text: You cannot install non-virtual resources. When your turn begins, you may install 1 card from your grip facedown.
data.title: Apex: Invasive Predator

data.text:
Play only if you made a successful run on HQ, R&D and Archives this turn.
Trash all installed Corp cards. Turn all installed Runner cards facedown.
data.title: Apocalypse

data.text: Make a run. Once during this run, when you pass a piece of ice, you may trash a number of your installed cards equal to the strength of that ice. If you do, trash that ice.
data.title: Prey

data.flavor: "Meantime the hellish tattoo of the heart increased. It grew quicker and quicker, and louder and louder every instant." -Edgar Allan Poe
data.text: +1[mu] Trash an installed card: Prevent 1 damage. Limit 1 console per player.
data.title: Heartbeat

data.flavor: "I've been monitoring the anomaly's activity across the New Angeles Pacifica and Andea trunk lines and associated nodes. I have yet to detect a predictable pattern or even to formulate a theory as to the anomaly's nature." -Joséo Greene, SYNC Analyst
data.text: Trash an installed card: Break "[subroutine] End the run." subroutine.
data.title: Endless Hunger

data.text: When Harbinger is trashed, install it facedown instead of adding it to your heap.
data.title: Harbinger

data.flavor: "There's parts of the Network now that are different from how they used to be. I can't put my finger on it; just something twitching at my ganglion through my BMI." -Reeve
data.text:
Once per turn, prevent a "when encountered" ability on a piece of ice.
[trash]: Install the top 3 cards of your stack facedown.
data.title: Hunting Grounds

data.flavor: Data goes in. Nothing comes out.
data.text: The first time each turn you trash 1 of your installed cards, gain 1[credit].
data.title: Wasteland

data.text: You start the game with 3 different directive cards installed (these cards are not considered part of your deck).
data.title: Adam: Compulsive Hacker

data.flavor: Adam raised the hammer. He was free.
data.text: Trash up to 5 of your installed cards. Draw 1 card for each card trashed (or 2 cards for each card trashed if you trashed at least 1 directive).
data.title: Independent Thinking

data.text: +X[mu] Your maximum hand size is increased by X. X is equal to the number of agenda points you have. Limit 1 console per player.
data.title: Brain Chip

data.flavor: Bioroids have two brains running in parallel, each capable of running sophisticated programming. There are certain advantages to the setup.
data.text:
2[recurring-credit]
Use these credits to pay for using programs.
data.title: Multithreader

data.flavor: The Second Directive requires a bioroid to complete its primary function above all other considerations, save the First Directive.
data.text: Your first [click] each turn must be spent to make a run or a play a run event. Once per turn, you can spend [click][click] to break a subroutine on a piece of ice currently being encountered.
data.title: Always Be Running

data.flavor: "You look tore up, kid. Have a seat, I'll fire up the arc welder."
data.text: When your turn begins, choose one of your installed cards. The text box of that card is blank for the remainder of the turn.
data.title: Dr. Lovegood

data.flavor: The Third Directive requires a bioroid to preserve its ability to function and report frequently to Haas-Bioroid for repairs and updates.
data.text:
The first time each turn you access a card with a trash cost, you must trash it by paying its trash cost, if able.
Whenever you access cards from HQ, access 1 additional card.
data.title: Neutralize All Threats

data.flavor: The First Directive forbids a bioroid from harming, or through inaction allowing harm to befall, a human being.
data.text:
Your maximum hand size is reduced by 2.
When your turn ends, draw 1 card if you do not have cards in your grip equal to or greater than your maximum hand size.
data.title: Safety First

data.flavor: "Mommy will be home soon, sweetie. She has to kick some ass first."
data.title: Sunny Lebeau: Security Specialist

data.flavor: Fortunately, Globalsec buys them by the case.
data.text: [trash]: Choose an icebreaker (or any number of cloud icebreakers). Each chosen icebreaker has +1 strength for each [link] you have for the remainder of this run. Use this ability only during a run.
data.title: Security Chip

data.text: +1[mu] +1[link] Once per turn, when you encounter a piece of ice, you may force the Corp to "trace 5 If successful, give the Runner 1 tag and end the run. If unsuccessful, the Runner bypasses the currently encountered ice." Limit 1 console per player.
data.title: Security Nexus

data.flavor: Bigger.
data.text: If you have at least 2[link], the memory cost of GS Striker M1 is 0, even if it is not installed. 2[credit]: Break any number of code gate subroutines. 2[credit]: +3 strength.
data.title: GS Striker M1

data.flavor: Badder.
data.text: If you have at least 2[link], the memory cost of GS Shrike M2 is 0, even if it is not installed. 2[credit]: Break any number of sentry subroutines. 2[credit]: +3 strength.
data.title: GS Shrike M2

data.flavor: Boom.
data.text: If you have at least 2[link], the memory cost of GS Sherman M3 is 0, even if it is not installed. 2[credit]: Break any number of barrier subroutines. 2[credit]: +3 strength.
data.title: GS Sherman M3

data.flavor: She approached the server, flashed her credentials, and passed straight through. She wondered what it said about her that doing things the legal way felt like cheating.
data.text:
Install only if you have at least 2[link].
When your turn begins, you may lose [click]. If you do, look at the top card of R&D.
data.title: Globalsec Security Clearance

data.flavor: "I got an early start today...or maybe I forgot to go home last night."
data.text:
Reduce the cost to install Jak Sinclair by 1 for each [link] you have.
When your turn begins, you may make a run. You cannot use programs during this run.
data.title: Jak Sinclair

data.flavor: "Are you crazy? We can't send in prisec until the media gets bored and goes home."
data.text: This card is not trashed until another current is played or an agenda is scored. The Corp's identity text box is blank.
data.title: Employee Strike

data.flavor: She tried to remember who he was. Not that it mattered anymore.
data.text: Shuffle your stack. Trash the top card of your stack. Gain X[credit] where X is equal to the install cost of that card.
data.title: Windfall

data.flavor: Technically correct: the best kind of correct.
data.text:
Whenever you install a piece of hardware or a program, place 1[credit] from the bank on Technical Writer.
[click],[trash]: Take all credits from Technical Writer.
data.title: Technical Writer

data.flavor: "While there have been other anti-corporation movements before, like the Maroon Wave, this new one is different. It's organized." -Ramesh Gupta, One World Economy
data.text: Make a run. When the run ends, trash 1 piece of ice that was rezzed during this run.
data.title: Run Amok

data.text:
[trash]: Prevent up to X net or brain damage. Trash cards from the top of your stack equal to the amount of damage prevented. X is the number of copies of Ramujan-reliant 550 BMI installed (including the one just trashed).
Limit 6 per deck.
data.title: Ramujan-reliant 550 BMI

data.flavor: The greatest trick is not the trick itself, but in making someone believe that it is no trick at all. To your average sysop, it's magic. To your average runner, it's a closely held trade secret.
data.text: Unbroken subroutines resolve in the order of your choice.
data.title: Street Magic

data.text: Make a run on a server with at least 1 piece of unrezzed ice. When the run ends, gain 12[credit] if it was successful.
data.title: High-Stakes Job

data.flavor: It is the hardest thing in the world to frighten a mongoose, because he is eaten up from nose to tail with curiosity. The motto of all the mongoose family is "Run and find out". -Rudyard Kipling, Rikki-Tikki-Tavi
data.text: You cannot use Mongoose to break subroutines on more than one ice per run. 1[credit]: Break up to 2 sentry subroutines. 2[credit]: +2 strength.
data.title: Mongoose

data.flavor: "Mirrormode on."
data.text: Avoid the first tag during each run.
data.title: Jesminder Sareen: Girl Behind the Curtain

data.text: +2[mu] Once per turn, immediately after you access a card from R&D, you may add that card to the bottom of R&D. If you do, take 1 tag. Limit 1 console per player.
data.title: Maya

data.flavor: "The basics should be like the stories you learned as a child - unconscious, never forgotten, and suddenly relevant at the most random times." -g00ru
data.text: Once per turn, when you encounter a piece of ice, you may have it gain 1 subtype of your choice that is not sentry, code gate, or barrier for the remainder of this run.
data.title: Panchatantra

data.flavor: "We can forgive a man for making a useful thing as long as he does not admire it. The only excuse for making a useless thing is that one admires it intensely." -Oscar Wilde
data.text: Forfeit an agenda: Search your stack for a card and install it (paying the install cost). Shuffle your stack.
data.title: Artist Colony

data.flavor: Legions of software engineers have been manufactured within its halls.
data.text:
[click]: Place 1 power counter on Chatterjee University.
[click]: Install a program from your grip, lowering the install cost by 1 for each power counter on Chatterjee University. Remove 1 hosted power counter.
data.title: Chatterjee University

data.flavor: "I don't want a hopper. I've never even owned one. But every time I jack in, that same damn ad loads." -2xTiger
data.text: The first time the Runner initiates a run each turn, you may draw 1 card or gain 1[credit].
data.title: Advanced Concept Hopper

data.text:
The Runner can spend [click] to break any subroutine on Vikram 1.0.
[subroutine] The Runner cannot use programs for the remainder of this run.
[subroutine] <trace>Trace 4</trace> If successful, do 1 brain damage.
[subroutine] <trace>Trace 4</trace> If successful, do 1 brain damage.
data.title: Vikram 1.0

data.flavor: It is only by respecting the past that we can build a better future.
data.text: This card costs 0 influence if you have 6 or more non-alliance [jinteki] cards in your deck. Draw 3 cards. Add 1 card from HQ to the top of R&D.
data.title: Heritage Committee

data.text: Whenever the Runner passes a piece of ice protecting this server, you may swap that ice with another piece of ice protecting this server. Limit 1 region per server.
data.title: Mumbad City Grid

data.flavor: "A new property has two, maybe three hours. If it doesn't sell, cut it and move on."
data.text:
When your turn begins, you may look at the top card of the Runner's stack.
[trash]: The Runner trashes the top card of his or her stack.
data.title: Kala Ghoda Real TV

data.text: [subroutine] For the remainder of this run, the Runner must pay 1[credit] as an additional cost each time he or she uses an icebreaker to break at least 1 subroutine. [subroutine] For the remainder of this run, the Runner must pay 1[credit] as an additional cost each time he or she uses an icebreaker to break at least 1 subroutine.
data.title: Interrupt 0

data.flavor: "Never cut the ribbon until you have something to show off." -Eta Shah, VP Global Expansion
data.text: Place 3 advancement tokens on a faceup card. You cannot score that card until your next turn begins.
data.title: Dedication Ceremony

data.flavor: Those who are the wisest know the least.
data.text:
This card costs 0 influence if you have 15 or fewer ice in your deck.
2[recurring-credit]
Use these credits to rez cards.
data.title: Mumba Temple

data.flavor: "And here we see the Polar Bear, once the largest land carnivore on Earth."
data.text:
This card costs 0 influence if you have 50 or more cards in your deck.
When your turn begins, you may shuffle 1 card from Archives into R&D.
<errata>Errata from FAQ 3.1</errata>
data.title: Museum of History

data.flavor: "No! Don't set that off HERE!"
data.text: [trash]: The Corp cannot rez more than 1 piece of ice for the remainder of this run. Use this ability only during a run.
data.title: EMP Device

data.text:
When Diwan is installed, choose a server. As an additional cost to install a card in or protecting that server, the Corp must pay 1[credit].
Trash Diwan if the Corp purges virus counters.
data.title: Diwan

data.flavor: <champion>Designed by 2013 World Champion Jens Erickson</champion>
data.text: Make a run on HQ. If successful, instead of accessing cards, the Corp adds all cards in HQ to the top of R&D in the order of his or her choice.
data.title: CBI Raid

data.flavor: "Why would you dispose of perfectly good evidence when you can sell it?"
data.text: Whenever you use a [trash] ability, gain 1[credit].
data.title: Tech Trader

data.text:
NetChip can host a program with a memory cost less than or equal to the number of copies of NetChip installed. The memory cost of the hosted program does not count against your memory limit.
Limit 6 per deck.
data.title: NetChip

data.flavor: "We may be outraged, but we're not surprised." -Sunder
data.text: This card is not trashed until another current is played or an agenda is scored. The Corp has 1 additional bad publicity (even if they have 0).
data.title: Corporate Scandal

data.flavor: "The corporations may be stronger than any of us, but they are not stronger than all of us." -Akshara Sareen
data.text: Play only if you have at least 1 seedy card installed. The Corp has 1 fewer [click] to spend on his or her next turn.
data.title: Populist Rally

data.text:
When you rez Advanced Assembly Lines, gain 3[credit].
[trash]: Install a non-agenda card from HQ (paying the install cost). You cannot use this ability during a run.
data.title: Advanced Assembly Lines

data.text: Whenever you rez a card, place 1 power counter on Lakshmi Smartfabrics. X hosted power counters: Reveal an agenda worth X points from HQ. The Runner cannot steal copies of that agenda for the remainder of this turn.
data.title: Lakshmi Smartfabrics

data.text: This card costs 0 influence if you have 6 or more non-alliance [haas-bioroid] cards in your deck. Trash a rezzed asset or upgrade. If you do, gain credits equal to its trash cost.
data.title: Product Recall

data.flavor: We Are What We Eat.
data.text: The first time each turn the Runner draws a card, gain 1[credit].
data.title: Pālanā Foods: Sustainable Growth

data.flavor: Expensive to build but dramatically more efficient than traditional farming, agroplexes are emblems of the inevitable corporatization of the food industry.
data.text: When your turn begins, each player draws 1 card.
data.title: Pālanā Agroplex

data.flavor: "We can help others, yet also help ourselves." -Soraiya Suresh, VP Public Programs
data.text:
[subroutine] The Runner draws 3 cards and then discards down to his or her maximum hand size.
[subroutine] The Runner draws 3 cards and then discards down to his or her maximum hand size.
data.title: Harvester

data.flavor: Data, not food, is one of the biggest exports from the Gujarat district of Mumbad.
data.text: Your maximum hand size is increased by 2.
data.title: Remote Data Farm

data.text:
If Disposable HQ is accessed from R&D, the Runner must reveal it.
When the Runner accesses Disposable HQ, you may add any number of cards from HQ to the bottom of R&D.
data.title: Disposable HQ

data.text:
Install New Construction faceup.
Whenever you advance New Construction, you may install a card from HQ in a new server (and rez that card ignoring all costs if there are 5 or more advancement tokens on New Construction).
data.title: New Construction

data.text:
When your turn begins, place 1 advancement token on Mumbad Construction Co.
2[credit]: Move 1 advancement token from Mumbad Construction Co. to a faceup card.
data.title: Mumbad Construction Co.

data.flavor: "You got it. We sell it. They buy it. Everyone wins."
data.text:
When you score Corporate Sales Team, place 10[credit] on it.
When each player's turn begins, take 1[credit] from Corporate Sales Team.
data.title: Corporate Sales Team

data.text:
This card costs 0 influence if you have 3 PAD Campaigns in your deck.
[click]: Place 1 advancement token on a card. You cannot score that card until your next turn begins.
data.title: PAD Factory

data.text: Make a run on Archives. If successful, instead of accessing cards, add Political Graffiti to an agenda in the Corp's score area as a hosted condition counter with the text "This agenda is worth -1 agenda points. Trash Political Graffiti if the Corp purges virus counters."
data.title: Political Graffiti

data.flavor: "Credits spend anywhere in the worlds, but there are other forms of currency."
data.text: Once per turn, you may jack out when you encounter a sentry.
data.title: Nero Severn: Information Broker

data.flavor: "I'm on a need-to-know basis. I need to know everything." -Nero Severn
data.text: +1[mu] +1[link] Whenever you jack out, the Corp reveals 1 card from HQ at random. Limit 1 console per player.
data.title: Reflection

data.text:
[click]: Look at the top X cards of your stack and arrange them in any order. X is the number of copies of Spy Camera installed.
[trash]: Look at the top card of R&D.
Limit 6 per deck.
data.title: Spy Camera

data.flavor: Leverage, secrets, access, and influence are currency as valuable as credits. But credits work, too.
data.text: Install only if you made a successful run on HQ this turn. [trash], pay the trash cost of a rezzed card: Trash that card.
data.title: Political Operative

data.flavor: The Creator.
data.text: 1[credit]: Break ice subroutine on a piece of ice with 3 or more subtypes. 1[credit]: +1 strength. 2[credit]: Swap Sadyojata with a deva program from your grip.
data.title: Sadyojata

data.text: This card is not trashed until another current is played or an agenda is scored. When you steal an agenda, add "Freedom Through Equality" to your score area as an agenda worth 1 agenda point.
data.title: "Freedom Through Equality"

data.flavor: "Our shared humanity is our greatest strength. And as we share more broadly, our strength grows, not dwindles."
data.text: Each player has 1 additional [click] to spend during his or her turn.
data.title: Akshara Sareen

data.flavor: "Bureaucracy and red tape have been weaponized." -Fake-ir
data.text: Whenever the Corp rezzes an asset or upgrade, you may pay credits equal to its rez cost and trash Councilman. If you do, derez that asset or upgrade. The Corp cannot rez it for the remainder of this turn.
data.title: Councilman

data.text:
Place 3 agenda counters on Voting Machine Initiative when you score it.
When the Runner's turn begins, you may spend 1 hosted agenda counter. If you do, the Runner loses [click], if able.
data.title: Voting Machine Initiative

data.flavor: "Our research says the public views clones as more human than bioroids. Historically, this has been a liability. Let's make it a strength."
data.text: When your turn begins, you may add 1 operation from Archives to HQ if there is no ice protecting this server.
data.title: Clone Suffrage Movement

data.flavor: "There's no conflict of interest here. These are complex issues with highly technical minutiae. It's only natural that the experts should lay down the guidelines."
data.text: When your turn begins, do 1 net damage if there is no ice protecting this server.
data.title: Bio-Ethics Association

data.flavor: "Politics is a dirty business. But so is business." -Krishnan Sareen
data.text: Whenever you draw an agenda, you may reveal and install it.
data.title: Political Dealings

data.text: This card is not trashed until another current is played or an agenda is stolen. When you score an agenda, add "Clones are not People" to your score area as an agenda worth 1 agenda point.
data.title: "Clones are not People"

data.flavor: Being a Mumbad sensie star means a glamorous life, though it is lived in constant fear of blackmail-or worse-from orgcrime.
data.text: When your turn begins, you may draw 3 cards if there is no ice protecting this server. If you do, add 1 card from HQ to the bottom of R&D.
data.title: Sensie Actors Union

data.flavor: "Money is speech and I am listening intently." -Krishnan Sareen
data.text: When your turn begins, gain 3[credit] if there is no ice protecting this server.
data.title: Commercial Bankers Group

data.flavor: Mumbad's public city corporation is tightly connected to all the other corporations.
data.text: [click]: Search R&D for an alliance card, reveal it, and play or install it (paying all costs). Shuffle R&D.
data.title: Mumbad City Hall

data.flavor: Efficiency means profiting from things everyone was doing anyway.
data.text:
Whenever the Runner breaks a subroutine on Bailiff, gain 1[credit].
[subroutine] End the run.
data.title: Bailiff

data.flavor: The political centre of Mumbad.
data.text: Whenever you rez a card in or protecting this server (not including Surat City Grid), you may rez another card, lowering the rez cost by 2. Limit 1 region per server.
data.title: Surat City Grid

data.flavor: Sometimes in an instant you realize who your friends really are.
data.text:
Play only as your first [click].
Look at the top 6 cards of your stack. You may trash any of those cards and arrange the rest in any order.
data.title: Making an Entrance

data.flavor: "Underestimate those people at your own peril." -Akshara Sareen
data.text:
Once per turn, you may pay the trash cost of a card you access that is not in Archives to remove that card from the game.

data.title: Salsette Slums

data.flavor: The more parties she attended, the more they trusted her. The more they trusted her, the more entertaining her scams became.

Draw 1 card. Gain 1[credit] for each copy of Exclusive Party in your heap.
Limit 6 per deck.
data.title: Exclusive Party

data.flavor: The Preserver.
data.text: 1[credit]: Break ice subroutine on a piece of ice with exactly 1 subroutine. 1[credit]: +1 strength. 2[credit]: Swap Vamadeva with a deva program from your grip.
data.title: Vamadeva

data.text:
When your turn begins, you may choose a server.
The first time you make a successful run on that server this turn, instead of accessing cards, draw 2 cards.

data.flavor: "Check out my new ride." -2xTiger
data.text:
+1[link]
[trash]: Draw 3 cards.

data.flavor: In these days of digital full-sim browsing and widely available nano-assembly, it takes a special kind of crazy person to go shopping in meatspace. There are millions of them.
data.text: Whenever you install a piece of hardware from your grip, you may install another copy of that hardware from your grip (paying all costs).
data.title: Bazaar

data.text: Whenever the Runner searches his or her stack or installs a card from his or her heap, he or she must trash a card from his or her grip at random.
data.title: Personality Profiles

data.flavor: "Very good, sir."
data.text: This card costs 0 influence if you have 6 or more non-alliance [haas-bioroid] cards in your deck. The first time you spend 3[click] on the same action each turn, gain [click].
data.title: Jeeves Model Bioroids

data.text: This card costs 0 influence if you have 6 or more non-alliance [jinteki] cards in your deck. Once per turn, you may lose [click] when you draw a card. If you do, reveal that card and a card in Archives of the same type, then swap those cards.
data.title: Raman Rai

data.flavor: "Connect two truths. Connect two programs. All is one."
data.text: [subroutine] You and the Runner secretly spend 0[credit], 1[credit], or 2[credit]. Reveal spent credits. If you and the Runner spent a different number of credits, the Runner loses 2[credit]. [subroutine] Resolve a subroutine on a piece of rezzed psi ice.

data.flavor: "As the world shrinks, communications becomes the most essential technology." -Ramesh Gupta, One World Economy

data.text:
[subroutine] Each player gains 2[credit].
[subroutine] You and the Runner secretly spend 0[credit], 1[credit], or 2[credit]. Reveal spent credits. If you and the Runner spent a different number of credits, do 1 net damage for each card in the Runner's grip.
data.title: Chetana

data.text: Whenever the Runner makes a successful run, you may place 1 advancement token on a card that can be advanced.
data.title: Puppet Master

data.text: [subroutine]<trace>Trace 5</trace> If successful, the Runner reveals his or her grip. Trash each of those cards with a play or install cost equal to or less than the amount by which your trace strength exceeded his or her link strength.
data.title: Waiver

data.text:
Play only if the Runner is tagged.
Swap an agenda in your score area with an agenda in the Runner's score area.
data.title: Exchange of Information

data.text: [subroutine] All ice has +3 strength for the remainder of this run.
data.title: Red Tape

data.text: This card costs 0 influence if you have 6 or more non-alliance [weyland-consortium] cards in your deck. As an additional cost to play this operation, spend [click]. Search R&D for an operation and play it (paying all costs). Shuffle R&D.
data.title: Consulting Visit

data.text: [subroutine] End the run.
data.title: Vanilla

data.text:
Make a run on HQ. If successful, instead of accessing cards, force the Corp to trash the top card of R&D. You may reveal X copies of Fear the Masses from your grip to force the Corp to trash X additional cards.
Limit 6 per deck.
data.title: Fear the Masses

data.flavor: The Destroyer.
data.text: 1[credit]: Break ice subroutine on a piece of ice that has a rez cost of 5 or greater. 1[credit]: +1 strength. 2[credit]: Swap Aghora with a deva program from your grip.
data.title: Aghora

data.flavor: "They don't want to listen, so we'll just have to crank up the volume."
data.text: The first time you make a successful run on HQ each turn, force the Corp to trash the top card of R&D.
data.title: Bhagat

data.text:
The Corp cannot win the game unless the Runner is flatlined.
When your turn begins, place 1 power counter on The Black File. When there are 3 or more power counters on The Black File, remove it from the game.
Limit 1 per deck.
data.title: The Black File

data.text: As an additional cost to play this event, trash an installed connection. The Corp cannot advance cards during his or her next turn. Remove The Price of Freedom from the game instead of trashing it.
data.title: The Price of Freedom

data.text: If you use Ankusa to break all subroutines on a barrier during a single encounter, add that barrier to HQ. 2[credit]: Break barrier subroutine. 1[credit]: +1 strength.
data.title: Ankusa

data.text: Secretly spend up to 2[credit]. The Corp guesses how much you spent. Reveal spent credits. If the Corp guessed incorrectly, make a run and choose a piece of ice protecting the attacked server. Bypass that ice when you encounter it.
data.title: Rigged Results

data.flavor: "When the enemy has mastered the battlefield, change the battlefield." -The Playbook
data.text:
When you rez Magnet, host a program on it that is hosted on an installed piece of ice.
The text box of each program hosted on Magnet is blank.
[subroutine] End the run.
data.title: Magnet

data.flavor: "Practical effects are expensive, but worth it. I had to smash seventeen stunt bioroids to get this shot." -Parvati Kapoor, director
data.text: Gain 4[credit]. You may install 1 card (paying the install cost).
data.title: Lateral Growth

data.flavor: They eat us, we eat them, the cycle goes on and on. -Omar Keung, "the Flashpoint"
data.text: When Improved Protein Source is scored or stolen, the Runner gains 4[credit].
data.title: Improved Protein Source

data.text:
Play only if there is an agenda in the Runner's score area.
You and the Runner secretly spend 0[credit], 1[credit], or 2[credit]. Reveal spent credits. If you and the Runner spent a different number of credits, trash 1 resource.
data.title: Voter Intimidation

data.flavor: We Know What You Want.
data.text: If the Runner is tagged, he or she plays with his or her grip revealed.
data.title: Harishchandra Ent.: Where You're the Star

data.flavor: The costumes aren't strictly necessary, but they improve the performances of the vactors and sensie stars.
data.text:
Full Immersion RecStudio can host up to 2 assets and/or agendas.
The trash cost of Full Immersion RecStudio is increased by 3 for each card hosted on it.
data.title: Full Immersion RecStudio

data.text: This card costs 0 influence if you have 6 or more non-alliance [nbn] cards in your deck. As an additional cost to rez Ibrahim Salem, forfeit an agenda. When your turn begins, name a card type. Look at the Runner's grip and trash 1 card in it of the named type.
data.title: Ibrahim Salem

data.flavor: The entertainment capital of Mumbad.
data.text: During a run on this server, the Runner cannot use paid abilities on non-icebreaker cards. Limit 1 region per server.
data.title: Navi Mumbai City Grid

data.text:
Zealous Judge can only be rezzed if the Runner is tagged.
[click], 1[credit]: Give the Runner 1 tag.
data.title: Zealous Judge

data.flavor: "A new administration means we have to start greasing the wheels all over again. Let's get to work."
data.text: Trash all cards in HQ (minimum of 1). Draw 5 cards.
data.title: Election Day

data.flavor: Judicious use of freelancers can increase efficiency and protect the company from legal repercussions. It's what they call a "win-win".
data.text:
Play only if the Runner is tagged.
Play up to 2 operations from HQ (paying all costs), resolving them one at a time.
data.title: Subcontract

data.flavor: Survival of the fittest' is so outdated; in finance it's 'survival of the fattest.' -Omar Keung, "the Flashpoint"
data.text: Merger is worth 1 additional agenda point while in the Runner's score area.
data.title: Merger

data.text: This card is not trashed until another current is played or an agenda is scored. Whenever the Corp draws 1 or more cards, he or she loses 1[credit] if it is not the first time he or she has drawn cards this turn.
data.title: System Outage

data.text: Once per turn, when you encounter a piece of ice, you may trash 1 card from your grip. If you do, that ice has -2 strength for the remainder of this run.
data.title: Null: Whistleblower

data.flavor: Sometimes the itsy-bitsy data is most important.
data.text: Whenever you approach a piece of ice, you may expose it. You may then trash GPI Net Tap to jack out.
data.title: GPI Net Tap

data.flavor: "Take it from me, there is a point where you have so much money you stop caring. That's usually right before it all comes tumbling down."
data.text: If the Corp has at least 10[credit], as an additional cost to rez each piece of ice, the Corp must spend credits equal to the number of subroutines on that ice.
data.title: Hernando Cortez

data.text: +2[mu] Whenever you make a successful run on R&D, you may replace 1 spent recurring credit. Limit 1 console per player.
data.title: Mirror

data.flavor: In running, as in reality, all elements are connected.
data.text: 2[credit]: Break all subroutines. Use this ability only by spending credits from stealth cards. 1[credit]: +1 strength.
data.title: Dai V

data.text: This card is not trashed until another current is played or an agenda is scored. Whenever you steal an agenda, force the Corp to "Trace 0 If unsuccessful, the Runner gains credits equal to the number of agenda points in both players' score areas."
data.title: Another Day, Another Paycheck

data.flavor: <champion>Designed by 2014 World Champion Dan D'Argenio</champion>
data.text:
Resolve two of the following in any order:
  • Gain 3[credit].
  • Draw 2 cards.
  • Remove 1 tag.
  • Expose 1 piece of ice, then make a run.
data.title: Deuces Wild

data.flavor: They call it "running" because jacking in is mentally and physically exhausting.
data.text: Make a run and choose an icebreaker. That icebreaker has +2 strength for the remainder of this run.
data.title: Injection Attack

data.flavor: I foresee the end of all things...
data.text:
The Runner can spend [click] to break any subroutine on Fairchild 1.0.
[subroutine]The Runner must pay 1[credit] or trash 1 of his or her installed cards.
[subroutine]The Runner must pay 1[credit] or trash 1 of his or her installed cards.
data.title: Fairchild 1.0

data.text:
The Runner can spend [click][click] to break up to 2 subroutines on Sherlock 2.0.
[subroutine]<trace>Trace 4</trace> If successful, add 1 installed program to the bottom of the Runner's stack.
[subroutine]<trace>Trace 4</trace> If successful, add 1 installed program to the bottom of the Runner's stack.
[subroutine]Give the Runner 1 tag.
data.title: Sherlock 2.0

data.flavor: "I'm telling you, free up the emergency accounts. Something's coming; I haven't seen a reaction like that since the tsunami. My god, the screaming..."
data.text: The first time each turn you reveal secretly spent credits, gain that many credits.
data.title: Hyoubu Research Facility

data.text:
If Chrysalis is accessed from R&D, the Runner must reveal it.
When the Runner accesses Chrysalis, he or she encounters it. Ignore this ability if the Runner accesses Chrysalis from Archives.
[subroutine] Do 2 net damage.
data.title: Chrysalis

data.flavor: "Your mistake is thinking that it's just business, when really it's a war."
data.text:
Whenever the Runner makes an unsuccessful run on this server, do 1 net damage.
2[credit]: Move Georgia Emelyov to another server.
data.title: Georgia Emelyov

data.flavor: "Person of interest. Noun. Someone who is about to get ****ed by a corp." - Anarch's Dictionary, Volume Who's Counting
data.text: The rez cost of the first piece of ice you rez each turn is lowered by 1 for each tag the Runner has.
data.title: Watchdog

data.text:
After you resolve this operation, end your action phase.
Play only if the Runner made a run during his or her last turn.
<trace>Trace 4</trace> If successful, give the Runner 4 tags.
data.title: Hard-Hitting News

data.text: The first time the Runner trashes an installed Corp card each turn, you may <trace>trace 4</trace> If successful, give the Runner 1 tag (cannot be avoided).
data.title: NBN: Controlling the Message

data.flavor: "For the duration of the emergency" is code for "this is the way things are now."
data.text: If the Runner is tagged, Crisis Management gains "When your turn begins, do 1 meat damage."
data.title: Crisis Management

data.flavor: A stock dropping sharply is bad for shareholders, but not neccessarily bad for the company.
data.text:
After you resolve this operation, end your action phase.
Gain 3[credit] for each agenda in the Runner's score area.
data.title: Stock Buy-Back

data.flavor: Money is power.
data.text: If you have at least 10[credit], each piece of ice has +1 strength for every 5[credit] in your credit pool.
data.title: Sandburg

data.text: Make a run. Trash the first non-agenda card you access during this run at no cost. The Corp can spend credits equal to the rez or play cost of the accessed card to prevent this trash.
data.title: Credit Crash

data.flavor: "You can have a lot of fun in 23 seconds." -Princess Space Kitten
data.text: This card is not trashed until another current is played or an agenda is scored. The text box of each unique non-region asset and upgrade is blank.
data.title: Rumor Mill

data.flavor: Balance out the equation.
data.text: When an encounter in which you used Nfr to break all subroutines on that piece of ice ends, place 1 power counter on Nfr. Nfr has +1 strength for each power counter on it. 1[credit]: Break barrier subroutine.
data.title: Nfr

data.flavor: "It is not wise to call someone crazy until you fully understand what they're trying to say." -Omar Keung
data.text: Whenever you encounter a barrier, you may install Paperclip from your heap (paying its install cost). X[credit]: +X strength. Break up to X barrier subroutines, if able.
data.title: Paperclip

data.flavor: The program was as close to a hunting raptor as she could afford...for now.
data.text: 2[credit]: Break up to 2 sentry subroutines. 2[credit]: +4 strength. 2[credit], return Golden to your grip: Derez a sentry. Use this ability only after using Golden to break all the subroutines on that sentry during a single encounter.
data.title: Golden

data.flavor: "The best part is, it's legal!" -Khan
data.text:
Choose a server and place 20[credit] from the bank on Temüjin Contract when you install it. When there are no credits left on Temüjin Contract, trash it.
Whenever you make a successful run on the chosen server, take 4[credit] from Temüjin Contract.
data.title: Temüjin Contract

data.text: The first time you pass a piece of ice each turn, you may install an icebreaker from your hand, lowering the install cost by 1.
data.title: Khan: Savvy Skiptracer

data.flavor: Once a security flaw is identified, there's only a limited window to exploit it before it's patched. Runners call this period "open season."
data.text: Make a run on R&D. If successful, you may make another run on R&D when this run ends.
data.title: Data Breach

data.text:
When your turn begins, you may move up to 3[credit] from your credit pool to Algo Trading.
When your turn begins, place 2[credit] on Algo Trading from the bank if there are at least 6[credit] on it.
[click],[trash]: Take all credits from Algo Trading.
data.title: Algo Trading

data.flavor: "Coming to you live from the front lines, for now, unless they kill me..."
data.text:
If the Corp has 5-9[credit] when your turn begins, gain 1[credit].
If the Corp has 10-14[credit] when your turn begins, draw 1 card.
If the Corp has at least 15[credit] when your turn begins, gain [click].
data.title: Beth Kilrain-Chang

data.flavor: To threaten my treasures is to incur my wrath.
data.text:
The Runner can spend [click][click] to break up to 2 subroutines on Fairchild 2.0.
[subroutine] The Runner must pay 2[credit] or trash 1 of his or her installed cards.
[subroutine] The Runner must pay 2[credit] or trash 1 of his or her installed cards.
[subroutine] Do 1 brain damage.
data.title: Fairchild 2.0

data.flavor: First, blend with the attacker. Then, control the attack.
data.text:
[subroutine] You and the Runner secretly spend 0[credit], 1[credit], or 2[credit]. Reveal spent credits. If you and the Runner spent a different number of credits, the Runner draws 2 cards.
[subroutine] Do 1 net damage.
[subroutine] Do 1 net damage.
data.title: Aiki

data.flavor: "Eiko here. It's done."
data.text:
As an additional cost to play this operation, spend [click].
<trace>Trace 3</trace> If successful, trash an installed card that does not match the faction of the Runner's identity.
data.title: Enforcing Loyalty

data.flavor: "SELL!! Buy platinum, but GET OUT OF THE TT CREDIT! It is TOXIC!"
data.text: As an additional cost to play this operation, spend [click]. Trace 5 If successful, add an installed non-virtual card to the Runner's grip.
data.title: Hatchet Job

data.flavor: By the time the report of Emelyov's murder was produced, there had already been a dozen more, hitting all the corps.
data.text: Shuffle any number of cards from HQ into R&D. Draw that number of cards.
data.title: Special Report

data.text:
When your turn begins, you may move up to 3[credit] from your credit pool to C.I. Fund.
When your turn begins, place 2[credit] on C.I. Fund from the bank if there are at least 6[credit] on it.
2[credit],[trash]: Take all credits from C.I. Fund.
data.title: C.I. Fund

data.flavor: What's a little insurance fraud between friends?
data.text:
As an additional cost to play this operation, spend [click].
Trash any number of your rezzed cards and gain 3[credit] for each card trashed.
data.title: Liquidation

data.flavor: Strength makes leaders.
data.text:
The first time an encounter with a piece of ice with at least 1 advancement token ends each turn, do 1 meat damage.
<errata>Errata from FAQ 3.1.1</errata>
data.title: Weyland Consortium: Builder of Nations

data.flavor: She'd never heard her dads argue like this. Not ever. She'd give anything to make it stop.
data.text:
Play only if the Runner has at least 6[credit].
The Runner loses 2[credit] for each installed resource. The Runner can trash a resource to prevent this.
data.title: Financial Collapse

data.flavor: "While the money pooled at the top, the power went with it, until there were two sets of laws: one for them, one for us" -Omar Keung, the Flashpoint
data.text: If the Runner accesses Prisec while installed, you may pay 2[credit] to give the Runner 1 tag and do 1 meat damage.
data.title: Prisec

data.text: +1[mu] Your maximum hand size is increased by 1 for each tag you have. The first time a successful run on R&D or HQ ends each turn, draw 1 card for each card you accessed during that run. Limit 1 console per player.
data.title: Obelus

data.flavor: "In extremity, your conscience may make you terrible." -Omar Keung, the Flashpoint
data.text: Whenever you encounter a code gate, you may install Black Orchestra from your heap (paying its install cost). 3[credit]: +2 strength. Break up to 2 code gate subroutines, if able.
data.title: Black Orchestra

data.text: [click]: Make a run on Archives. If successful, instead treat it as a successful run on another central server. Use this ability only once per turn.
data.title: Omar Keung: Conspiracy Theorist

data.flavor: Khan's avatar lifted her arm and the bird launched itself into the air.
data.text: 1[credit]: Break code gate subroutine. 3[credit]: +3 strength. 2[credit], return Peregrine to your grip: Derez a code gate. Use this ability only after using Peregrine to break all the subroutines on that code gate during a single encounter.
data.title: Peregrine

data.flavor: My brain is the key that sets my mind free.
data.text: 1[credit]: Break code gate subroutine. 2[credit]: +4 strength for the remainder of this run. Use this ability only by spending at least 1 credit from a stealth card.
data.title: Houdini

data.flavor: "Live, unfiltered, and uncensored: this is Net Mercur, signing off for the night. Stay safe, New Angeles."
data.text: The first time you spend at least 1[credit] from a stealth card each run, place 1[credit] on Net Mercur or draw 1 card. Use credits on Net Mercur for anything.
data.title: Net Mercur

data.flavor: "All bioroids are bound by the Three Directives, but in theory a bioroid could have any number of core directives. Even zero."
data.text:
Whenever you draw a card, reveal that card.
The first time you make a successful run each turn, you may look at the top card of R&D.
data.title: Find the Truth

data.flavor: "Last week, I crossed the street to avoid her. Today, she pulled me out of the rubble. Makes me rethink who the bad guys are."
data.text: 2[credit]: Draw 1 card. Use this ability only if you have suffered damage from a Corp card ability this turn.
data.title: First Responders

data.flavor: In battle, I take half the slain.
data.text:
The Runner can spend [click][click][click] to break up to 3 subroutines on Fairchild 3.0.
[subroutine] The Runner must pay 3[credit] or trash 1 of his or her installed cards.
[subroutine] The Runner must pay 3[credit] or trash 1 of his or her installed cards.
[subroutine] Do 1 brain damage or end the run.
data.title: Fairchild 3.0

data.flavor: "If you live off-site, please consult the building AI for temporary housing. We regret that your off-site family cannot join you here while we are in lockdown..."
data.text: Name a card. Remove all copies of that card in the heap from the game.
data.title: Ark Lockdown

data.flavor: "Wait a minute, I don't even have a cat."
data.text:
Play only if the Runner trashed an accessed Corp card during his or her last turn.
<trace>Trace 2</trace> If successful, trash 2 installed non-program cards. If unsuccessful, take 1 bad publicity.
data.title: Hellion Beta Test

data.text: When you score Project Kusanagi, place 1 agenda counter on it for each advancement token on it over 2. Hosted agenda counter: Choose 1 piece of ice to gain "[subroutine] Do 1 net damage." after all its other subroutines for the remainder of this run.
data.title: Project Kusanagi

data.text:
[subroutine] Do 1 net damage. The Runner loses 2[credit].
[subroutine] Do 1 net damage. The Runner loses 2[credit].
[subroutine] Do 1 net damage. The Runner loses 2[credit].
data.title: DNA Tracker

data.flavor: Your better nature.
data.text: Whenever the Runner takes at least 1 net damage, trash the top card of the stack.
data.title: Jinteki: Potential Unleashed

data.flavor: "She used to work for me at my chop shop. Now she makes more money than I do." -MacPherson
data.text: [trash]: Shuffle all cards in HQ into R&D. The Runner may pay any number of credits to prevent 1 random card in HQ from being shuffled into R&D for every 2[credit] spent.
data.title: Alexa Belsky

data.flavor: Observing is fun, but it's just the appetizer.
data.text:
Play only if the Runner has fewer than 6[credit].
As an additional cost to play this operation, remove 1 tag.
Trash 1 installed card.
data.title: Observe and Destroy

data.text: This card is not trashed until another current is played or an agenda is stolen. As an additional cost to make the first run on his or her turn (even through a card ability), the Runner must spend 1[credit].
data.title: Service Outage

data.flavor: Game over.
data.text:
Play only if the Runner has at least 2 tags.
As an additional cost to play this operation, spend [click].
Do 7 meat damage.
data.title: BOOM!

data.text: This card is not trashed until another current is played or an agenda is stolen. When the Runner's turn begins, trace 1 If successful, do 1 meat damage if the Runner is tagged; otherwise, give the Runner 1 tag.
data.title: Door to Door

data.flavor: The event is now referred to as the Water Tower Massacre. No one was ever indicted, and no one knows who paid the prisec team responsible.
data.text: This card is not trashed until another current is played or an agenda is stolen. The install cost of each resource is increased by 2.
data.title: Scarcity of Resources

data.flavor: "When your opponent is weak, strike. If you do not, he will become strong." - the Playbook
data.text:
Play only if you made a successful run this turn.
Trash an unrezzed piece of ice you passed during the last run you made this turn.
data.title: En Passant

data.flavor: Omar goes through four, five keyboards per week, no two from the same decade.
data.text: Look at the top 10 cards of your stack. If any of those cards are programs, you may install one of them, lowering the install cost by 5. Trash the rest of those cards.
data.title: Frantic Coding

data.text: +2[mu] Whenever you access cards from HQ during a run, access 1 additional card for each piece of ice protecting HQ that you broke all subroutines on during this run. Limit 1 console per player.
data.title: The Gauntlet

data.flavor: Spiraling even higher, every feature of cyberspace sprawled before it.
data.text: 1[credit]: Break barrier subroutine. 2[credit]: +2 strength. 2[credit], return Saker to your grip: Derez a barrier. Use this ability only after using Saker to break all the subroutines on that barrier during a single encounter.
data.title: Saker

data.flavor: "I used to run stims, simsensies, the usual. I was scum. Now I run water. I'm a fragging hero."
data.text: [click],[click]: Draw 3 cards. Shuffle 1 card from your grip into your stack.
data.title: Blockade Runner

data.flavor: "Nothing up my sleeve..."
data.text: 1[recurring-credit] Use this credit to pay for using icebreakers.
data.title: Ele "Smoke" Scovak: Cynosure of the Net

data.flavor: "I usually find something interesting in there. Just not what I was looking for."
data.text: Whenever you make a successful run on R&D, instead of accessing cards, you may choose 1 of the top 5 cards of R&D and access it. You cannot access any other cards in R&D during this run.
data.title: Top Hat

data.flavor: The personality must be bigger than the prop.
data.text: 1[credit]: Break barrier subroutine. 3[credit]: +4 strength for the remainder of this run. Use this ability only by spending at least 1 credit from a stealth card.
data.title: Blackstone

data.flavor: "Take this to Inez Delgado in Netcrimes. No one else."
data.text: This card is not trashed until another current is played or an agenda is scored. While secretly spending credits, players cannot spend 2[credit].

data.flavor: "The Starlight Meditation Booths are available to refugees for free for the duration of the crisis."
data.text: If you are tagged when your turn ends, force the Corp to "Trace 1 If unsuccessful, the Runner removes 1 tag." [trash],trash all cards in your grip: Prevent all meat damage.
data.title: Citadel Sanctuary

data.flavor: "I let the bioroids do a ride-along via remote, so they can see what pain really looks like." -Agent Valkyrie

data.flavor: "Does an alliance with the yakuza truly seem so strange? They are honorable businessmen, and women, just like us." -Rin Kimura, Chief NA Security
data.text: Whenever you and the Runner reveal secretly spent credits, do 1 meat damage if you and the Runner spent a different number of credits.
data.title: Fumiko Yamamori

data.flavor: "Keep your head down, keep moving, try not to attract attention."
data.text:
As an additional cost to play this operation, trash the top card of R&D.

data.text: If the Runner is tagged, Drone Screen gains "Whenever the Runner initiates a run on this server, <trace>Trace 3</trace> If successful, do 1 meat damage (cannot be prevented)."

data.text: Whenever an encounter with a piece of ice ends, place 1 power counter on Chief Slee for each unbroken subroutine on the encountered piece of ice. [click], 5 hosted power counters: Do 5 meat damage.

data.text: When you rez Bulwark, take 1 bad publicity. When the Runner encounters Bulwark, gain 2[credit] if there is an installed AI. [subroutine] The Runner trashes 1 program. [subroutine] The Corp gains 2[credit]. End the run. [subroutine] The Corp gains 2[credit]. End the run.

data.flavor: When a shooting war threatens, the prudent course is to shoot first.
data.text: Trash 1 installed card with an install cost equal to or less than the number of tags the Runner has.

data.text:
After you resolve this operation, end your action phase.
Shuffle 3 cards from Archives into R&D. Remove Preemptive Action from the game instead of trashing it.

data.flavor: "These things are always there, under the surface, but no one wants to know the truth." -Omar Keung, the Flashpoint
data.text: Whenever you encounter a sentry, you may install MKUltra from your heap (paying its install cost). 3[credit]: +2 strength. Break up to 2 sentry subroutines, if able.
