data.text: Install On the Lam on a resource as a hosted condition counter with the text "[trash]: Avoid up to 3 tags or prevent up to 3 damage."
data.title: On the Lam

data.flavor: Her ability to analyze and adapt mid-run bordered on the paranormal.
data.text: Make a run, and place 4[credit] on this card, which you may use only during this run. When this run ends, trash 1 program (cannot be prevented) used during this run.
data.title: Cold Read

data.flavor: It is only the illusion of choice.
data.text: Whenever you make a successful run on R&D, you may reveal the top card of R&D. If you do, you may force the Corp to draw that card.
data.title: Equivocation

data.flavor: "It's the most fundamental element of illusions and running both. In either case, it should be the first skill you master." -Ele "Smoke" Scovak
data.text: [click], [click], X[credit]: Remove X tags.
data.title: Misdirection

data.flavor: "It had been hoped that the Network disruptions surrounding the conflict might also disrupt the phenomenon. Evidently, the reverse is true." -Joséo Greene, SYNC Analyst
data.text: The first time you trash an installed card each turn, draw 1 card.
data.title: Reaver

data.flavor: This is my USMC-XOB32. There are many like it, but this one is mine.
data.text: This card is not trashed until another current is played or an agenda is scored. The Corp cannot rez non-ice cards during the Runner's turn.
data.title: Interdiction

data.flavor: "She was riding in a great iron mortar and driving it with the pestle, and as she came she swept away her trail behind her with a kitchen broom." -Vasilissa the Beautiful
data.text: You may host any number of non-AI icebreaker programs on Baba Yaga. Baba Yaga gains the paid abilities of all hosted icebreaker programs.
data.title: Baba Yaga

data.text:
[subroutine] End the run unless the Runner pays 4[credit].
[subroutine] End the run unless the Runner pays 4[credit].
[subroutine] End the run unless the Runner trashes 1 of his or her installed cards.
[subroutine] End the run unless the Runner suffers 1 brain damage.
data.title: Fairchild

data.flavor: Friends give friends advance warning before moving a carrier group down to enforce a no-fly zone.
data.text:
After you resolve this operation, end your action phase.
Install up to 2 cards from Archives (paying all install costs).
data.title: Friends in High Places

data.text: If the Runner has fewer than 6[credit] or no unspent clicks when a successful run on this server ends, you have 1 additional [click] to spend your next turn. Limit 1 region per server.
data.title: Manta Grid

data.text: [subroutine] You and the Runner secretly spend 0[credit], 1[credit], or 2[credit]. Reveal spent credits. If you and the Runner spent a different number of credits, choose another server. The Runner is now running on that server instead of passing Mind Game. For the remainder of the run, the Runner must add 1 installed card to the bottom of his or her stack as an additional cost to jack out.
data.title: Mind Game

data.text: If the Runner has fewer than 6[credit] or fewer than 2 cards in his or her grip when there is a successful run on this server, you may look at the top 5 cards of R&D and swap 1 of those cards with a card in HQ. Limit 1 region per server.
data.title: Nihongai Grid

data.flavor: //Connection Terminated
data.text: When the Runner encounters IP Block, give him or her 1 tag if there is an installed AI. [subroutine] Trace 3 If successful, give the Runner 1 tag. [subroutine] End the run if the Runner is tagged.
data.title: IP Block

data.flavor: Truth like the sunlight shines above all.
data.text:
When the Runner encounters Thoth, give him or her 1 tag.
[subroutine] <trace>Trace 4</trace> If successful, do 1 net damage for each tag the Runner has.
[subroutine] <trace>Trace 4</trace> If successful, the Runner loses 1[credit] for each tag he or she has.
data.title: Thoth

data.flavor: "I don't get paid to be calm."
data.text:
When your turn begins, place 1 advancement token on Anson Rose.
Whenever you rez a piece of ice, you may move any number of advancement tokens from Anson Rose to that ice.
data.title: Anson Rose

data.text:
Mausolus can be advanced.
If Mausolus has 3 or more advancement tokens on it, do the parenthetical text instead (otherwise, do not resolve it).
[subroutine] The Corp gains 1[credit]. (The Corp gains 3[credit].)
[subroutine] Do 1 net damage. (Do 3 net damage.)
[subroutine] Give the Runner 1 tag. (Give the Runner 1 tag and end the run.)
data.title: Mausolus

data.flavor: There is a special place in hell for the first person who mined cyberspace.
data.text:
If Sapper is accessed from R&D, the runner must reveal it.
When the Runner accesses Sapper, he or she encounters it. Ignore this ability if the Runner accesses Sapper from Archives.
[subroutine] Trash 1 program.
data.title: Sapper

data.flavor: Walk loudly and carry a bigger stick.
data.text: When you score Show of Force, do 2 meat damage.
data.title: Show of Force

data.flavor: "Get those civilians off the street. No more collateral damage." -Commissioner Dawn
data.text: This card is not trashed until another current is played or an agenda is stolen. The Runner's maximum hand size is reduced by 1.
data.title: Enforced Curfew

data.text: +2[mu] Once per turn, when you encounter a piece of ice, you may reduce your maximum hand size by 1 until the beginning of your next turn. If you do, the strength of that ice is lowered to 0 for the remainder of the encounter. Limit 1 console per player.
data.title: Şifr

data.flavor: Open yourself to the universe.
data.text: When an encounter in which you used Sūnya to break all subroutines on that piece of ice ends, place 1 power counter on Sūnya. Sūnya has +1 strength for each power counter on it. 2[credit]: Break sentry subroutine.
data.title: Sūnya

data.flavor: "A little birdie told me..." -Khan
data.text: X[credit],[trash]: Prevent X damage from a card currently being accessed.
data.title: Recon Drone

data.text:
Install only if you made a successful run on a central server this turn.
When your turn begins, gain 1[credit] for every 5[credit] in the Corp's credit pool.
Trash Tapwrm if the Corp purges virus counters.
data.title: Tapwrm

data.flavor: "Everything leaves a ripple in cyberspace. If you can find the ripples, nothing can hide." -Khan
data.text:
When your turn begins, choose a server.
[click],2[credit]: Make a run on the chosen server. Prevent the first subroutine that would resolve this run from resolving.
data.title: Tracker

data.flavor: "You want to do business in Los Pistoleros turf, then you gotta deal with me."
data.text: Whenever an agenda is scored or stolen, place 2 power counters on Aaron Marrón. Hosted power counter: Remove 1 tag and draw 1 card.
data.title: Aaron Marrón

data.text:
Play only if you made a successful run on R&D, HQ, and Archives this turn.
Take an additional turn after this one. Remove Encore from the game instead of trashing it.
data.title: Encore

data.flavor: Faster than the eye can follow.
data.text: 1[credit]: Break sentry subroutine. X[credit]: +X strength for the remainder of this run. Use this ability only by spending at least 1 credit from a stealth card.
data.title: Fawkes

data.text:
Play only as your first [click] and only if the Corp scored no agendas during his or her last turn.
Gain 10[credit]. The Corp gains 5[credit]. You cannot initiate any runs this turn.
data.title: Peace in Our Time

data.text: Place 1 agenda counter on Sensor Net Activation when you score it. Hosted agenda counter: Rez a bioroid, ignoring all costs. When the turn ends, derez that bioroid.
data.title: Sensor Net Activation

data.flavor: It required a hexadecimal code along with biometrics, delivered by way of BMI.
data.text:
After you resolve this operation, end your action phase.
Gain 8[credit] and draw 4 cards.
data.title: Violet Level Clearance

data.flavor: "Ice is not meant to kill; just slow or cripple the Runner. Killing is my job." - Tori Hanzō
data.text: Whenever the Runner breaks a subroutine on Chiyashi while there is an AI installed, trash the top 2 cards of the Runner's stack. [subroutine] Do 2 net damage. [subroutine] Do 2 net damage. [subroutine] End the run.
data.title: Chiyashi

data.text:
After you resolve this operation, end your action phase.
Look at the top 5 cards of R&D. If any of those cards are agendas, assets, or upgrades, you may install 1 of those cards in a remote server.
data.title: Psychokinesis

data.text:
The Runner's base link strength is reduced to 0 during the first trace each turn.
Whenever the Runner increases his or her link strength by spending credits, gain 1[credit] for every 2[credit] spent.
data.title: Net Quarantine

data.text:
If Herald is accessed from R&D, the Runner must reveal it.
When the Runner accesses Herald, he or she encounters it. Ignore this ability if the Runner accesses Herald from Archives.
[subroutine] The Corp gains 2[credit].
[subroutine] The Corp may pay up to 2[credit] to place that number of advancement tokens on a card that can be advanced.
data.title: Herald

data.flavor: The truth hurts.
data.text:
[subroutine] The Corp gains 2[credit].
[subroutine] The Runner loses 2[credit].
[subroutine] <trace>Trace 2</trace> If successful, give the Runner 1 tag.
data.title: Veritas

data.flavor: "My job? I provide legal exculpation and sign everything. It pays very well."
data.text: While the Runner has fewer than 6[credit], Bryan Stinson gains "[click]: Play a transaction operation from Archives, ignoring all costs. Remove that transaction from the game instead of trashing it."
data.title: Bryan Stinson

data.text:
Gain 1[credit] when your turn begins.
Whenever you gain credits through a card ability other than from NASX, you may spend up to 2[credit] to place that many power counters on NASX.
[click],[trash]: Gain 2[credit] for each power counter on NASX.
data.title: NASX

data.flavor: One way to get rid of a virus is to get a nastier virus.
data.text: [subroutine] Trace 4 If successful, purge virus counters. [subroutine] Trace 3 If successful, trash 1 virus. [subroutine] Trace 2 If successful, remove a virus in the heap from the game. [subroutine] Trace 1 If successful, end the run.
data.title: Macrophage

data.flavor:
"Guilty."
"Guilty."
"Guilty."
data.text:
[subroutine] The Runner trashes 1 of his or her installed cards.
[subroutine] The Runner trashes 1 of his or her installed cards.
[subroutine] The Runner trashes 1 of his or her installed cards.
data.title: Tribunal

data.flavor: "Hitting them when they are weakest sometimes means acting before you want to." -Alice Merchant
data.text: Make a run. If you have 2 or fewer cards in your grip, each installed icebreaker has +2 strength until the end of the run.
data.title: Pushing the Envelope

data.text: +2[mu] The first time each turn you access a card not in Archives and do not steal or trash it, the Corp must trash 1 card from HQ at random. Limit 1 console per player.
data.title: Maw

data.flavor: The Archivist tracks all the clans and their members, and official dealings clans have with the various corps. Half law clerk and half historian, he wields a tremendous amount of power doing a job no one else wants, but none can do without.
data.text: +1[link] Whenever the Corp scores an initiative or security agenda, force the Corp to "Trace 1 if unsuccessful, take 1 bad publicity."
data.title: The Archivist

data.flavor:
1) Find the weakness.
2) Exploit the weakness.
3) Repeat.
data.text:
Play only if you made a successful run on R&D, HQ, and Archives this turn.
Derez up to 3 pieces of ice.
data.title: Exploit

data.flavor: "So, yeah, I just reverse engineered a tracer, and then built it back up with some new lines of code. Pretty stellar." -Los
data.text: Expose 1 non-ice card, then make a run.
data.title: Spot the Prey

data.flavor: "You created a distributed AI replica of yourself and projected it into the network to run for you!?"
data.text: [trash]: Prevent all but 1 net damage.
data.title: Bio-Modeled Network

data.flavor: "To beat cautious sysops, you've got to get creative. Commandeering Network systems is like using their own strengths against them." -Kabonesa Wu
data.text: The install cost of each piece of ice that is not installed in the innermost position is increased by 1.
data.title: Network Exchange

data.text: Make a run. When this run ends, add Mad Dash to your score area as an agenda worth 1 agenda point if you stole at least 1 agenda during the run; otherwise, suffer 1 meat damage.
data.title: Mad Dash

data.flavor: "The newest electronic-warfare rollout from NEXT Design has us sysops drooling." -Mason Bellamy
data.text: If there is a rezzed piece of NEXT ice when you score NEXT Wave 2, you may do 1 brain damage.
data.title: NEXT Wave 2

data.flavor: "Dismantle. Dissect. Is there really a difference?"
data.text:
The Runner can spend [click][click] to break up to 2 subroutines on Zed 2.0.
[subroutine] Trash 1 hardware.
[subroutine] Trash 1 hardware.
[subroutine] If the Runner has spent at least 1 [click] to break a subroutine during this run, do 2 brain damage.
data.title: Zed 2.0

data.text:
Defense Construct can be advanced.
[trash]: Add 1 facedown card from Archives to HQ for each advancement token on Defense Construct. Use this ability only during a run on Archives.
data.title: Defense Construct

data.text: The first time a subroutine on a piece of AP ice is broken each turn, do 1 net damage.
data.title: Synth DNA Modification

data.flavor: "The ultimate aim of martial arts is not having to use them." - Miyamoto Musashi
data.text:
When the Runner passes Kakugo, do 1 net damage.
[subroutine] End the run.
data.title: Kakugo

data.text: Whenever the Runner avoids or removes 1 or more tags, you may draw 1 card.
data.title: Net Analytics

data.flavor: "'What does BRE stand for?' Have you seen its Net presence?" -Bernice Mai
data.text:
[subroutine]<trace>Trace 4</trace> If successful, give the Runner 1 tag.
[subroutine]<trace>Trace 2</trace> If successful, the Runner accesses 1 fewer card whenever he or she accesses cards for the remainder of this run.
<errata>Errata from FAQ 4.0</errata>
data.title: SYNC BRE

data.text: Whenever you forfeit an agenda, place 1 advancement token on a card and 1 additional token for each agenda point the agenda was worth.
data.title: Jemison Astronautics: Sacrifice. Audacity. Success.

data.text: Forfeit an agenda: Rez up to 3 pieces of ice, lowering the cost of each by 2[credit] for each printed agenda point on the forfeited agenda.
data.title: Quarantine System

data.text:
As an additional cost to rez Oberth Protocol, forfeit an agenda.
The first time you advance a card in or protecting this server each turn, place an additional advancement token on it.
data.title: Oberth Protocol

data.flavor: Senate staffers and clerks of the MCA can be seen thronging Khondi Plaza during break times.
data.text:
X[recurring-credit]
Use these credits to rez ice protecting this server. X is the number of remote servers.
data.title: Khondi Plaza

data.text: [trash]: Cards cannot be installed until the end of the run. Use this ability only during a run on this server.
data.title: Signal Jamming

data.flavor: "Sure, the implantation was fine, but it pumps Burn. Did you think it wouldn't hurt?"
data.text:
[click]: Make a run on R&D or HQ and trash 2 or more cards from your grip. Whenever you access cards from that server during this run, access 1 additional card for every 2 cards trashed.
<errata>Errata from FAQ 4.0</errata>
data.title: Severnius Stim Implant

data.flavor: "An eye for an eye? If you're lucky, that's all you'll lose."
data.text:
Whenever you suffer any amount of damage, place 1 power counter on Clan Vengeance.
[trash]: Trash 1 card from HQ at random for each power counter on Clan Vengeance.
data.title: Clan Vengeance

data.flavor: "Who watches the watchers? We do."
data.text: [click], [trash]: Make a run. If successful, instead of accessing, pay X[credit] to access up to X cards from this server, if able. X is the number of tags you have.
data.title: Counter Surveillance

data.text: Make a run on R&D. If successful, you may make another run on R&D when this run ends. If the second run is successful, gain 4[credit].
data.title: Möbius

data.flavor: "From code to profit in three easy steps."
data.text: The first time the Corp rezzes a piece of ice each turn, gain 2[credit].
data.title: Los: Data Hijacker

data.text: This card is not trashed until another current is played or an agenda is scored. The first icebreaker whose strength you increase each turn does not return to its base strength until the end of the run.
data.title: System Seizure

data.text:
When you install Customized Secretary reveal the top 5 cards of the stack. You may host any number of revealed programs from your stack on it. Shuffle your stack.
[click]: Install a hosted program, paying all install costs.
data.title: Customized Secretary

data.flavor: Sometimes efficiency is as easy as offloading routine work to a dedicated handler.
data.text: Gain 1[credit] and draw 2 cards.
data.title: Build Script

data.text:
Seidr Adaptive Barrier has +1 strength for each piece of ice protecting this server.
[subroutine] End the run.
data.title: Seidr Adaptive Barrier

data.flavor: "Submit."
data.text:
The Runner can spend [click][click] to break up to 2 subroutines on Nerine 2.0.
[subroutine] Do 1 brain damage. The Corp may draw 1 card.
[subroutine] Do 1 brain damage. The Corp may draw 1 card.
<errata>Errata from FAQ 4.0</errata>
data.title: Nerine 2.0

data.flavor: "Trust me, most corps cannot match the performance of our brainmap enhanced system; a home-brewed rig doesn't stand a chance." - Rachel Giacomin
data.text: When the Runner's next turn begins, he or she loses [click].
data.title: Load Testing

data.text:
[subroutine] You may install a piece of ice from HQ protecting another server, ignoring all costs.
[subroutine] You may install a piece of ice from HQ in the next innermost position, protecting this server, ignoring all costs.
data.title: Bloom

data.text:
As an additional cost to play this operation, spend [click].
Add one of your installed cards to HQ. Install 2 cards from HQ, ignoring all costs.
data.title: Replanting

data.flavor: "The customer pays to use our service, and then the advertisers pay us to put ads on their screens, and then the customers pay us a premium to remove the ads. Welcome to the dream."
data.text: The first time the Runner spends [click] to gain 1[credit] each turn (not through a card effect), gain 1[credit].
data.title: CPC Generator

data.text: Hosted power counter: The Runner loses 1[credit]. [subroutine] Place 1 power counter on Free Lunch. [subroutine] Place 1 power counter on Free Lunch.
data.title: Free Lunch

data.text: After you resolve this operation, end your action phase. Install MCA Informant on a connection resource as a hosted condition counter with the text "The Runner is considered to have 1 additional tag. The host connection gains '[click], 2[credit]: Trash this card.'" Errata from FAQ 4.0
data.title: MCA Informant

data.flavor: "You have two choices: do what I asked, or make me ask again. It's your choice, but if I have to ask again, it will go badly for you."
data.text: When your turn begins, the Runner must pay 1[credit] or trash the top card of the stack.
data.title: Clyde Van Rite

data.text: [subroutine] Search R&D for a card and add it to HQ. Shuffle R&D.
data.title: Watchtower

data.text:
As an additional cost to play this operation, forfeit an agenda.
Remove 1 bad publicity per agenda point that the forfeited agenda was worth. Gain 1[credit] for each bad publicity removed.
data.title: Sacrifice

data.flavor: "All my best tricks were shrugged right off. I ended up having to send a self-destruct code to the whole server." - Wyvern
data.text:
The strength of Self-Adapting Code Wall cannot be lowered.
[subroutine] End the run.
data.title: Self-Adapting Code Wall

data.text: Whenever you encounter a barrier, Berserker has +1 strength for each subroutine on that barrier. 2[credit]: Break up to 2 barrier subroutines.
data.title: Berserker

data.text: 2[credit]: Break sentry subroutine. 1[credit]: +1 strength. Whenever you pass a sentry, you may trash the top card of the stack to trash one card from the top of R&D for each subroutine on that sentry that resolved.
data.title: Persephone

data.flavor: "Even I don't know how or why this one works. I just copied the schematics from a burst broadcast from someplace north of Paxton's Node, where nothing is supposed to be." -Los
data.text: X[credit],[click]: Derez a piece of ice rezzed this turn. X is its printed rez cost. Use this ability once per turn.
data.title: Rubicon Switch

data.text: Whenever you access a card with a trash cost not in Archives and do not trash it, you may reveal it and gain 1[credit].
data.title: Aeneas Informant

data.text: [click], remove an installed program from the game: Search your stack for a non-virus program, shuffle your stack, then install that program, lowering the install cost by the cost of the program removed from the game.
data.title: Rosetta 2.0

data.flavor: "Who said you can't teach an old breaker new tricks?" -g00ru
data.text: Install Adjusted Matrix on an icebreaker. Host icebreaker gains AI and "You may spend [click] to break any subroutine on a piece of ice currently being encountered." Errata from FAQ 4.1
data.title: Adjusted Matrix

data.flavor: Better, Faster, Stronger
data.text: Install Dedicated Processor on a non-AI icebreaker. Host icebreaker gains "2[credit]: +4 strength."
data.title: Dedicated Processor

data.text: The first time you pass a piece of ice each turn in which you used Inversificator to break all subroutines, you may swap that ice with another piece of ice. 1[credit]: Break code gate subroutine. 1[credit]: +1 strength.
data.title: Inversificator

data.flavor: "You want untraceable funds? I'll lend, as long as you have the ability to pay me back."
data.text:
When your turn begins, gain 1[credit] if you have fewer than 6[credit].
Whenever you have 0[credit], trash Dadiana Chacon and take 3 meat damage.
data.title: Dadiana Chacon

data.flavor: "I passed through the opalescent curtain only to find a suddenly empty server..."
data.text: NEXT Opal gains "[subroutine] You may install 1 card from HQ, paying all costs." for each rezzed piece of NEXT ice. Errata from FAQ 4.1
data.title: NEXT Opal

data.flavor: "They don't need sleep, breaks, overtime, or even O₂. How can we compete with that!?"
data.text:
[trash]: Install 1 card, paying all costs. Use this ability only during the next paid ability window after playing and resolving an operation.
<errata>Errata from FAQ 4.1</errata>
data.title: Bioroid Work Crew

data.text: Once per turn, instead of rezzing an approached piece of ice, you may trash it to choose another server. The Runner is now running on that server and encountering the outermost piece of ice, if any.
data.title: AgInfusion: New Miracles for a New World

data.text: Install only in the root of R&D. [click]: Reveal the top 3 cards of R&D. Secretly choose 1 to add to HQ. Return the others to the top of R&D, in any order. Limit 1 region per server.
data.title: Bamboo Dome

data.text: Each time the Runner accesses an agenda from this server, he or she must suffer 2 net damage as an additional cost in order to steal it. This applies even during the run on which the Runner trashes Ben Musashi.
data.title: Ben Musashi

data.flavor: "I'm sure there is no way this could go wrong for you." -Henry Phillips
data.text:
When the Runner encounters Authenticator, he or she may take 1 tag to bypass it.
[subroutine] The Corp gains 2[credit].
[subroutine]End the run.
data.title: Authenticator

data.flavor: "Toying with them is where the job satisfaction comes in".
data.text: Whenever the Runner breaks a subroutine during a run on this server, gain 2[credit] if he or she is tagged.
data.title: Henry Phillips

data.flavor: "Our job is to stop incursions. Let Argus get cute with them." -Moishe Saban
data.text:
[subroutine]End the run.
[subroutine]End the run.
data.title: Battlement

data.text:
Play only if there are at least 3 cards in HQ.
Trash all cards in HQ. Place a total of 2 advancement tokens on up to 2 cards that can be advanced.
data.title: Audacity

data.text:
As an additional cost to play this operation, spend [click], [click].
Move all advancement tokens from all installed cards to 1 card that can be advanced.
data.title: Red Planet Couriers

data.flavor: "It's eyes just keep following you."
data.text: [subroutine] Add 1 installed program to the top of the stack.
data.title: Owl

data.flavor: Jarogniew's agent provocateur.
data.text: The first time you make a successful run on Archives each turn, the Corp must trash 1 card from HQ.
data.title: Alice Merchant: Clan Agitator

data.text: When you install Jarogniew Mercs, take 1 tag. Place 3 power counters on Jarogniew Mercs, and 1 additional power counter for each tag you have. When there are no power counters left on Jarogniew Mercs, trash it. The Corp cannot trash Jarogniew Mercs while there is another resource installed. Hosted power counter: Prevent 1 meat damage.
data.title: Jarogniew Mercs

data.text: +2[mu] X[recurring-credit] Use these credits during runs on HQ. X is the number of pieces of ice protecting HQ. Limit 1 console per player.
data.title: Māui

data.flavor: Everything you need in case of an emergency.
data.text: Place X power counters on Bug Out Bag when you install it. If you have no cards in your grip at the end of your turn, draw 1 card for each counter on Bug Out Bag, then trash it.
data.title: Bug Out Bag

data.flavor: "I don't bother asking why anymore—he never says—but if I had to guess, it's because he's embezzling and using my runs to disguise it. Not that I care. His credit spends as well as the next guy's" -Moth
data.text: The first time you derez a piece of ice each turn, gain 2[credit].
data.title: Keros Mcintyre

data.flavor: "Taking risks is what makes it fun!" -Kabonesa Wu
data.text: +2[mu] The first time you initiate a run on a server protected by 2 or more pieces of ice each turn, draw 2 cards. Limit 1 console per player.
data.title: Daredevil

data.text: Whenever you use Mass-Driver to break all subroutines on a piece of ice during a single encounter, the first 3 subroutines on the next piece of ice you encounter this run do not resolve. 2[credit]: Break code gate subroutine. 1[credit]: +1 strength.
data.title: Mass-Driver

data.text: Whenever the Runner trashes 1 or more cards in or protecting this server (including Warroid Tracker), <trace>Trace 4</trace> If successful, the Runner must trash 2 of his or her installed cards.
data.title: Warroid Tracker

data.text:
When the Runner encounters Loki, choose another rezzed piece of ice. Until the end of the run, Loki gains the subtypes of that ice and the subroutines of that ice before all Loki's other subroutines.
[subroutine] End the run unless the Runner shuffles his or her grip into the stack.
data.title: Loki

data.flavor: "Proper application of stress can create the most profound changes." - Tennin Institute Intern Brief
data.text: As an additional cost to steal Obokata Protocol, the Runner must suffer 4 net damage.
data.title: Obokata Protocol

data.text:
If the Runner breaks the printed subroutine on Mirāju, he or she is now running on Archives instead of passing Mirāju and approaches the outermost ice, if any. Derez Mirāju.
[subroutine] The Corp may draw 1 card. Then, shuffle 1 card from HQ into R&D.
data.title: Mirāju

data.text:
Play only if the Runner did not make a successful run during his or her last turn.
Place 2 advancement tokens on 1 card.
data.title: Shipment from Tennin

data.flavor: "Of course words hurt." -Bex Gleeson
data.text: [click]: Gain 1[credit] for each tag the Runner has. Use this ability only once per turn.
data.title: Escalate Vitriol

data.text: When you score Reeducation, add any number of cards from HQ to the bottom of R&D and draw that many cards. The Runner randomly adds the same number of cards from his or her grip to the bottom of the stack, if able.

data.flavor: "I've got a rock!" - Charles "Mad Dog" Brun, Comet Jockey
data.text: When you score Meteor Mining, you may gain 7[credit]. If the Runner has at least 2 tags, you may do 7 meat damage instead.
data.title: Meteor Mining

data.text:
When you score Standoff, each player, starting with the Runner, trashes 1 of his or her installed cards until 1 player declines to trash a card. If the Runner declines, draw 1 card and gain 5[credit].
<errata>Errata from FAQ 4.1</errata>
data.title: Standoff

data.flavor: The difference between surviving and thriving is successful terraforming.
data.text:
As an additional cost to play this operation, forfeit an agenda and spend [click][click].
Advance a card X times. X equals the advancement requirement of the agenda just forfeited.
data.title: Success

data.flavor: "Whampoa is the largest and meanest Earth-based mining concern on Mars. They put bodies and waste in the ground as fast as they pull minerals out." - Alice Merchant
data.text: Trash 1 card from HQ: Add 1 card from Archives to the bottom of R&D. Use this ability only once per turn.

data.text: Gain 2[credit] for each card with at least 1 advancement token on it.

data.flavor: "We don't want you! We don't need you!"
data.text: Play only as your first [click]. Draw 1 card for each installed clan resource. Gain 1[credit] for each tag you have.

data.flavor: "Subtle? You don't really understand the point of all of this, do you?" -Alice Merchant
data.text: When your turn begins, you may take 1 tag to place 2 virus counters on God of War. Hosted virus counter: Break ice subroutine. 2[credit]: +1 strength.
data.title: God of War

data.flavor: "The perfect Run is when you get in, take something of value, and get back out, with no one knowing you've ever been there" -g00ru
data.text: Make a run. When the run ends, derez all ice that was rezzed during this run.
data.title: Leave No Trace

data.text: Make a run on HQ. If successful, when you would access any number of cards from HQ, you may instead add that many cards from your heap to your grip. Remove Rip Deal from the game instead of trashing it.

data.text:
6[credit]: Derez a sentry currently being encountered.
1[credit]: +1 strength.

data.flavor: "The question isn't 'should I do it?' the question is 'can I do it?'" -Kabonesa Wu
data.text: Make a run. If you have 3 or fewer programs installed, all icebreakers have +2 strength during this run.

data.text:
Maven has +1 strength for each installed program.
2[credit]: Break ice subroutine.
data.title: Maven

data.flavor: "Anyone can hit someone where they are weakest." -S'onge Galaxy

data.title: Na'Not'K

data.flavor:
"Talk is free. Anything else is going to cost you."
-Jitish
data.text: When your turn begins, you may remove 1 card in the heap from the game. If you do, gain 2[credit].

data.flavor:
"Is the lack of oxygen causing distress, friend?"
-Gregory 3D3R6Z

data.flavor: "As you'll see on page 276, section CDXXIX, paragraph 47, line 102 of your contract, you are overdue for your seed upgrade, and all growth from out of date seed is to be confiscated and destroyed."

data.flavor: AgInfusion doesn't just have patents on nearly every plant seed that in farmed on Mars - they own most of the rights to the water that farms use.

data.flavor: "My gift to runners: isomorphic architectural protocols. Ichiban daikirai da." -Midori

When the Runner encounters Data Loop, he or she must add 2 cards from his or her grip to the top of the stack.
[subroutine] End the run if the Runner is tagged.
[subroutine] End the run.

data.flavor:
"Please, speak freely. I've been tasked by the board itself to hear your grievances."
-Mandy Traut

[subroutine] Trash 1 program.
[subroutine] Trash 1 program.
[subroutine] Trash 1 resource and end the run.

data.title: Transparency Initiative

data.text:
Play only if you made a successful run on a central server this turn.
The Corp must pay 5[credit] or take 1 bad publicity. Remove Mining Accident from the game instead of trashing it.

When you install Respirocytes, suffer 1 meat damage.
The first time you have 0 cards in your grip each turn, draw 1 card and place a power counter on Respirocytes. When Respirocytes has 3 or more power counters on it, trash it.
data.title: Respirocytes

data.flavor: Vanadis, a Martian arms manufacturer, was among the first sites targeted from orbit during the war.
data.text:
[trash]: The Corp trashes the top X cards of R&D. X is the amount of damage you have suffered this turn. Use this ability only during the next paid ability window after suffering any amount of damage.

Whenever you expose a card or access cards and do not steal or trash any of them, place 1 virus counter on Aumakua.
Aumakua has +1 strength for each virus counter on it.
1[credit]: Break ice subroutine.

data.flavor: The electric pulses ripped through the Net, backtracking Los's location. When they hit his defenses, they spent themselves against the slope.
data.text: 3[credit]: Prevent 1 net or brain damage.

data.text: Make a run. Whenever you encounter a piece of ice during this run, you may install a program from your grip, ignoring all costs. When this run ends, trash all programs installed using Diana's Hunt.

data.flavor: "I wield the power cosmic - a galactic force that can reshape the Net!" -S'onge Galaxy
data.text: Swap 2 pieces of unrezzed ice.

data.flavor: "Aptly named." -g00ru
data.text: Trash a card from your grip: Prevent an installed card of the same type from being trashed by the Corp.

data.flavor: He was suddenly very motivated to pass on confidential information.
data.text: Whenever the Corp spends a [click] to draw a card (not through a card effect), reveal that card.

data.flavor: "Sure, we also use human labor - they are more easily replaced." -Emil Merk

[click]: Place 1 power counter on MCA Austerity Policy. When the Runner's next turn begins, he or she loses [click]. Use this ability only once per turn.
[click],[trash], 3 hosted power counters: Gain [click],[click],[click],[click].

If Breached Dome is accessed from R&D, the Runner must reveal it.
When the Runner accesses Breached Dome, do 1 meat damage and trash the top card of the stack.

data.flavor: By the time the data storm passed, the landscape was transformed, and she was hopelessly lost.
data.text: [subroutine] Move Sand Storm so that it is the outermost piece of ice protecting another server (the Runner continues the run from this new position and is now running on this new server). Trash Sand Storm.

data.flavor: Only NBN's sec teams were outfitted with systems that could read data flows and see into the Net.
data.text: The first time the Runner trashes a Corp card each turn, give him or her 1 tag.
data.title: AR-Enhanced Security

As an additional cost to play this operation, spend [click].
<trace>Trace 1</trace> If successful, give the Runner 1 tag for each tag he or she has; if the Runner has no tags, give him or her 1 tag.

As an additional cost to play this operation, spend [click].
Install a piece of ice from HQ protecting a remote server (ignoring all costs). Place 3 advancement tokens on that ice.

data.flavor: "I embedded recursive data loops into the go-no-go subroutines of every piece of ice." -Anson Rose
data.text: Each time all the subroutines are broken on a piece of ice protecting this server, trash the top 2 cards of the stack.
data.title: Fractal Threat Matrix

data.flavor: A ghost image of it could be made out in the static of his BMI. He hoped never to run across the real thing again.
data.text: Conundrum has +3 strength if there is an installed AI. [subroutine] The Runner trashes an installed program. [subroutine] The Runner loses [click], if able. [subroutine] End the run.

data.text: The first time each turn that you make a successful run on HQ, you may choose 2 cards in your heap, if able. The Corp removes 1 from the game; the other is added to your grip.
data.title: Steve Cambridge: Master Grifter

data.flavor: "Bypassing a system's defenses by cutting physical wires is what I like to call old school." - Steve Cambridge
data.text:
As an additional cost to play this event, spend [click].
Derez a piece of ice that has a rez cost of X or lower.
data.title: Brute-Force-Hack

data.flavor: Targeted attacks make system breaches so much easier, especially if you can spoof an authorized user.

data.flavor: Flooding the system with synchronized request messages makes it unresponsive to legitimate requests.

The Corp must either discard 2 cards or draw 4 cards.

data.flavor: "Technology breeds crime."

data.flavor: "Never boast. Just let your importance be quietly obvious."
data.text: 1[credit]: Break sentry subroutine. 3[credit]: +5 strength. [trash]: Bypass a piece of sentry ice currently being encountered, even if it has strength greater than Lustig.

data.flavor: "It's a matter of 'acquiring' the right credentials."
data.text: 2[credit]: Break up to 2 barrier subroutines. 2[credit]: +3 strength. [trash]: Bypass a piece of barrier ice currently being encountered, even if it has strength greater than Demara.

data.flavor: Know your mark, their weaknesses and strengths--both will show how to best bypass their defenses.
data.text: [click], [click]: Make a run. The first time you approach a rezzed piece of ice during this run, you may pay credits equal to the strength of that ice to bypass it.
data.title: Charlatan

data.flavor: You remember when Maxi was making book for Chacon. He's moved up in the world and gained the veneer of respectability. But as an executive the people he works for now, are far more vicious, bloodthirsty, and crooked.
data.text:
+1[link]
[trash]: Derez a piece of ice protecting a remote server. Use this ability only during the next paid ability window after a successful run on HQ ends.

Before drawing your starting hand, look at the top 6 cards of your stack. Set 4 of them facedown, as NVRAM. Shuffle the rest into your stack.
[click]: Add 1 card from NVRAM to your grip.

data.flavor: Each AI had been tasked with finding a solution to the same problem but with different variables.

Play only as your first [click].

data.flavor: Extracting data from complex systems is what running is all about.

+1[mu], +1[link]
Your maximum hand size is increased by 1.

data.flavor: "It is more than just a 'pretty nanite plant'. It's a complex synthetic intelligent distributed network, and a VERY pretty nanite plant." - Bios

data.flavor: Restructuring labor resources.

data.text: [trash]: Choose an icebreaker. Until the end of the run, that icebreaker has +1 strength for each card in your grip.

data.flavor: She left behind an encrypted trail leading to some random employee for a rival corp. She knew lazy sysops would work just hard enough to figure it out and wouldn't bother looking any deeper.
data.text: [trash]: Prevent 2 damage.
data.title: Biometric Spoofing

data.flavor: A despicable web of outcasts and infamy, no government or corporation could effectively shut it down. If only because so many of their sysops, executives, and covert agents made use of it.

data.flavor: "They say he is an ex-runner. I don't know if it is true, but he is chromed to the gills and seems to know all the runners' tricks."

data.flavor: I feel almost naked without it
data.text: 1[recurring-credit] Use this credit to pay for using icebreakers or for installing virus programs.

Place 2 virus counters on Imp when it is installed.

data.flavor: Bleeding data is more of a science than an art. Too much and you can end up with a one-way ticket to flatline city. Not enough and you might as well be running an empty server.

data.flavor: November 5th: the day when all would see the corrupt machinations of the corporate oligarchy.
data.text: 1[credit]: Break sentry subroutine.

data.flavor: Weaponizing the heavens, one star at a time.
