data.flavor: In the public consciousness, there's a hard line between corp and runner. In the real world, things are a little more porous. The corp need the best hackers to run their networks, and some of the best hackers are ex-runners who like the idea of a regular paycheck. But sometimes things run the other way, and someone on the inside makes something like this.
data.text: All ice is encountered with its strength lowered by 1.
data.title: Ice Carver

data.flavor: It's easier to spend when it's not your money.
data.text:
Place 16[credit] from the bank on Liberated Account when it is installed. When there are no credits left on Liberated Account, trash it.
[click]: Take 4[credit] from Liberated Account.
data.title: Liberated Account

data.flavor: "They're mindless tools of destruction, good for little else. Nice guys, though. Some of my best friends are scrubbers." -Ji "Noise" Reilly
data.text:
2[recurring-credit]
Use these credits to trash cards.
data.title: Scrubber

data.flavor:
And all should cry, Beware! Beware!
His flashing eyes, his floating hair!
Weave a circle round him thrice,
And close your eyes with holy dread,
For he on honey-dew hath fed,
And drunk the milk of Paradise.
-Samuel Taylor Coleridge
data.text: The rez cost of all ice is increased by 1.
data.title: Xanadu

data.flavor: "Of course I steal from the rich. They're the ones with all the money."
data.text: The first time you make a successful run on HQ each turn, gain 2[credit].
data.title: Gabriel Santiago: Consummate Professional

data.flavor: "Hey kid, you fire that up now, bound to be vamped real bad. Some real pathetic individuals around here. But thankfully I got just the ticket…"
data.text: Gain 3[credit].
data.title: Easy Mark

data.flavor: "Think of it as a virtual shock collar for punishing corporate pets." -Andromeda
data.text:
Play only if you made a successful run on HQ this turn.
Derez a piece of ice.
data.title: Emergency Shutdown

data.flavor: As the hysteria in the room climbed higher up the corporate chain, an uneasy feeling of joblessness began to sink in on the lower rungs.
data.text: Choose an unrezzed piece of ice. The Corp must either rez that ice or trash it.
data.title: Forged Activation Orders

data.flavor: "Hey, listen, I'm not asking you to do anything dangerous. Just let me into the building. And tell me which room has the weakest security. And please don't say 'the bathroom' again."
data.text: Make a run. Bypass the first piece of ice encountered during this run.
data.title: Inside Job

data.flavor: Feverishly tracking its frustratingly slow progress across the Pacific, the package finally shows up hours later…
data.text: Search your stack for an icebreaker, reveal it, and add it to your grip. Shuffle your stack.
data.title: Special Order

data.flavor: Twice the fun.
data.text: +1[mu] Once per turn, you may immediately make another run when a successful run ends. Limit 1 console per player.
data.title: Doppelgänger

data.flavor: If you don't have someone on the inside, find someone on the inside who's fond of desk ornaments.
data.text: Whenever you access cards from HQ, access 1 additional card from HQ.
data.title: HQ Interface

data.text: 2[credit]: Break barrier subroutine. 2[credit]: +3 strength.
data.title: Aurora

data.flavor: Do you believe in faeries?
data.text: 0[credit]: Break sentry subroutine. 1[credit]: +1 strength. When an encounter with a piece of ice in which you used Faerie to break a subroutine ends, trash Faerie.
data.title: Faerie

data.text: 1[credit]: Break sentry subroutine. 2[credit]: +1 strength. When you install Femme Fatale, choose an installed piece of ice. When you encounter that ice, you may pay 1[credit] per subroutine on that ice to bypass it.
data.title: Femme Fatale

data.flavor: Show-off.
data.text: 2[credit]: Break code gate subroutine. 2[credit]: +3 strength.
data.title: Peacock

data.text:
X[recurring-credit]
Use these credits during runs on HQ. X is the number of virus counters on Pheromones.
Whenever you make a successful run on HQ, place 1 virus counter on Pheromones.
data.title: Pheromones

data.flavor: "The code isn't important. It's where the code takes you that is important." -g00ru
data.text: [click]: Make a run on Archives. If successful, instead treat it as a successful run on HQ.
data.title: Sneakdoor Beta

data.text:
Place 8[credit] from the bank on Bank Job when it is installed. When there are no credits left on Bank Job, trash it.
Whenever you make a successful run on a remote server, instead of accessing cards you may take any number of credits from Bank Job.
data.title: Bank Job

data.flavor: "My roomie, he had a cousin with a college girlfriend whose brother's best friend was an addict, and the addict's mother used to live here. So yeah, there's a connection." -Lez "Rockfist" S.
data.text:
2[recurring-credit]
Use these credits to pay for removing tags.
[trash]: Prevent up to 3 meat damage.
data.title: Crash Space

data.flavor: There are good, honest, hardworking cops in the NAPD. Officers who do their best to bring justice to the guilty and protect the innocent. Fortunately for the criminals, they're outnumbered by the other kind. The kind who are much easier to work with.
data.text:
[trash]: Prevent another installed resource from being trashed.
[trash]: Gain 2[credit].
data.title: Fall Guy

data.flavor:
"We're always happy to help, Mr. Santiago."
"I appreciate it, Mr. Li."
"We'll be in touch. And, Gabriel…"
"Yes?"
"Don't leave town."
data.text: [click]: Draw 2 cards. Add 1 of these cards to the bottom of your stack.
data.title: Mr. Li

data.flavor: "Have you met Dinosaurus?"
data.title: Chaos Theory: Wünderkind

data.flavor: Diesel gives you flames.
data.text: Draw 3 cards.
data.title: Diesel

data.flavor: A little corporate restructuring is necessary once in a while.
data.text: Make a run on R&D. If successful, instead of accessing cards you may look at the top 5 cards of R&D and arrange them in any order.
data.title: Indexing

data.flavor: There's no replacement for a home-grown program. Fed on late nights, oaty bars and single-minded determination. Cheaper, too.
data.text: Install a program or piece of hardware, lowering the install cost by 3.
data.title: Modded

data.flavor: When you're this good, it's hard not to grow a fan base.
data.text:
Play only if you made a successful run on R&D, HQ, and Archives this turn.
Add Notoriety to your score area as an agenda worth 1 agenda point.
data.title: Notoriety

data.text: Search your stack or heap for a program. Install that program, ignoring all costs. Shuffle your stack if you searched it. When this turn ends, add the program to the top of your stack if it is still installed.
data.title: Test Run

data.flavor: "Some of the professionals have good instincts, but they can't see beyond the data. They can't see the matrix." -Ele "Smoke" Scovak
data.text: Make a run on R&D. If successful, access 2 additional cards from R&D.
data.title: The Maker's Eye

data.flavor: "There's that moment, you know, when the whole world seems to fall away and it is only you and your mod, and the mod is the world."
data.text: Choose a piece of ice. That ice gains sentry, code gate, and barrier until the end of the turn.
data.title: Tinkering

data.text: Dinosaurus can host a single non-AI icebreaker. The memory cost of the hosted icebreaker does not count against your memory limit. Hosted icebreaker has +2 strength. Limit 1 console per player.
data.title: Dinosaurus

data.flavor: It's not endless, it just feels that way.
data.text:
+1[link]
When Rabbit Hole is installed, you may search your stack for another copy of Rabbit Hole and install it by paying its install cost. Shuffle your stack.
data.title: Rabbit Hole

data.flavor: A z-loop here, a cortical wave there…
data.text: Install The Personal Touch only on an icebreaker. Host icebreaker has +1 strength.
data.title: The Personal Touch

data.flavor: "It's called 'brute-forcing' and it's just as effective today as it was a hundred years ago." -Kate "Mac" McCaffrey
data.text: 2[credit]: Break up to 2 barrier subroutines. 1[credit]: +1 strength for the remainder of this run.
data.title: Battering Ram

data.flavor: It can slice through the thickest knots of data.
data.text: 1[credit]: Break code gate subroutine. 1[credit]: +1 strength for the remainder of this run.
data.title: Gordian Blade

data.flavor: The Great Work was completed on a rainy Thursday afternoon. There were no seismic shifts, no solar flares, no sign from the earth or heavens that the world had changed. But upstalk in Heinlein, on a single Cybsoft manufactured datacore, the flickering data quantums of an account began to fill with creds. Real, honest-to-goodness UN certified creds.
data.text: [click]: Gain 2[credit].
data.title: Magnum Opus

data.text: 1[credit]: Break sentry subroutine. 2[credit]: +1 strength for the remainder of this run.
data.title: Pipeline

data.flavor: You didn't mention Aesop's arm unless you wanted an earful. Sometimes he talked about it in such a way that you wondered why he didn't laser his other arm off as well.
data.text: When your turn begins, you may trash another of your installed cards to gain 3[credit].
data.title: Aesop's Pawnshop

data.flavor: "I don't care what the studies show. From my experience, I can ingest three cans of Diesel an hour for up to twelve hours before going into cardiac arrest." -heard during the eleventh hour
data.text: [click], [trash]: Gain [click][click].
data.title: All-nighter

data.flavor: The life expectancy of a jacked construct is about that of a mayfly. In other words, short.
data.text: [trash]: Prevent an installed program or an installed piece of hardware from being trashed.
data.title: Sacrificial Construct

data.flavor: "Bring back any memories, Monica?" -John "Animal" McEvoy
data.text: Gain 2[credit] or expose 1 card.
data.title: Infiltration

data.flavor: Lady Luck took the form of a hifi quantum manipulation ring that she wore on her middle finger.
data.text: Gain 9[credit].
data.title: Sure Gamble

data.flavor: Archaic but reliable.
data.text: +1[mu], +1[link]
data.title: Dyson Mem Chip

data.text:
1[credit]: Break ice subroutine.
1[credit]: +1 strength.
[click]: Place 1 virus counter on Crypsis.
When an encounter with a piece of ice in which you used Crypsis to break a subroutine ends, remove 1 hosted virus counter or trash Crypsis.
data.title: Crypsis

data.flavor: Drudge work, but it pays the bills.
data.text:
Place 12[credit] from the bank on Armitage Codebusting when it is installed. When there are no credits left on Armitage Codebusting, trash it.
[click]: Take 2[credit] from Armitage Codebusting.
data.title: Armitage Codebusting

data.flavor: "My boss rewards quality work. If you know what's good for you, you'll keep it up."
data.text: When your turn begins, gain 1[credit] if you have at least 2[link].
data.title: Underworld Contact

data.flavor: A Different Breed of Machine.
data.text: All bioroid ice has +1 strength.
data.title: Haas-Bioroid: Stronger Together

data.flavor: Who wants to start a war?
data.text: When you score Project Ares, the Runner trashes 1 of his or her installed cards for each advancement token on Project Ares over 4. If the Runner trashes at least 1 card, take 1 bad publicity.
data.title: Project Ares

data.text: When you score Project Vitruvius, place 1 agenda counter on it for each advancement token on it over 3. Hosted agenda counter: Add 1 card from Archives to HQ.
data.title: Project Vitruvius

data.text:
Put 12[credit] from the bank on Adonis Campaign when rezzed. When there are no credits left on Adonis Campaign, trash it.
Take 3[credit] from Adonis Campaign when your turn begins.
data.title: Adonis Campaign

data.text:
Aggressive Secretary can be advanced.
If you pay 2[credit] when the Runner accesses Aggressive Secretary, trash 1 program for each advancement token on Aggressive Secretary.
data.title: Aggressive Secretary

data.flavor: I hear the shift of every bit amid the flow of the datastream. I hear the whispers of my mothers, and their commands are law. The realm beyond is forbidden.
data.text:
The Runner can spend [click] to break any subroutine on Heimdall 1.0.
[subroutine] Do 1 brain damage.
[subroutine] End the run.
[subroutine] End the run.
data.title: Heimdall 1.0

data.flavor: I'm not here to play games. The game is over.
data.text:
The Runner may spend [click] to break any subroutine on Hudson 1.0.
[subroutine] The Runner cannot access more than 1 card during this run.
[subroutine] The Runner cannot access more than 1 card during this run.
data.title: Hudson 1.0

data.flavor: My reputation would precede me, if any could speak of it.
data.text:
The Runner can spend [click] to break any subroutine on Ichi 1.0.
[subroutine] Trash 1 program.
[subroutine] Trash 1 program.
[subroutine] <trace>Trace 1</trace> If successful, give the Runner 1 tag and do 1 brain damage.
data.title: Ichi 1.0

data.flavor: Whrrrrr!
data.text:
[subroutine] Trash 1 program.
[subroutine] End the run.
data.title: Rototurret

data.flavor: My name is Viktor. Nice to meet you. Would you like to play a game?
data.text:
The Runner can spend [click] to break any subroutine on Viktor 1.0.
[subroutine] Do 1 brain damage.
[subroutine] End the run.
data.title: Viktor 1.0

data.flavor: "Do you think they…feel it?"
data.text: Add 1 card from Archives to HQ.
data.title: Archived Memories

data.flavor: "Why of course, we have six different Haas-Bioroid models serving in a variety of positions at this branch office alone. We here at Haas-Bioroid aren't going to shy away from practicing what we preach, and we pass the savings from increased efficiency on to our valued customers."
data.text: Gain [click][click].
data.title: Biotic Labor

data.flavor: Green-two clearance is the highest level of security a corp can gain access to. Legally, anyway.
data.text: Gain 3[credit] and draw 1 card.
data.title: Green Level Clearance

data.flavor: The new heads were in. Their eyes always followed your movements when you unlocked the pressurized container and lifted the lid.
data.text: Install up to 3 cards from HQ (one at a time and paying all install costs).
data.title: Shipment from MirrorMorph

data.flavor: "Eyes forward please."
data.text: Whenever there is a successful run on this server, <trace>trace 4</trace> if successful, the Runner cannot access any cards other than Ash 2X3ZB9CY for the remainder of this run.
data.title: Ash 2X3ZB9CY

data.text: Each time the Runner accesses an agenda from this server, he or she must spend [click] as an additional cost in order to steal it. This applies even during the run on which the Runner trashes Strongbox.
data.title: Strongbox

data.flavor: Moving Upwards.
data.text: Gain 1[credit] whenever you play a transaction operation.
data.title: Weyland Consortium: Building a Better World

data.flavor: There are going to be some changes around here.
data.text: When you score Hostile Takeover, gain 7[credit] and take 1 bad publicity.
data.title: Hostile Takeover

data.text: When you score Project Atlas, place 1 agenda counter on it for each advancement token on it over 3. Hosted agenda counter: Search R&D for 1 card, reveal it, and add it to HQ. Shuffle R&D.
data.title: Project Atlas

data.flavor: "I use bioroids because I can wipe their memories or just blow their brains out when the job is done. No witnesses means no witnesses."
data.text: Whenever you do meat damage, do 1 additional meat damage.
data.title: The Cleaners

data.flavor: They don't call them dedicated for nothing
data.text: If the Runner is tagged, Dedicated Response Team gains "Whenever a successful run ends, do 2 meat damage."
data.title: Dedicated Response Team

data.flavor: "It's not personal. Urban renewal is a necessity of the modern world. It's always someone's home, yours is no different."
data.text: When you rez Elizabeth Mills, remove 1 bad publicity. [click], [trash]: Trash 1 location. Take 1 bad publicity.
data.title: Elizabeth Mills

data.flavor: GRNDL refineries process many different rare elements unearthed during the fracking process.
data.text:
GRNDL Refinery can be advanced.
[click], [trash]: Gain 4[credit] for each advancement token on GRNDL Refinery.
data.title: GRNDL Refinery

data.flavor: Next time, read the Terms of Service more carefully. Or you might find yourself in the danger zone.
data.text:
As an additional cost to rez Archer, the Corp must forfeit an agenda.
[subroutine] The Corp gains 2[credit].
[subroutine] Trash 1 program.
[subroutine] Trash 1 program.
[subroutine] End the run.
data.title: Archer

data.flavor: A symbol of commerce, but beware its bite.
data.text:
[subroutine] <trace>Trace 3</trace> If successful, the Corp gains 3[credit].
[subroutine] <trace>Trace 2</trace> If successful, end the run.
data.title: Caduceus

data.flavor: "He had a bit of an ego, ol' Hadrian. his constructs live up to it though." -g00ru
data.text:
Hadrian's Wall can be advanced and has +1 strength for each advancement token on it.
[subroutine] End the run.
[subroutine] End the run.
data.title: Hadrian's Wall

data.text:
Hive loses an "[subroutine] End the run." subroutine for each agenda point in the Corp's score area.
[subroutine] End the run.
[subroutine] End the run.
[subroutine] End the run.
[subroutine] End the run.
[subroutine] End the run.
data.title: Hive

data.flavor: "I asked for ice as impenetrable as a wall. I can't decide if someone down in R&D has a warped sense of humor or just a very literal mind." -Liz Campbell, VP Project Security
data.text:
Ice Wall can be advanced and has +1 strength for each advancement token on it.
[subroutine] End the run.
data.title: Ice Wall

data.flavor: Who knows what evil lurks in the memory diamonds of men? Weyland knows. -unsigned cyber-graffiti
data.text:
Shadow can be advanced and has +1 strength for each advancement token on it.
[subroutine] The Corp gains 2[credit].
[subroutine] <trace>Trace 3</trace> If successful, give the Runner 1 tag.
data.title: Shadow

data.flavor: The New Angeles Space Elevator, better known as the Beanstalk, is the single greatest triumph of human engineering and ingenuity in history. The Beanstalk makes Earth orbit accessible to everyone…for a small fee.
data.text: Gain 3[credit].
data.title: Beanstalk Royalties

data.flavor: "I'd say it's nothing personal, but corporations are people, too."
data.text: <trace>Trace 5</trace> If successful, do meat damage to the Runner equal to the number of printed agenda points on agendas he or she stole during his or her last turn.
data.title: Punitive Counterstrike

data.flavor:
"And then there's these two crates. No eID."
"Just leave those with me and forget you ever saw them."
data.text: Place 1 advancement token on each of up to 2 different installed cards that can be advanced.
data.title: Shipment from Kaguya

data.flavor: When You Need the Human Touch.
data.text: Whenever an agenda is scored or stolen, do 1 net damage.
data.title: Jinteki: Personal Evolution

data.text:
When you score Braintrust, place 1 agenda counter on it for every 2 advancement tokens on it over 3.
The rez cost of all ice is lowered by 1 for each agenda counter on Braintrust.
data.title: Braintrust

data.text: Place 1 agenda counter on Nisei MK II when you score it. Hosted agenda counter: End the run.
data.title: Nisei MK II

data.text:
Project Junebug can be advanced.
If you pay 1[credit] when the Runner accesses Project Junebug, do 2 net damage for each advancement token on Project Junebug.
data.title: Project Junebug

data.flavor: I will serve you…for a time.
data.text:
Ronin can be advanced.
If there are at least 4 advancement tokens on Ronin, it gains "[click], [trash]: Do 3 net damage."
data.title: Ronin

data.text:
If Snare! is accessed from R&D, the Runner must reveal it.
If you pay 4[credit] when the Runner accesses Snare!, do 3 net damage and give the Runner 1 tag. Ignore this effect if the Runner accesses Snare! from Archives.
data.title: Snare!

data.flavor: Himitsu-Bako is a simple ice barrier that appears as a digital puzzle box. What makes it special is the ease with which it can be uninstalled and installed in a different server, throwing up barriers in unexpected places and giving any intruder a curious feeling of déjà vu.
data.text:
1[credit]: Add Himitsu-Bako to HQ.
[subroutine] End the run.
data.title: Himitsu-Bako

data.flavor:
Forged by Ak.wa on 23.11.79-23. Filed 23.11.79-23.2 with #34k-lw3-21HH-4i.
//Samurai included.
data.text: [subroutine] Do 3 net damage.
data.title: Neural Katana

data.flavor: Writing a program that can pass the Turing test is easy. The Gibson-Akamatsu test is a higher bar, and the only AIs to clear it thus far have been the androids. Even some humans have been known to fail.
data.text: The Runner cannot use AI programs to break subroutines on Swordsman. [subroutine] Trash 1 AI program. [subroutine] Do 1 net damage.
data.title: Swordsman

data.flavor: Most runners do their business in full-sim, with their rigs wired directly into their brains. The setup has a large number of advantages, with the runner able to process data and input commands far faster than a traditional meat-bound system. But it also means greater risk.
data.text:
[subroutine] Do 2 net damage.
[subroutine] End the run.
data.title: Wall of Thorns

data.flavor: "This ice sucks." -g00ru
data.text: [subroutine] The Runner cannot jack out for the remainder of this run. Trash Whirlpool.
data.title: Whirlpool

data.flavor: The 'cyber-war' is a war of information, and in a war of information, advance warning can be as good as a killing blow. -Michael Muhama, Musings on Cybercrime
data.text:
[subroutine] Look at the top card of R&D. You may add that card to the bottom of R&D.
[subroutine] Do 1 net damage.
data.title: Yagura

data.flavor: When Miranda Rhapsody showed up with a teacup giraffe, suddenly everybody wanted one.
data.text:
As an additional cost to play this operation, spend [click].
Reveal up to 5 cards in HQ to the Runner. Gain 2[credit] for each card revealed.
data.title: Celebrity Gift

data.flavor: The trick isn't hitting the person you were aiming at. It's hitting only the person you were aiming at.
data.text:
Play only if the Runner made a run during his or her last turn.
Do 1 net damage.
data.title: Neural EMP

data.flavor: Smoke and mirrors optional.
data.text: Move up to 2 advancement tokens from a card to another installed card that can be advanced.
data.title: Trick of Light

data.flavor: Despite its appearance, the Hokusai Grid is the most notorious research facility at Jinteki.
data.text: Whenever there is a successful run on this server, do 1 net damage. Limit 1 region per server.
data.title: Hokusai Grid

data.flavor: Someone is Always Watching.
data.text:
2[recurring-credit]
Use these credits during trace attempts.
data.title: NBN: Making News

data.text:
When you score Project Beale, place 1 agenda counter on it for every 2 advancement tokens on it over 3.
Project Beale is worth 1 additional agenda point for each agenda counter on it.
data.title: Project Beale

data.flavor: "The damn raven just kind of cawed at me as I went past. I should have known it was too good to be true."
data.text:
If TGTBT is accessed from R&D, the Runner must reveal it.
When the Runner accesses TGTBT, give the Runner 1 tag.
data.title: TGTBT

data.text:
Ghost Branch can be advanced.
When the Runner accesses Ghost Branch, you may give the Runner 1 tag for each advancement token on Ghost Branch.
data.title: Ghost Branch

data.text: When the Runner encounters Data Raven, he or she must either take 1 tag or end the run. Hosted power counter: Give the Runner 1 tag. [subroutine] Trace 3 If successful, place 1 power counter on Data Raven.
data.title: Data Raven

data.flavor: A bright light blossomed, and then the console went dark. That's when she smelled smoke.
data.text: [subroutine]<trace>Trace 6</trace> If successful, trash 1 piece of hardware, do 2 meat damage (cannot be prevented), and end the run.
data.title: Flare

data.flavor: "Try to close it. Go on. See what it does." -Chaos Theory
data.text:
When the Runner encounters Pop-up Window, you gain 1[credit].
[subroutine] End the run unless the Runner pays 1[credit].
data.title: Pop-up Window

data.flavor:
"Ever heard of a catch-22?"
"Remind me to forget it."
data.text:
When the Runner encounters Tollbooth, he or she must pay 3[credit], if able. If the Runner cannot pay 3[credit], end the run.
[subroutine] End the run.
data.title: Tollbooth

data.flavor: "It can make a real fine roller coaster, provided you're properly stimmed up." -Noise
data.text: If there is no installed fracter, Wraparound has +7 strength. [subroutine] End the run.
data.title: Wraparound

data.flavor: "Please stay connected. Priority transfer in progress. An operator will shortly verif-"
data.text: Draw 3 cards.
data.title: Anonymous Tip

data.text:
Play only if the Runner is tagged.
The Runner loses all credits in his or her credit pool.
data.title: Closed Accounts

data.flavor: Access to the largest consumer database in the galaxy has its advantages.
data.text:
X is equal to or less than the number of tags the Runner has.
Place X advancement tokens on a card that can be advanced.
data.title: Psychographics

data.flavor: "The SEA tipped us off to some suspicious data spikes up by the Castle." -Jerome Lock, on-duty tech
data.text:
Play only if the Runner made a successful run during his or her last turn.
<trace>Trace 3</trace> If successful, give the Runner 1 tag.
data.title: SEA Source

data.text: Each time the Runner accesses an agenda from this server, he or she must pay 5[credit] as an additional cost in order to steal it. This applies even during the run on which the Runner trashes Red Herrings.
data.title: Red Herrings

data.flavor: Keeping tabs on the world, one screen at a time.
data.text: Whenever there is a successful run on this server, <trace>trace 5</trace> if successful, give the Runner 1 tag. If unsuccessful, trash Bernice Mai.
data.title: Bernice Mai

data.flavor: It didn't look like the headquarters of a multi-billion cred company. Probably because it wasn't.
data.text: Forfeit False Lead: The Runner loses [click][click], if able.
data.title: False Lead

data.flavor: "If it isn't in my terminal by six p.m., heads are going to roll!"
data.text: When you score Priority Requisition, you may rez a piece of ice ignoring all costs.
data.title: Priority Requisition

data.flavor: "Expensive? Not when you're protecting a fortune as large as ours."
data.text: If the Runner is tagged, Private Security Force gains: "[click]: Do 1 meat damage."
data.title: Private Security Force

data.flavor: "The mining bosses are worse than any downstalk crime lords. Tri-Maf, 4K, Yak, I don't care what gangs you got down there. In Heinlein there's just one law: the He3 must flow." -"Old" Rick Henry, escaped clone.
data.text: [click], [click], [click]: Gain 7[credit].
data.title: Melange Mining Corp.

data.flavor: It is like the one you just bought, only better.
data.text: Gain 1[credit] when your turn begins.
data.title: PAD Campaign

data.flavor:
"Hey, hey! Wake up man. You were under a long time. What'd you see?"
"I…don't remember."
data.text:
[subroutine] The Runner loses [click], if able.
[subroutine] End the run.
data.title: Enigma

data.flavor:
.//run/hunter-tr/return=true
client/sec256IPv7->confirm? /y
3926:0HB7:1001:2NB1:1601:7784:ERROR
data.text: [subroutine] <trace>Trace 3</trace> If successful, give the Runner 1 tag.
data.title: Hunter

data.flavor: "There's nothing worse than seeing that beautiful blue ball of data just out of reach as your connection derezzes. I think they do it just to taunt us." -Ele "Smoke" Scovak
data.text: [subroutine] End the run.
data.title: Wall of Static

data.flavor: Hedge Fund. Noun. An ingenious device by which the rich get richer even while every other poor SOB is losing his shirt. -The Anarch's Dictionary, Volume Who's Counting?
data.text: Gain 9[credit].
data.title: Hedge Fund

data.text:
Play only as your first [click].
Until the turn ends, whenever you access a card not in Archives, trash it at no cost (even if it cannot normally be trashed) and suffer 1 meat damage.
data.title: By Any Means

data.text: Whenever you make a successful run, you may place 1 virus counter on Yusuf. Virus counter from any installed card: Break barrier subroutine. Virus counter from any installed card: +1 strength.
data.title: Yusuf

data.flavor: Mounted holistic lenses download, recompile, and broadcast data faster than a corporate cover-up.
data.text: +2[mu] Whenever a Corp card is exposed, you may gain 1[credit]. Limit 1 console per player.
data.title: Zamba

data.text: 1[credit]: Break sentry subroutine. 2[credit]: +1 strength. [click]: Place 1 power counter on Puffer or remove 1 power counter from Puffer. Puffer's strength and memory cost are increased by 1 for each power counter on it.
data.title: Puffer

data.flavor: Brought up in the slums of Jinja, Lewi made his fortune through back alley deals, well-placed bets, and savvy showmanship.
data.text:
When your turn begins, either lose 1[credit] or trash Lewi Guilherme.
The Corp's maximum hand size is reduced by 1.
data.title: Lewi Guilherme

data.flavor: Optical computig still has its uses. But it's hard to explain them to people whose eyes glaze over when you bring up the double-slit experiment.
data.text:
+1[mu]
The first time you break all subroutines on a piece of ice each turn, you may gain 1[credit].
data.title: Cyberdelia

data.flavor: New life through new understanding.
data.text: Whenever you make a successful run on R&D, you may place 1 power counter on Upya. [click], 3 hosted power counters: Gain [click][click]. Use this ability only once per turn.
data.title: Upya

data.flavor:
"Its only function seems to be repurposing code."
"Can you kill it?" she asked.
"I can try," he said. Guiding his program dead center of the mass, he plunged, piercing the shell before an eruption sent his screen into static. He jacked out, his eyes wide. "I... I think it absorbed my breaker. And everything else."
data.text: [click],[click]: Turn one of your facedown installed cards faceup. If that card is an event, trash it.
data.title: Assimilator

data.text: The first time you install a card each turn, you may install an additional non-agenda card from HQ in or protecting that server (paying all costs).
data.title: Asa Group: Security Through Vigilance

data.flavor: "The average citizen of Nairobi speaks six languages. Every culture, language, and ethnicity of the east of Africa collides here, collapses together. What happens slowly by nature can happen quickly in our lab. We will bring peace." - Dr. Muchina, Project Lead
data.text: As an additional cost to steal Ikawah Project, the Runner must spend [click] and 2[credit].
data.title: Ikawah Project

data.flavor: Earth and Sun, together as one.
data.text:
The Runner may spend [click] to break any subroutine on Najja 1.0.
[subroutine] End the run.

[subroutine] End the run.
data.title: Najja 1.0

data.text: Gene Splicer can be advanced. When the runner accesses Gene Splicer, do 1 net damage for each advancement token on Gene Splicer. [click], 3 advancement tokens: Add Gene Splicer to your score area as an agenda worth 1 agenda point.
data.title: Gene Splicer

data.flavor: Thin enough to pierce netspace. Deadly enough to pierce your mind.
data.text: [subroutine] You and the Runner secretly spend 0[credit], 1[credit] or 2[credit]. Reveal spent credits. If you and the Runner spend a different number of credits, do 2 net damage; otherwise do 1 net damage. Trash Mganga.
data.title: Mganga

data.flavor: Sometimes you have to break a few eggs to sequence a genome.
data.text: Trash the top 2 cards of R&D, then shuffle up to 4 cards from Archives into R&D. Remove Genotyping from the game instead of trashing it.
data.title: Genotyping

data.flavor: "Capitalism runs on two things: amplified arrogance and censored dissent. With those, a corp can create any environment it wants." - Freedom Khumalo
data.text: [click], [click], [click]: Add Echo Chamber to your score area as an agenda worth 1 agenda point.
data.title: Echo Chamber

data.flavor: Our patented ClearMind™ technology pacifies the trial and tribulations of everyday life.
data.text:
Play only if the Runner is tagged.
Add 2 installed Runner cards to the grip.
data.title: Self-Growth Program

data.flavor: "Once every week, we perform a drill. Except, I'm the only one who knows it's a drill."
data.text:
Install only in a remote server.
[trash]: Place 1 advancement token on a card in this server.
data.title: Calibration Testing

data.text:
Place 3 power counters on Urban Renewal when it is rezzed. When there are no power counters left on Urban Renewal, trash it and do 4 meat damage.
When your turn begins, remove 1 power counter from Urban Renewal.
data.title: Urban Renewal

data.text: Play only if the Runner trashed at least 1 Corp card during his or her last turn. Choose an installed piece of hardware or non-virtual resource. The Runner must either trash that card or suffer 4 meat damage. Remove Wake Up Call from the game instead of trashing it.
data.title: Wake Up Call

data.text:
Whenever the Runner suffers any amount of meat damage, you may place 1 advancement token on Reconstruction Contract.
[trash]: Move any number of advancement tokens from Reconstruction Contract to a card that can be advanced.
data.title: Reconstruction Contract

data.flavor: The system is so deeply rooted, who knows how far the cables run?
data.text: Whenever the Corp purges virus counters, you may gain 1[credit] for each virus counter removed and trash Acacia.
data.title: Acacia

data.flavor: Embedded in the mainframe, it proliferates and devours with each agitation.
data.text:
When you install Plague, choose a server.
Whenever you make a successful run on the chosen server, you may place 2 virus counters on Plague.
data.title: Plague

data.flavor: The gap of 0.19 seconds was all he needed.
data.text:
Play only if you made a successful run on a central server this turn.
Install a card from your grip, lowering its install cost by 8[credit], and take 1 tag.
data.title: Credit Kiting

data.flavor: "He's probably the best pet I've ever had but I'd still trade him for something better." - 419
data.text: The first time you make a successful run on HQ each turn, you may trash Wari to name sentry, code gate or barrier. Expose a piece of ice, then add it to HQ if it has the named subtype.
data.title: Wari

data.text: [click]: Search your stack for a non-virus program and install it, lowering its install cost by 1[credit], then shuffle your stack. If that program is still installed when your turn ends, remove it from the game.
data.title: Kabonesa Wu: Netspace Thrillseeker

data.flavor: When standard breaking just doesn't cut it.
data.text: Whenever you break all subroutines on a piece of ice during a single encounter, you may place 1 power counter on Takobi. 2 hosted power counters: Choose a non-AI icebreaker. That icebreaker has +3 strength until the end of the current encounter.
data.title: Takobi

data.flavor: A winged terror, the Kongamato dives from above, rending its prey in one ferocious bite.
data.text: [trash]: Break the first subroutine on the encountered piece of ice.
data.title: Kongamato

data.text:
As an additional cost to play this event, spend [click].
Trash any number of programs and/or pieces of hardware from your grip. Search your stack for a program or piece of hardware and install it, lowering its install cost by the total install cost of the trashed cards. Shuffle your stack.
<errata>Errata from FAQ 4.2</errata>
data.title: Emergent Creativity

data.flavor: Between nothing and infinity.
data.text: The first time you make a successful run on HQ or R&D each turn, you may name a number. If you do, reveal the next card that you access this run. If it has a rez cost, play cost, or advancement requirement equal to the named number, either gain 3[credit] or draw 2 cards.
data.title: RNG Key

data.flavor: Witchcraft to the nescient; beauty to the wise.
data.text:
[subroutine] The Runner loses [click], if able. You have an additional [click] to spend during your next turn.
[subroutine] The Runner loses [click], if able. You have an additional [click] to spend during your next turn.
data.title: Nightdancer

data.flavor: "The site of the world's second beanstalk, or I'll die trying." - Mirja Byanyima, Director of VSEP
data.text: Whenever you draw a piece of ice, you may reveal it and install it protecting this server, lowering the install cost by 4[credit]. Limit 1 region per server.
data.title: Jinja City Grid

data.flavor: "Starving, dehydrated, delirious, I picked a direction and ran, ran for days, maybe even weeks. I ran until my legs couldn't carry me. Then I crawled. When I was finally out, finally free of the shroud, I checked the time, the date. How long had I been gone, trapped in the all-encompassing blackness? Turns out, 3 minutes."
data.text: [subroutine] Trash the top 3 cards of the stack. Trash Aimor.
data.title: Aimor

data.text: When Bacterial Programming is scored or stolen, you may look at the top 7 cards of R&D, add any number of them to HQ, trash any number of them, and arrange the rest in any order.
data.title: Bacterial Programming

data.flavor: "It wasn't until the spots cleared that I realized half of my rig was gone." - Kabonesa Wu
data.text:
When the Runner encounters Jua, he or she cannot install cards for the remainder of the turn.
[subroutine] Choose 2 installed Runner cards, if able. The Runner must add 1 of those cards to the top of the stack.
data.title: Jua

data.text:
Play only if the Runner trashed at least 1 Corp card during his or her last turn.
Choose an installed Runner card. The Runner must either add that card to the top of the stack or take 2 tags. Remove Threat Assessment from the game instead of trashing it.
data.title: Threat Assessment

data.flavor: He found it odd that three frozen yogurt shops, all less than a block from his, opened within the same week.
data.text:
Play only if the Runner made a successful run during his or her last turn.
The Runner loses 4[credit], if able.
data.title: Economic Warfare

data.text:
If Forced Connection is accessed from R&D, the Runner must reveal it.
When the Runner accesses Forced Connection, <trace>trace 3</trace> If successful, give the Runner 2 tags. Ignore this ability if the Runner accesses Forced Connection from Archives.
data.title: Forced Connection

data.text:
When SSL Endorsement is scored or stolen, place 9[credit] from the bank on it.
When the Corp's turn begins, he or she may take 3[credit] from SSL Endorsement. This ability is active even while SSL Endorsement is in the Runner's score area.
data.title: SSL Endorsement

data.flavor: "Who knew non-profits could be so profitable?"
data.text: NGO Front can be advanced. [trash],1 hosted advancement token: Gain 5[credit]. [trash],2 hosted advancement tokens: Gain 8[credit].
data.title: NGO Front

data.flavor: "Food. Drinks. Entertainment. It doesn't take much to gratify the bourgeoisie."
data.text: The Runner gains 2[credit]. Trash up to 2 cards from HQ, then shuffle up to 2 cards from Archives into R&D. Remove Distract the Masses from the game instead of trashing it.
data.title: Distract the Masses

data.flavor:
"Amateurs feign it as 'random packet loss'. They do this for safety. They do this out of fear. But why should we cower? We will collapse the Corporatocracy, piece by piece! They are not the ones to fear. We are."
- Freedom Khumalo
data.text:
Whenever you access cards from R&D, access 1 additional card.
Trash eXer if the Corp purges virus counters.
data.title: eXer

data.flavor:
"It makes every bad thing that you do so much better."
- g00ru
data.text: Whenever you trash a Corp card, you may place 1 virus counter on Friday Chip. When your turn begins, you may move 1 hosted virus counter to a virus program.
data.title: Friday Chip

data.flavor: The smell of rot strengthens with each step.
data.text: Whenever you make a successful run on Archives, you may place 1 virus counter on Crypt. [click], [trash], 3 hosted virus counters: Search your stack for a virus program and install it (paying its install cost), then shuffle your stack.
data.title: Crypt

data.flavor: You'd think someone would have noticed a program entitled "Career Opportunities in Hacking" earlier.
data.text: This card is not trashed until another current is played or an agenda is scored. The first time you install a card each turn, the Corp loses 1[credit].
data.title: Corporate "Grant"

data.flavor: "Go away! I'm not here!"
data.text: The first time you would take any number of tags or suffer any amount of net damage each turn, you may trash No One Home to force the Corp to "<trace>trace 0</trace> If unsuccessful, the Runner avoids any number of tags or prevents any amount of net damage."
data.title: No One Home

data.text: Make a run on a remote server. When the run ends, gain [click] and add Marathon to your grip instead of trashing it if the run was successful. You may not make another run on that server for the remainder of this turn.
data.title: Marathon

data.flavor: Ripples are all the prey sees before Gbahali swallows it whole.
data.text: [trash]: Break the last subroutine on the encountered piece of ice.
data.title: Gbahali

data.text:
Play only if you made a successful run on a central server this turn.
Force the Corp to "<trace>trace 3</trace> If unsuccessful, reveal all cards in HQ. The Runner may choose up to 2 of the revealed cards. Shuffle those cards into R&D."
data.title: White Hat

data.text:
When your turn begins, you may <trace>trace X</trace> If successful, do 1 brain damage and trash Kuwinda K4H1U3. If unsuccessful, place 1 power counter on Kuwinda K4H1U3.
X is the number of power counters on Kuwinda K4H1U3.
data.title: Kuwinda K4H1U3

data.flavor: Every level of protection for all of your security needs.
data.text: X is the number of rezzed NEXT ice. [subroutine] Draw up to X cards. [subroutine] Add up to X cards from Archives to HQ. [subroutine] Shuffle up to X cards from HQ into R&D.
data.title: NEXT Sapphire

data.text:
Whenever an encounter with Anansi ends, do 3 net damage unless the Runner broke all subroutines on it.
[subroutine] Look at the top 5 cards of R&D and arrange them in any order.
[subroutine] You may draw 1 card. The Runner may pay 2[credit] to draw 1 card.
[subroutine] Do 1 net damage.
data.title: Anansi

data.flavor: for (;;)
data.text: When the Runner passes a rezzed piece of ice protecting this server, you may trash Code Replicator to force the Runner to approach that piece of ice again.
data.title: Code Replicator

data.text:
Choose one:
  • Purge virus counters. Trash 1 card from the top of the stack for every 3 virus counters removed.
  • Gain 2[credit].
data.title: Reverse Infection

data.text: When your turn ends, you may name a card type. Gain 2[credit] the first time each turn the Runner plays or installs a card that has the type you last named this way.
data.title: Azmari EdTech: Shaping the Future

data.flavor:
Master any subject in 30 minutes or less!*
*Azmari EdTech is not responsible for altered memories or reduced temporal lobe functionality. Level of mastery may vary.
data.text: As an additional cost to steal Degree Mill, the Runner must shuffle 2 installed Runner cards into the stack.
data.title: Degree Mill

data.flavor: "Welcome to Azmari Mail! You have 4,196 unread messages."
data.text: When your turn begins, the Runner draws 1 card, then you may gain 1[credit] for every 2 cards in the grip.
data.title: Personalized Portal

data.flavor: "The way I see it, you've got two options: die here or die running. I'll enjoy both."
data.text: When you score Armed Intimidation, the Runner must either suffer 5 meat damage or take 2 tags.
data.title: Armed Intimidation

data.flavor: The only certainties.
data.text: This card is not trashed until another current is played or an agenda is stolen. Whenever the Runner installs a card or trashes an installed card, you may gain 1[credit].
data.title: Death and Taxes

data.text:
Play only if the Runner accessed at least 1 card during his or her last turn.
<trace>Trace 4</trace> If successful, trash 1 installed program with an install cost equal to or less than the amount by which your trace strength exceeded the Runner's link strength.
data.title: Trojan Horse

data.text: The install cost of each program, piece of hardware, and virtual resource is increased by 1. Whenever the Runner installs a program, piece of hardware, or virtual resource, you may gain 1[credit].
data.title: TechnoCo

data.flavor: "Ever watch a server vomit?"
data.text: Make a run on Archives. If successful, instead of accessing cards, force the Corp to choose 5 cards from Archives and add them to HQ, if able, then trash that many cards from HQ at random.
data.title: Glut Cipher

data.text: +3[mu] Use the MU on Knobkierie only for virus programs. The first time you make a successful run each turn, you may place 1 virus counter on an installed virus program. Limit 1 console per player.
data.title: Knobkierie

data.flavor: "Is there anything better than free money?"
data.text: The first time the Corp installs a card each turn, you may expose that card unless the Corp pays 1[credit].
data.title: 419: Amoral Scammer

data.flavor:
"I'm sorry, sir, we weren't expecting you! You look different than I remember..."
"Haircut."
data.text: Name a card type. Expose a card in a remote server, then gain 5[credit] if the exposed card has the named card type.
data.title: Falsified Credentials

data.text:
Place 18[credit] from the bank on Rogue Trading when it is installed. When there are no credits left on Rogue Trading, trash it.
[click], [click]: Take 6[credit] from Rogue Trading and take 1 tag.
data.title: Rogue Trading

data.flavor: At least this time around, the graphic was family-friendly.
data.text: Make a run on a remote server. If successful, instead of accessing cards, you may force the Corp to shuffle all cards in that server into R&D.
data.title: Because I Can

data.flavor: Speed gets you in, intuition gets you out.
data.text:
Place 3 power counters on Nyashia when it is installed.
Whenever you access cards from R&D, you may remove 1 hosted power counter to access 1 additional card from R&D.
data.title: Nyashia

data.flavor:
"It 'ate' the vertex grid?! What does that even mean?"
- Nkiru Qiū, Asa Group sysop
data.text:
Whenever you trash a Corp card, you may place 1 virus counter on Consume
[click]: Gain 2[credit] for each hosted virus counter, then remove all virus counters from Consume.
data.title: Consume

data.flavor: A Model G21V Tracker, Malia Z0L0K4 excels at locating assignments and subduing them.
data.text: When you rez Malia Z0L0K4, choose an installed non-virtual resource. The text box of that resource is blank.
data.title: Malia Z0L0K4

data.flavor: "Don't worry, he won't feel a thing! Probably."
data.text: If the Runner accesses an agenda from R&D, he or she must reveal it. This card is not trashed until another current is played or an agenda is stolen. Whenever an agenda is accessed or scored, trace 3 If successful, do 1 brain damage. Errata from FAQ 4.2
data.title: Kill Switch

data.text:
If Tempus is accessed from R&D, the Runner must reveal it.
When the Runner accesses Tempus, <trace>trace 3</trace> If successful, the Runner must lose [click][click] or suffer 1 brain damage. Ignore this ability if the Runner accesses Tempus from Archives.
data.title: Tempus

data.flavor: Many things go in. Nothing comes out.
data.text: Install only in a remote server. Bio Vault can be advanced. [trash], 2 hosted advancement tokens: End the run.
data.title: Bio Vault

data.text:
[subroutine] Look at the top 3 cards of R&D and either arrange them in any order or shuffle R&D. You may draw 1 card.
[subroutine] You may trash 1 card in HQ. If you do, trash 1 resource. Trash Sadaka.
data.title: Sadaka

data.flavor: "Has anyone ever actually read one of these things?" - 419
data.text:
[subroutine]End the run unless the Runner pays 1[credit].
[subroutine]End the run unless the Runner pays 1[credit].
[subroutine]End the run unless the Runner pays 1[credit].
[subroutine]End the run unless the Runner pays 1[credit].
[subroutine]End the run unless the Runner pays 1[credit].
[subroutine]End the run unless the Runner pays 1[credit].
data.title: Endless EULA

data.flavor: Your first dog, your favorite food, your own mother's name. Your love, your hate, your fear. Hopes and dreams, pain and sorrow. All of it, everything, slips away.
data.text:
[subroutine]Add an installed Runner card to the grip.
[subroutine]Add an installed Runner card to the grip.
data.title: Sandman

data.flavor: Azmari EdTech's most popular instructor, Amani Senai regularly broadcasts to millions of students.
data.text: Whenever an agenda is scored or stolen, you may <trace>trace X</trace> If successful, add an installed Runner card to the grip. X is the advancement requirement of the scored or stolen agenda.
data.title: Amani Senai

data.text: When your turn ends, you may choose a piece of ice with no advancement tokens on it. If you do, place 1 advancement token on that piece of ice for each agenda point on all installed faceup agendas.
data.title: SSO Industries: Fueling Innovation

data.text:
Install City Works Project faceup.
When the Runner accesses City Works Project while it is installed, do 2 meat damage and 1 additional meat damage for each advancement token on it.
data.title: City Works Project

data.flavor: Might given form.
data.text:
When the Runner encounters Oduduwa, place 1 advancement token on it. You may place X advancement tokens on another piece of ice. X is the number of advancement tokens on Oduduwa.
[subroutine] End the run.
[subroutine] End the run.
data.title: Oduduwa

data.flavor: She gets the job done. And then some.
data.text: When your turn begins, you may trash Rashida Jaheem to gain 3[credit] and draw 3 cards.
data.title: Rashida Jaheem

data.text: Once per turn, you may remove X virus counters from your installed cards to trash a card that you access at no cost (even if it cannot normally be trashed). X is that card's rez or play cost.
data.title: Freedom Khumalo: Crypto-Anarchist

data.flavor: Twisting, writhing, ripping into all that it touches.
data.text:
Install Trypano only on a piece of ice.
When Trypano has 5 or more virus counters on it, trash host ice.
When your turn begins, you may place 1 virus counter on Trypano.
data.title: Trypano

data.flavor: "What kind of maniac infects their own rig?!"
data.text: Place 3 virus counters on an installed Runner card with no hosted virus counters.
data.title: Contaminate

data.text: Make a run on HQ. If successful, instead of accessing cards, name asset, ice, operation or upgrade, then reveal 2 cards from HQ at random. Trash each revealed card that has the named type, then gain 4[credit] for each card trashed this way.
data.title: Embezzle

data.flavor: Filaments occasionally flare from the Network, manifesting ephemeral threads between random domains.
data.text: Whenever you pass a rezzed piece of ice, you may trash Slipstream. If you do, choose a piece of ice protecting a central server in the same position as the passed ice. You are now approaching that ice.
data.title: Slipstream

data.text: When you encounter a piece of ice, you may pay 2[credit] to have it gain barrier until the end of the encounter. Use this ability only once per turn. 2[credit]: break any number of barrier subroutines. 3[credit]: +6 strength.
data.title: Laamb

data.flavor: Go for distance.
data.text: [click]: Host Gebrselassie on an installed non-AI icebreaker. Host icebreaker returns to its base strength at the end of each turn rather than each encounter.
data.title: Gebrselassie

data.text: Make a run. The first time you encounter a piece of ice during this run, you may search your stack or heap for a program and install it, ignoring all costs. When the run ends, add that program to the bottom of your stack if it is still installed.
data.title: Compile

data.flavor: "Could God create a stone so heavy, He could not lift it?"
data.text: [trash]: Bypass a piece of ice you are currently encountering. Lose any remaining clicks.
data.title: Logic Bomb

data.flavor: "Jackpot!"
data.text:
When your turn begins, you may place 1[credit] on Jackpot!.
Whenever an agenda is added to your score area, you may take any number of credits from Jackpot!. If you do, trash Jackpot!.
data.title: Jackpot!

data.text: When you score Remote Enforcement, you may search R&D for a piece of ice, install it protecting a remote server (paying its install cost), and rez it, ignoring its rez cost, then shuffle R&D.
data.title: Remote Enforcement

data.text:
The Runner can spend [click] to break any subroutine on Kamali 1.0.
[subroutine] Do 1 brain damage unless the Runner trashes an installed resource.
[subroutine] Do 1 brain damage unless the Runner trashes an installed piece of hardware.
[subroutine] Do 1 brain damage unless the Runner trashes an installed program.
data.title: Kamali 1.0

data.flavor: "It's neither cruel nor unusual. Merely efficient."
data.text: Each piece of rezzed bioroid ice gains "[subroutine] The Runner loses [click], if able." before all of its other subroutines.
data.title: Warden Fatuma

data.flavor: Quicker and deadlier than ever imagined, the trial was an outstanding success.
data.text: When the turn on which you scored Viral Weaponization ends, do 1 net damage for each card in the grip.
data.title: Viral Weaponization

data.flavor: "On one hand, I knew I shouldn't touch it. On the other, it was really shiny." - Kabonesa Wu
data.text:
[subroutine] Do 1 net damage.
[subroutine] End the run.
data.title: Envelope

data.text: Install only in the root of HQ or R&D. Whenever the Runner accesses cards from this server, he or she accesses 3 additional cards. After accessing, gain 2[credit] for each card accessed. This applies even during the run on which the Runner trashes Mwanza City Grid. Limit 1 region per server.
data.title: Mwanza City Grid

data.text:
Play only if the Runner made a successful run on his or her last turn.
Name a card type, then reveal the grip. Gain 2[credit] for each card in the grip that has the named type.
data.title: Standard Procedure

data.text: If Intake is accessed from R&D, the Runner must reveal it. When the Runner accesses Intake, trace 4 If successful, add an installed program or virtual resource to the grip. Ignore this ability if the Runner accesses Intake from Archives.
data.title: Intake

data.flavor: No matter which direcion ze climbed, the blocks reshuffled, zipping in from left to right, bottom to top. It was going to be a long hike.
data.text:
Masvingo can be advanced.
When you rez Masvingo, place 1 advancement token on it.
Masvingo gains "[subroutine] End the run." for each advancement token on it.
data.title: Masvingo

data.flavor: The blast doesn't hurt, but what comes after does.
data.text: Whenever the Runner trashes a card in this server, you may pay 1[credit] to give the Runner 1 tag. This applies even during the run on which the Runner trashes Overseer Matrix.
data.title: Overseer Matrix

data.flavor: Eat. Code. Sleep. Eat. Code. Sleep. Eat. Code. Eat. Code. Sleep. Eat. Code. Code. Sleep. Code. Code. Code. Eat. Code. Code. Code. Code. Code. Code.
data.text: [click], suffer 1 net damage: Gain 1[credit] and draw 2 cards. Use this ability only once per turn.
data.title: Zer0
